loans.name: Kablan

texts.ar: قبلان عمره 55 سنة متزوج وله 2 اولاد يعمل في حفر وبيع لوازم الآبار الصناعية له في عمله 18 سنة يتميز بالدقة في العمل وايضا بالانفراد في هذه المصلحة في منطقته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة واكسسوارات  كان يواجه صعوبات في عدم معرفة الناس به والصعوبات المادية ايضا لكنه يحلم دائما في تحسين وضع الزراعة والعمل في ضيعته وتقوية عمله
texts.en: Kablan is 55 years old and married with two children. He works in well-digging and sells well supplies. He has 18 years experience in this. He is distinguished with attention to detail and his business is unique in his locality. With this loan he wants to purchase new equipment and accessories to sell. He struggles with lack of financiA. capitA., and also the fact that not many people know about his business. However, he dreams of improving his position within the agriculturA. sector and of strengthening his business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ibad

texts.ru:
Ibad K. 44 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Lachin regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ibad jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Dvoye iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje. 
Ibad uje 11 let kak rabotayet masnikom. Etomu biznessu yeqo nauchil otec kotoriy toje bil masnikom, eto professia u nix idet po rodu , dedushka Ibada toje bil masnikom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit maso dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Ibad K. is 44 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Lachin region who now lives in Baku with his family. Ibad is married with three children.  Two of his children go to college.  Ibad has been a butcher for eleven years.  He started this business with his father who was also a butcher.  This profession runs in the family; his grandfather was also a butcher.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy meat for resale to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en:
Abdusalom is a responsible husband and a loving father of four children. He is engaged in the production of dried fruit. Abdusalom buys the fruit from a market area and sells in a local market as a wholesaler. He has been in this business for 10 years. He started his business with a small amount of fruit. Today, he has extensive experience.

 Abdusalom would like to get a loan of 6000 Somoni to expand his business. He wants to grow his business and promises to repay the current loan without any violations and thanks all lenders for their support.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried fruit.

loans.name: Hilton

texts.en:
Hilton T. T. is a 23-year-old single man from the Vikwatani area. He owns a retail shop and has been in this business for the last two years getting good profits.  

This marks Hilton’s first loan from KADET after he recently joined another group. He plans to use the loan  to purchase sugar, tea leaves and soft drinks to resell. He anticipates reinvesting his profits into the repayment of the loan and expansion of the business.

His dream is to own a bigger shop and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves and soft drinks

loans.name: Kibwana

texts.en:
Kibwana M. M. is a 29-year-old man from the Majaoni area. He is married to Halima Twaha. He has been a charcoal dealer for the last year. 

This marks Kibwana’s first loan from KADET.  He plans to purchase paraffin and sacks of charcoal to add to his business stock. He anticipates redirecting the profits from this loan into expanding his business.  Kibwana's dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase paraffin and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 36 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل سائق فان له في عمله 13 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يطور عمله ومدخوله يحب العائلة ويريد تأمين حياة كريمة لهم يسعى دائما الى تطوير العمل يريد خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة الفان خاصته حتى يتمكن من مواكبة العمل في فصل الصيف حيث يزيد عدد الزبائن خاصة من السواح لا توجد لديه صعوبات في العمل حيث انه معروف في محيطه ولكن هناك صعوبة مادية لتطوير الفان حتى يستوعب عدد اكبر من الزبائن واماكن ابعد في النقل
texts.en: Mohamed is 36 years old, married and has one child. He works as a van driver and has been doing this for 13 years. He loves his work and wants to develop it and increase his income. He loves his family and would like to secure a comfortable future for them. With this loan he wants to perform maintenance work on his van in preparation for the busy summer season when demand increases, especially from tourists. His business faces no difficulties as he is well known in his locality, but he suffers from lack of financial capital to maintain his van so that he can accommodate a greater number of customers and travel further distances.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his van in preparation for summer so that more customers can be accommodated.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with two children, both of whom are married. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam has been operating a retail shop business for the past five years, selling to her neighbours and friends. Her major challenge in the business is theft because of insecurity in the area. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase six bundles of wheat flour, sacks of tomatoes and fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase wheat flour, tomatoes and fish to resell

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is 32 years old and a married man. He is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for more than 10 years. He usually earns about 4000 PHP per month from farming.

Ireneo needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. He requested a loan so he could buy these. Ireneo works hard to build his business. He wants to provide a better shelter and improved living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Sylvia has a beauty salon, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more oil and braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to become a doctor after completing her studies.   

Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to learn how to read and write.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Mwingo

texts.en:
Mwingo K. is a 25-year-old single man. He runs a grocery shop in Mkoroshoni and has been in this business for the past year. 

Mwingo's business is doing well and this will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase cereals, cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of potatoes, which he will add into his current business stock. He hopes to direct the anticipated profits into the expansion of his business.

His dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: purchase cereals, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes to sell in his grocery store

loans.name: Tarek

texts.ar: طارق عمره 23 سنة اعزب يعمل في الحدادة الفرنجية فرفورجيه له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله ويطوره دائما يريد من خلال دعم مصلحته زيادة مدخوله وتأمين مستقبل جيد وبناء عائلة يطمح في تحقيق ذاته وزيادة مدخوله من خلال تطوير عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة وتقوية المصلحة له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يعاني من صعوبة في المنافسة لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة له خبرة كبيرة في عمله ويتميز بالجودة في العمل والمصداقية
texts.en: Tarek is 23 years old and unmarried. He works as a blacksmith and has been been doing this for 5 years. He loves his work and is always seeking to develop it. With investment into his business he would like to increase his income and settle down with his own family in the future. With this loan he wants to purchase new equipment and strengthen his business. He has many local customers but suffers from competition and lack of financial capital is holding him back. He has vast experience and is distinguished for his high quality and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and strengthen his business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rehema has a small retail shop, which she has had for four years.  She also has a second business selling tap water.  

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as rice for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees.  In the future, Rehema hopes to own a restaurant.  

Rehema is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to improve her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as rice for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth J. is 25 years old.  She is married to Isaac Kering, who is a business man.  They are blessed with two children aged 2 and 5 years old.  

Ruth does dairy farming.  She supplies milk to the hotels in the Itigo trading centre and to her neighbors. She has been in this business for 2 years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 6500.

Ruth has borrowed loan of Ksh 30,000 from KADET LTD.   This her first loan and she wishes to use the money to purchase a dairy cow.  The profits will be used to improve the welfare of her family and for savings.   Her dreams are to ensure that her family is financially stable and also to own a car.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 46 years, married and has six children. Her oldest child is 27 years old and her youngest is 6. She makes a living as a farmer, helping her husband grow rice and corn. The couple works hard to raise a good crop and has been farming for 20 years. Josie has applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and her goal is to raise a very large crop this year. Her main hope in life is to give her children the brightest possible futures.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dried and smoked fish, fabric, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 30 years old.  She is married to Joshua Tumpes, aged 32 years, who is a farmer.  Together they have two children -- Vivian, aged 16,  and Melvin, aged 10.

Caroline runs a hotel which has been running for a period of 6 years.  It is located near their residential area, a busy remote area where most of her clients are females. Caroline’s business gives her a monthly profit of Kshs 4,000.

Caroline was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. This loan of Kshs 16,000 is her first loan with KADET LTD and she intends to use it to purchase food for the hotel. If the loan boosts her business, she plans to continue supporting her family and getting their necessary basic needs addressed. 

Caroline dreams of opening a guest house. Caroline describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase food for her hotel

loans.name: Kakin

texts.en:
Kakin A. is 54, widowed, and has five children.  She has been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating since 1994. Her elder son Abylgazy is her main helper, who in spite of his disability, makes every effort to provide his family with all they need. 

Kakin and her son cultivate beans and potatoes and also run a farm with one milk cow and twenty sheep. These activities allow them to earn about 6,500 KGS a month.  Kakin plans to use her loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase milk cows, which will allow her to increase her milk and meat sales. With the revenues, she plans to help her son build a barn for the cattle and to reconstruct her house. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to expand her farm

loans.name: Khalil

texts.ar: خليل في عمر 26 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في نقل البحص والرمل وغيره له في عمله 4 سنوات يعمل بجد ونشاط متطور مجتهد ومجد في العمل يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله ويطور نفسه وعائلته يتميز بالمعاملة الحسنة والجدية في العمل يعاني من صعوبة مادية في زيادة مدخوله له معارف وزبائن من محيطه كونه يسكن في منطقة عمارية والمنطقة هي بحاجة الى عمله بشكل جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب لنقل الرمل والبحص لحسابه الخاص
texts.en: Khalil is 26 years old and married with a child. He works transporting sand and gravel and has 4 years experience in this. He works hard and with enthusiasm, and is innovative and up to date in what he does. He would like to increase his income and seeks progress for himself and his family. He is distinguished with his good customer service skills and hard work but he suffers from lack of financiA. capitA.. He is well known in his locality and has many customers since he lives in a residentiA. area where there is a high demand for his services. With this loan he wants to purchase a new pick up truck for transporting sand and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase a new pick up truck for transporting sand and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne M. K. is a woman of thirty-four years, married to Newton Nyongesa and the mother of three beautiful children. She lives in Kitale town where she runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of about $356.

This will be Everlyne's 1st loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan amount to add stock to her retail shop, like more sugar, rice, baking flour, etc. With the income she will get, she plans to pay school fees for her children. 

In future, Everlyne wants to educate her children to the highest level and also expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Ivon

texts.en:
Ivon K. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Ivon has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Ivon has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase for another business of selling sand soil for building houses for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ivon hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Ivon hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase for another business of selling sand.

loans.name: Harris

texts.en:
Harris D. S. T. is 33 years old, married and a father of four children. They live in Endebess in the outskirts of Kitale town. He does horticulture farming and is also in the transportation business in the same area. Harris has been in this business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of about $950.

This will be Harris' first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to repair his vehicle so that he can offer better services to his customers. He will also buy pesticides and insecticides for use on his farm. 

In future he hopes to save and buy another piece of land where he can expand his horticulture business.

loans.use: to repair his motor vehicle, and to buy pesticides and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.ar: اشرف عمره 24 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع الأدوات المنزلية له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله وله تاريخ جيد فيه له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمصلحة وتقوية العمل له تاريخ جيد في عمله وهو يطور نفسه يعاني من صعوبة في المنافسة لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة يحلم بأن يمتلك محل اكبر وان يصبح صاحب مؤسسة وان يؤمن مستقبل جيد
texts.en: Ashraf is 24 years old and unmarried. He works in the business of selling household goods. He loves his business, which has a good reputation. He has customers from amongst his neighbours and locA. residents. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock for his store and thereby strengthen his business. He faces a lot of competition and what is holding him back is lack of financiA. capitA.. He dreams of owning a bigger store and securing a good future for himself.

loans.use: to purchase new stock for his store and strengthen his business against competition.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Sylvia has a cosmetics shop that sells lotions for the skin, which she has had for five years.  She also has a beauty salon.  

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics, body lotions, and braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to become a popular business woman.  

Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more new games.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, body lotions, and braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Ruth has a business selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take better care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to open up a retail shop.   

Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning more on how to protect herself from diseases like HIV/AIDS.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ramula

texts.en: Ramula G. is a widow with seven adult children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past five years, she has operated a food stall selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Ramula faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During dry hot season, the demand for products is high compared to rainy cold season where demand is low. She dreams of expanding her business and selling wholesale.  Ramula is requesting a loan for 25,000 KES, which she will use to buy sugar, coffee, and fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase one  sugar, coffee and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal for retailers

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty is 45 years old, married and has three children, the oldest of which is 18. She makes a living as a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato, growing rice that she sells to people in her community. She works hard because she is committed to provide her each of her children with a good education and a bright future. She has applied for this loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nambale Mixed Group-Mityana

texts.en: Laurencia M. is 43 years old and makes a living selling food from a stand in a business center in the Mityana district of her town. Mostly she sells bananas, cassavas and sweet potatoes. She went into this line of business 12 years ago after being persuaded by a friend to open her stand. Before that, she was a full-time mother who was raising nine cheerful children. She used to work occasionally as a farmer but is doing better in her new field because of her diligence and careful planning. She earns about 20,000 shillings a week as profit and will use her portion of this group loan to buy more food to sell, including beans, rice, maize flour and peas.

loans.use: to buy food items such as rice, beans and maize flour to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, where he makes a living as a rice farmer. He is married and has seven children, the oldest of which is 33. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and works very hard because he is his family's sole source of income. He has applied for this loan to increase his farm's output by buying more fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Betty has a business selling vegetables and fruit, which she has had for two years.  She also has a second business of selling soft drinks.  

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more vegetables, fruits and sodas for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and pay her rent.  In the future, Betty hopes to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, fruit and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is a mother of seven children who are between the ages of 11 and 30 years old. She herself is 49 years old. She is a widow and she is very hardworking. She owns a store in which she sells foodstuffs and she has been selling foodstuffs for seven years.She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs for her business. With any extra profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Mehsen

texts.ar: محسن في عمر 47 سنة متزوج وله 6 اولاد يعمل في بيع الأدوات المنزلية له في عمله 25 سنة يحب عمله ويتميز به له زبائن يقصدونه من عدة مناطق مجاورة لتميزه بالجودة والمصداقية في التعامل يحب عائلته ويسعى الى تأمين مستلزماتهم بشكل جيد فلعائلته فضل في تحسين وضع محله حيث قدموا له الدعم الكامل يعاني من صعوبة في المنافسة حيث تنقصه المادة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة + مساعدة الأبنة في تسديد بعض الدين لديها فهو اب عطوف ويسعى الى مساعدة اولاده بما يمتلك من امكانات
texts.en: Mehsen is 47 years old and married with six children. He works in the business of selling household appliances and has 25 years experience in this. He loves his business and has many customers from different neighbouring districts that recognise the quality and credibility of his goods and services. He loves his family and seeks to fulfill all of their needs. It is due to their full support that his business is where it is today. He suffers from competition and lack of financial capital. With this loan he wants to purchase new goods for his store. He would also like to help his son pay off some debts as he is a caring father who wants to assist his children by any means possible.

loans.use: to purchase new stock for his store.

loans.name: Tabitsa

texts.en:
Tabitsa N. B. is a woman of fifty years, married to B. Mzee Lisanza, and together they have seven children. She runs a grocery store in Kitale at a place called Nairobi ndogo, and she has been in this business for eleven years, getting a monthly income of about $96.

This will be Tabitsa's 2nd loan with KADET LTD after she repaid the first loan successfully. With the loan, she plans to add more stock to her business with items like onions, cabbages, green vegetables and so on. With the anticipated extra income she gets, she plans to pay school fees for her children. 

In future, Tabitsa wants to expand her business and also educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees and buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 56 years old and has 4 children who are between the ages of 16-21 years old. She sells goats and she has sold them for 19 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more goats and make more profits. With the profits she plans reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 34 years old, married to Elisha S. who is a farmer, and they are blessed with three children aged 10, 6 and 4 years old.  Dorcas sells secondhand clothes in Itigo market and has been in the business for a period of four years, getting a monthly income of about $63.

Dorcas has borrowed a loan from KADET LTD of 10,000 KES, this being her 1st loan. She wishes to use the money to purchase one bale of used clothes to add to her current stock. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase more stock for the business and to educate her children.

Her hope is to see her business grow and to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen V. trades in computers from a big rented shop. 

Karen purchases the computers from various sources to be able to meet the diverse suburban demand. 

Currently he is planning to enlarge the assortment in order to attract more customers. This loan will help Karen to pay for the computers.

Karen is the only breadwinner in his family. Karen’s wife looks after their two children.

loans.use: to buy computers for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 30 years old, married to Sheila M., a business lady, and they have two children aged six years and two years old.  For the past 10 years, James has been growing passion fruit on his farm in Kabirirsang;Kapsabet,and earns a monthly income of Ksh 10,600 from sales.

James has applied for a loan of Ksh 60,000 from KADET LTD for his second loan after having repaid his previous one. He will use this money to pay for the passion fruit seedlings.  


The subsequent profits will be used to extend the farm and plant more passion fruit. His dream is become a major supplier of passion fruits in the market.

loans.use: to pay for passion fruit seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the vegetables and fruits she ordered from the farmers

loans.name: Lungutsa

texts.en: Lungutsa M. is a single man who lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food and rent.  For the past year, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling in a shop to his community. Lungutsa also operates a farming business, which contributes to his livelihood. Lungutsa faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding and establishing other charcoal selling shops in the future. Lungutsa is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Lungutsa decided to work with Yehu Microfinance because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 56 years old. She has 4 children who are between the ages of 11-21 years old.

She has had a business selling a type of fabric called kitenge for seven years, which has helped her feed her family and meet their needs. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fabric in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sale

loans.name: Jemutai

texts.en:
W., 22 years old, is married to Wilson Ruto, a 30-year-old farmer, and they are blessed with two children aged four and two years old. W. has run a retail shop in the Kimaam trading centre for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 5,500.

W.'s loan from KADET LTD., her first, will be used to purchase dry maize, salt, tea leaves, soap and sugar for her shop. She intends to use the additional profits to educate her children and also improve the stock in the shop. W. hopes to eventially own a large and well-stocked shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Assia

texts.en: Asia is 46 years old and has eight children who range in age from 8 to 23. For the last three years, she has made a living by running a beauty salon. Asia is applying for this loan to buy more supplies for her shop. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Kotiyeie  Sankale

texts.en:
Kotiyeie Sankale R. is 66 years old and married to Sanka who is a farmer, and together they have three children: Ketere 20 years, Silita 18 years, and Morijoi 15 years. She sells green vegetables to her clients.The business is located in Olekuitoriori in Kitengela town, which is a remote but busy area.  Most of her clients are men. She has been running this business for two years and earns a monthly profit of KES. 500.


Kotiyeie was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office. This loan of Kshs 11, 000 is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more vegetables for her business. 

 

Kotiyeie plans to open another shop in Kajiado if this loan improves her business. She hopes to own a wholesale shop and she describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Lumière Plus Group

texts.en:
Makita chairs a loan group called Lumière Plus, which is made up of 14 entrepreneurs who have joined hands to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. Each member of this group is committed to develop and expand a small business. 

Makita has been in business for many years and today owns and runs a drugstore. She is 40 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 3 to 13. Her two older children are enrolled in school. Makita earns a profit of about $70 a week, and has done a very good job of using loans from IMF HOPE RDC to expand her business and increase her income. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to buy more medicine to sell to her customers. Makita’s dream is to someday open a clinic in the same area as her store, northeastern Kinshasa.

loans.use: to expand 14 small businesses

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, 33, is married to Eunice and they have three children: Simantoi aged five years, Nasiaulet aged three years and Goodluck aged two years. Andrew has run a shop located at the busy Olekaitoirori market for the past year, earning a monthly profit of Kshs 14, 200.

Andrew was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office, and this loan of Kshs.20,000 is his first loan with KADET. He plans to use it to purchase stocks of flour, sugar, cooking oil and tea leaves for his shop. If the loan boosts his business he plans to open another shop in Kajiado.

Describing himself as hardworking, Andrew hopes to eventually establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of flour, sugar, cooking oil and tea leaves for his shop.

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en: Liberatha is 53 years old and a mother of 4 children who are between the ages of 13 to 30. Liberata makes and sells a banana juice called ‘Imitobe’; she is requesting a loan to invest in this juice business.

loans.use: to buy bananas for their juice

loans.name: Kinoni Twimuke Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
A. Dominic is the leader of "Kinoni Twimuke Tukore" group in Ntungamo. He is 45 years old and married with six children aged 2 - 17 years. He is in the business of goat-selling and crop production growing crops like beans, "matooke" (green bananas), millet, and so on, plus the goats. He employs two labourers on his farm in Kahama and Kinoni. 

From farming, he is able to make 120,000/= monthly while 100,000/= is what he makes from goat sales weekly. He also performs other Local Council duties since he is the Local Council Chairperson in his area. He has been in the business for eight years and hard work and being sociable have enabled him to succeed. In future, he hopes to venture into the selling cows.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, aged 36 years, is married to Victoria Mwelu and together, they have three children: Judy, aged 6 years, Kelvin, aged 4 years and Peter, aged 1 year. Martin runs a quarry project located at Lukenya quarry site where he sells stones to clients from Athi River, Kitengela and Nairobi. Martin’s business of 12 years gives him a monthly profit of KES 23, 000.

He was introduced to KADET by another customer and he has applied for his first loan which he intends to use to purchase another quarry space. If the loan boosts his business, Martin plans to purchase a lorry for transporting stones.

Martin hopes to have a big quarry and Lorries for transporting stones to his customers. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase another quarry space.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 28 years, is married to Margret M., aged 25 years, who is a farmer. Together have one child, Denya, aged 10 years. David is a livestock trader and his business is located at Bissil market, a busy market, where he sells livestock to the butcher men from Kajiado, Kitengela and Nairobi. David has been operating his business for a year and it gives him a monthly profits of KES 17, 000.

He was introduced to KADET by another customer. This loan of KES 30,000 is his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it to purchase more livestock to sell. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to start dairy farming.

David hopes to be supplying livestock and milk to both Kenya meat commission and Kenya cooperative creameries. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 56 years old. She has two children with ages 22 and 24 years. She sells charcoal on a wholesale scale. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and pay her house rent. With the profits she plans to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale and pay her house rent.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N., aged 24 years, is married to Joseph Kirusuah Swakei, aged 35 years, who is a driver. Together, they have two children: Geoffrey, aged 8 years and Regina, aged 3 years. Jane runs a salon and barber shop business located at Olekaitoriori trading centre. Her business of 3 years gives her a monthly profit of KES 6,000.

She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office. This loan of KES 11,000 is her first loan with KADET and she plans to use it to purchase the seats for her salon and barber shop. She anticipates profits after the loan boost and she plans to pay the school fees of her children with it. 

Jane dreams of opening a hairdressing school. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase the seats for her salon and barber shop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 26 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 1 year and 8 years old. She owns a shop in which she sells rice, soap, flour, etc. She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business while with the profits she plans to put aside some savings

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, flour, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr: Jean Marie Vianney N. est chauffeur, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il est célibataire, ne a Rwanda, et il a 4 enfants entre 3 ans et 15 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont a l’école, et Jean Marie a fini ses études jusqu’au niveau A3.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une vache, alors il peut avoir du lait pour ses enfants, et aussi vendre du lait.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’acheter une autre vache après avoir vendre du lait produit par la première vache qu’il va acheter.  Il voudrait avoir une ferme, et pour la vie, il voudrait occuper sa famille, construire une maison pour eux, et aussi éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney N., a driver, has been a client of ACB since 2008. Born in Rwanda, he is single with four children ranging in age from 3 to 15 years old. Three of his children go to school. Jean Marie completed his own studies at the A3 level. 

He will use his loan to buy a cow, which will provide milk for his children and also for sale. His business growth strategy is to buy another cow after selling the milk produced by the first cow. He would like to own a farm, and in the future, he would also like to build a house for his family and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sofia Mercedes

texts.es: Sofía Mercedes tiene 58 años, su negocio es alquiler de sillas. Hace más de 9 años que tiene ese medio de vida.  Ella vive en casa propia en donde la mayoría de sus clientes ya conocen la atención que brinda, pues se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues llegan a realiza el alquiler para diferentes eventos como graduación, velas, piñatas, bodas entre otros. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día más y brindar un mejor medio de vida. Este financiamiento es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de sillas plásticas.
texts.en: Sofia Mercedes is 58 years old and she has a chair rental business. She has had this business for more than 9 years. She lives a house that is her own and the majority of her clients know the type of service that she provides. She is very happy with her business. She works every day from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. She has rental contracts for all types of events, such as graduations, funerals, piñata parties, weddings, and others. She dreams of improving her earnings every day to have a better quality of life. This loan will be used to purchase a large number of plastic chairs.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of plastic chairs

loans.name: Saida Del Carmen

texts.es: Saida Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos se siente muy contenta ya que han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios, con el propósito de apoyar a su compañero de vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de su medio de vida pues la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes y adolecentes. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsos, ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado, sabanas, prendas entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en: Saida Del Carmen works selling general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 7 years. This is not the first time she has received financing, and she feels very pleased that they have been of such great help to her business. She started this business with her own money, with the intention of helping her life partner. She is a very hardworking person and enjoys her way of life since the majority of her customers are young adolescents. She is requesting this loan to purchase purses, clothing, cosmetics, footwear, linens, and undergarments among other necessary products.

loans.use: to purchase purses, clothing, cosmetics, footwear, linens, and undergarments

loans.name: Tweyambe Women's Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
B. Matia, aged 37, the leader of "T. Women's Group" of Ibanda, is a married man with six children. He operates a retail shop in Kyarutanga trading centre that sells general merchandise. 

His previous loans have helped in increasing the stock in his shop and this is the same reason he has applied for a new loan. And in future, he hopes to turn his shop into wholesale sales. This will help him earn more revenue and cover his daily-living needs.

He is also a farmer growing various food crops for sale and this contributes to his income.

loans.use: to restock his retail shop with more general merchandise.

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Después de trabajar durante varios años vendiendo mercancía, hace un año, Gladys Elena J. R. decidió ubicarse en un local con el fin de incrementar sus ventas, mejorando así su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Actualmente Gladys quien vive en Rionegro Antioquia, necesita de un préstamo para comparar mercancía y así ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos; en el futuro Gladys espera que su almacén tenga un gran reconocimiento.
texts.en:
A year ago, after working for several years selling merchandise, Gladys Elena J. R. decided to set herself up in a shop with the goal of increasing her sales and thereby bettering the quality of life for herself and her family. 

Today Gladys, who lives in Rionegro Antioquia, needs a loan to purchase merchandise and thereby expand her business and increase her income. In the future Gladys hopes that her store may be widely known.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: Javier de Jesús tiene más de 10 años en su negocio, por lo que se siente muy independiente al obtener este medio de ingreso. Su negocio es la venta de medicamentos, pues tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes pedidos de medicamentos, el vive en el municipio de dolores en donde la mayoría de sus clientes saben que el precio de sus medicamentos son muy favorables. Con este crédito el comprara vitaminas, suplementos, pastillas, pomadas, entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Javier de Jesús has spent more than 10 years in his business, so he feels very independent having this source of income. His business is selling natural medicines. He has a wide variety of customers who place orders for different medicines. He lives in Dolores municipality where the majority of his customers know that his prices are very good. With this loan he will purchase vitamins, supplements, pills, creams, and other products they request from him.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, supplements, pills, creams, and other products

loans.name: Augustin

texts.fr: Augustin B. est menuisesien, il est client d’ACB depuis 2009. Il est marie et a 7 enfants entre 24 et 3 ans, 4 de ses enfants vont à l’école, il est ne en République Démocratique du Congo. So niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de l’école primaire. Le prêt qu’il a demande c’est pour acheter les arbres, les clous, tôles, pour la réhabilitation de sa maison, sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bâtir la meilleure maison pour éviter tous risques de destruction. Pour la famille est de  construire une maison d’habitation bien équipé, sa vision est de construire beaucoup des maisons pour la location.
texts.en:
Augustin B. is a carpenter, he has been a client of ACB since 2009. Born in the Democratic Republic of Congo, he is married and has 7 children aged between 3 and 24. 4 of the children are in school. Augustin attended school up to the 4th year of elementary school.

He is asking for a loan to buy trees, nails, and sheet metal to remodel his house. His plan for business growth is to build the best possible house to avoid risk of destruction. For the family, his plan is to build a well-equipped home, and his vision is to build many houses to rent out.

loans.use: to buy trees, nails and sheet metal for home building

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: Brenda Maria se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio. En donde la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante. Ella es muy conocida en el lugar pues sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan y son recibidos con gran amabilidad, es por eso que Brenda ha solicitado un crédito para aumentar su inventario como bolsos, ropa en general, ropa interior, cosméticos, calzado, sabanas, toallas. Ella tiene confianza que así lograra tener una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro seguro para su familia.   Su sueño es capitalizar su negocio y aumentar cada di mas su inventario.
texts.en:
Brenda sells general merchandise. She has dedicated more than 31 years to her business, which she conducts on the streets. Brenda is very well known in her location; customers prefer her because she always has what they need and they are received with great friendliness.

For that reason, Brenda has requested a loan to increase her inventory in bags, general clothing, underwear, cosmetics, shoes, sheets, and towels.  She has confidence that in this manner she can acquire a better quality of life and a more secure future for her family.

Her dream is to better capitalize her business and increase her inventory more each day.

loans.use: TO BUY PURSES, CLOTHING IN GENERAL, UNDERWEAR, COSMETICS, SHOES, SHEETS, AND TOWELS TO SELL

loans.name: Suliaman

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Sulaiman.  He is single and has no children. He has one dependent, his mother. 

In 2006, Suliaman established his electronic appliances business. He began his business because of the admiration he has for his father, who is a very successful businessman in the community. "I learnt business from my father," said Sulaiman. 

Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.   He needs a loan of Le 4,000,000. 

Sulaiman requires a loan in order to purchase laptop DVD players, DVD players, DVDs, and televisions for his business. In the future, Sulaiman plans to develop it further so that he can become more successful and popular than his father, build a house, get married and have children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy DVDs, DVD cleaner, televisions, laptop DVD players, etc.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose C. V. es vecino de Pérez Zeledón. El se dedica al engorde de cerdos desde hace poco tiempo.
Gracias a  a la idea de uno de sus amigos, don Jose será parte de un proyecto en su pueblo con el que formaran la porqueriza más grande de  la comunidad. Para ello el necesita un préstamo de  ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para pagar la mano de obra y parte del material necesario para construir la porqueriza.
El es  socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose C. V. lives in Pérez Zeledón and raises pigs.  He has only been in the business for a short period of time.

Thanks to a friend who came up with the idea, Jose will be part of a project in his village to set up the largest pig farm in the community.  He needs a loan of 594,000 CRC to pay for labor costs and part of the construction material for the pig pen.

He is a member of the "Productores El General" Association, one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Otto

texts.es:
Otto G. N.  es vecino de Pérez  Zeledón y tiene mucha  experiencia en el negocio de los cerdos. 
El es parte de una sociedad de amigos que van a construir la porqueriza más grande de la comunidad de El General.  Por eso el necesita un préstamo de 594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones)  para aportar para la compra de materiales y mano de obra necesaria para construir la porqueriza.  
El es  socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Otto G. N. lives in Pérez Zeledón and has a lot of experience in the pig-raising business.

He is one of a group of friends who are going to build the largest pig farm in the community. He needs a loan of 594,000 CRC to pay for construction materials and necessary labor costs to build the pig pen.

He is a member of the "Productores El General" Association, one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Don Walter se dedica al engorde de cerdos desde hace varios meses  en Pérez Zeledón  de San Jose.
Este negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante  a su familia, y él desea que su negocio crezca, es por eso  que él está solicitando un préstamo de  594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de materiales de construcción. Su meta es agrandar sus instalaciones para tener una mayor producción. 
El es  socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
For several months Mr. Walter has been raising pigs in Pérez Zeledón in San Jose.

This business has allowed him to provide an income for his family.  Since he wants to increase his activity he is requesting a loan in the amount of 594,000 CRC to buy construction materials.  His goal is to expand his facility in order to increase production.

He is a member of the "Productores El General" Association, one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy painting utensils

loans.name: Mary Jean's Group

texts.en:
Mary Jean V. lives in the village of Luttuad Diffun Quirino. She is 28 years old and leads a seven-person loan group affiliated with ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Jean is married, has one school-aged child and makes a living by selling mobile phone cards. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mary Jean joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from ASKI and will use her portion of this new one to buy more phone cards to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and women and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses

loans.name: Bosque De Las Flores Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es BOSQUES DE LAS FLORES,  ya que sus integrantes  pertenecen a dos comunidades: Bosques de San Sebastian y Valle de las Flores, y al unirse como grupo fusionaron sus nombres, este grupo se localiza en Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la segunda vez que piden un prestamo. La señora DIANA T. T., es la Tesorera del grupo, estudio unicamente la preparatoria y es casada. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos. La señora es reconocida por sus compañeras por una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad, el prestamo lo requiere para invertir más en su negocio y comprar por mayoreo ya que le hacen muchos pedidos y aveces no le alcanza para cumplir con todos los clientes a tiempo, quiere obtener mayor ganacia y hacer crecer su negocio con el fin de que más adelante pueda ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Bosques de las Flores' because its members live in two communities: Bosques de San Sebastian and Valle de las Flores.  When they joined together as a group they also joined their names.  The group is located in Puebla, Mexico.  

This group has ten members and this is the second time that they have requested a loan.  Diana T. T. is the group's treasurer.  She has an elementary school level of education and is married.  Diana's business is selling shoes.  She is known by her fellow group members as being a responsible person who has managed to get ahead when faced with setbacks.  She needs this loan to further invest in her business and buy products wholesale since people are placing a lot of orders with her and sometimes she doesn't have enough to satisfy all her customers on time.  She would like to make more profits and grow her business so that, in the future, she can offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her footwear business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy appliances for her restaurant

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: Rolando José de 28 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio con el servicio de taxi y molino, en este tiempo adquirió mucha experiencia y esto posibilito a seguir adelante con su negocio, el se levanta todos los días a trabajar desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que es as esa hora en donde transitan la mayoría de sus clientes, hay diferentes zonas que son muy concurrida. En un principio empezó con poco capital y a medida del tiempo ha podido capitalizarse mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida. Con el préstamo tiene pensado  comprar repuestos, cilindros, retrovisores,  llantas, tapizado, entre otras mejoras que quiere proporcionarle a su vehículo.
texts.en:
Rolando José is 28 years old.  He is a hard-working man who started in business offering a taxi service and a milling service.  Over time, he has acquired a lot of experience and this has made it possible for him to get ahead in his business.  He gets up every day to work from 6.00am to 9.00pm as this is when there are most customers.  There are some periods during the day which are very busy.  

Rolando José started his business with just a little capital and, over time, he has been able to gradually inject more capital into his business and improve his quality of life.  He plans to use this loan to buy spare parts, cylinders, rear-view mirrors, tires, upholstery and other improvements for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, cylinders, rear-view mirrors, tires, upholstery and other improvements for his vehicle

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafa S. R. es conocido por su ser una persona muy emprendedora, vecino de la Fuente en Cartago. 

El trabajo toda su vida como Jornalero de una empresa  agroindustrial en la cual se desempeñaba como jornalero. Pero gracias a su esfuerzo y desarrollo de liderazgo Rafa tuvo un ascenso en su trabajo,  y hoy administra una cuadrilla conformada por varios trabajadores. Es por eso que el solicita un préstamo de ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil coloneS).

El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  la Fuente Agrícola  Empresarial, una de las  110 empresas de Crédito Socias de EDESA.
texts.en:
Rafa S. R. is known as a very enterprising person.  He lives in La Fuente, in Cartago.

Rafa has worked all his life as a laborer for an agroindustrial company.  However, thanks to his effort and the development of his leadership skills, he got a promotion at work and now he manages a team of several workers.  This is why he is requesting a loan for 594,000 Costa Rican colones.

Rafa is a member of Fuente Agrícola Empresarial Communal Bank, one of the 110 loan companies who work with EDESA.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Con su anterior credikiva, Sebastián adquirió un molino eléctrico y también le alcanzó para comprar mas materia prima e insumos, ahora sus tiempos de producción son mejores y trabaja más eficientemente. En la actualidad se propone comprar una betería de cocina, utensilios varios y también como hizo créditos a  nuevos clientes,  financiará su cartera; esto es justamente en lo que invertirá el financiamiento al que está aplicando mediante  la línea credikiva. Sebastián envía muchos agradecimientos a sus financiadores por ayudarlo: Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Sebastián H. puede acceder al siguiente enlace:
  

http://www.kiva.org/lend/175710
texts.en: With his previous Kiva loan, Sebastián acquired an electric mill and also managed to buy more raw materials and supplies.  Now his production times have improved and he works more efficiently.  He is currently planning to buy pots and pans, various utensils and also, as he offered credit to new customers, he will finance his portfolio.  This is what he plans to invest his Kiva loan in.  Sebastián sends lots of thanks to his financial backers for their help.  If you would like to know more about Sebastián's story, you can click on the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/175710

loans.use: to buy pots and pans, various utensils and also, because he offered credit to his customers, to finance his portfolio

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural. Hace más de 27 años que tiene este negocio. Siempre está pensando en mejorar su negocio cada día y es por medio de los financiamientos que lo ha logrado poco a poco. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante, su forma de ofrecerlos es abordando diferentes buses que conducen a los diferentes departamentos y así logra obtener clientes nuevos y estables. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito para la compra de vitaminas, ungüentos, suplementos, frascos, hierbas entre otros.
texts.en: Alicia's business is selling natural medicines.  She has been in this business for more than 27 years and is always planning to improve her business every day.  Through taking loans, she has gradually achieved this.  Alicia gets up very early as she sells her products as an itinerant vendor.  Her way of selling involves taking different buses to different departments and obtaining new and regular customers.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy vitamins, olntments, supplements, small bottles and herbs etc.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, ointments, supplements, small bottles, herbs, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz Marina Martínez tiene un negocio de ferretería, donde vende alambre dulce carretes, cabuya de manilas, clavos, tornillos, pegantes, pinturas en aerosol, puntillas, soportes, bombillos empaques de tuberías sanitarias, roscas, cintas, y en general repuestos para tuberías domiciliarias, eléctricas y en PVC. Ella inició su microempresas al que llamó  “Depósito Surtimar”, una vez quedó sin trabajo en un negocio similar del cual adquirió su experiencia y con  la indemnización  recibida desarrolló su idea emprendedora, para fortalecer su ingreso familiar y generar su propio empleo. Con este negocio ha crecido como persona y también en el ámbito empresarial, su sueño es consolidarla y convertirla en una gran empresa con varios puntos de atención y por eso está aplicando a un crédito de capital de trabajo en cual invertirá en la compra de repuestos eléctricos y tuberías sanitarias, así como en tornillos, tuercas, clavos, bombillos en mayor cantidad de lo que está acostumbrada a hacerlo, con ello  empezará la construcción de su propósito
texts.en:
Luz Marina Martínez has a hardware business where she sells reels of soft wire, manila rope, nails, screws, adhesives, aerosol paints, small nails, brackets, lightbulbs, seals for bathroom pipes, bolts, tape and general spare parts for domestic, electrical and PVC piping.

Luz started her small business called "Depósito Surtimar" when she found herself out of work from a similar business where she gained her experience.  She used her severance pay to develop her entrepreneurial idea, strengthen her family income and create a job for herself.  Through her business, Luz has grown as a person and also as a businesswoman.  Her dream is to consolidate her business and to turn it into a large company with several sales outlets.  For this reason, she is applying for a loan to use as working capital.  She will invest the loan in buying electrical spare parts and bathroom plumbing supplies, as well as screws, nuts, nails and lightbulbs, in larger quantities than she is used to doing.  In this way she will start constructing her plan.

loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts and bathroom plumbing supplies, as well as screws, nuts, nails and lightbulbs in larger quantities

loans.name: Santos Gabriela

texts.es: Santos Gabriela se dedica a la venta de envases de vidrios y cuajadas. Tiene más de 20 años que tiene este negocio. Ella dio inicio al negocio gracias a su esposo y un hijo que trabaja con ella, pues ambos han puesto mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio en este negocio, Santos atiende muy bien sus negocios, pues la mayoría de sus clientes saben de la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo a los clientes que llegan a comprar botellas o cuajadas. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar un encargo de embases que le están realizando.
texts.en:
Santos Gabriela's business is selling glass containers and 'cuajadas' (a compact, cheese-like product).  She has been in the business for more than 20 years.  She started her business with the help of her husband and one of her children who works with her.  They have both put a lot of effort and sacrifice into the business.

Santos works well in her business and her customers know that the products she sells are good quality.  She is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman.  She always greets her customers with a smile and she is always ready to assist them in their purchases.  Santos considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay serving her customers all day as they come to buy bottles or 'cuajadas'.  She is requesting this loan to buy an order of containers.

loans.use: to buy an order of containers

loans.name: Luis Andrey

texts.es:
Luis Andrey V. V., tiene la edad de 20 años de edad, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende con el dinero comprar una motocicleta para su trasporte al trabajo. El con esta compra se le hará de menor dificultad llegar a su trabajo diario y así estar a tiempo en cuanto a sus horarios establecidos. El piensa en su futuro por lo cual no quiere deja de laborar en esa empresa donde se encuentra actualmente  por el motivo del trasporte, es así como el opto por el crédito para comprar ese pequeño vehículo de trasporte. El quiere seguir trabajando para un mayor bienestar propio y el de sus padres y llegar a ser alguien en el futuro y el cual este vehiculo le facilitara su llegada al su trabajo.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis Andrey V. V. is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is trying to get the money to buy a motorcycle for travel to and from work. With this purchase it will be less difficult for him to get to work every day, and to be on time for his scheduled hours. He is thinking about his future, so he doesn't want to quit working at the company where he works now just because he doesn't have transportation. Therefore he is opting for a loan to buy a small vehicle. He wants to continue working for a better life for himself and his parents, and to someday become somebody. This motorcycle will make it easier for him to get to his work. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans through the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to travel to and from work

loans.name: Prosperemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROSPEREMOS”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cuscoy departamento de Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Lourdes Malena; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada; La socia es administradora de profesión y actualmente presta sus servicios a una empresa industrial, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo trabajando en esta empresa ella trabaja de lunes a viernes por las mañanas y tardes, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando por su familia y continuar luchando por los sueños que tiene para el futuro.

La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar su capital para la compra de un terrenito.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa para bebes, venta de productos de belleza y maestros. 

La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas
texts.en:
These are the members of the "PROSPEREMOS” (We Will Prosper) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Lourdes Malena is 33 years old and married.  She is an administrator by profession and she currently provides her services to an industrial company.  She has been working for this company for a long time and she works from Monday to Friday, mornings and afternoons.  Lourdes is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to keep working for her family and to continue striving to fulfil the dreams that she has for the future.

Lourdes is requesting this loan to increase her capital so that she can buy a small plot of land.

The other members of the group work in different businesses.  Some buy and sell baby clothes, others sell beauty products and others are teachers.

Lourdes feels happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to increase her capital so that she can buy a small plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish, spare parts, local products and cleaning products

loans.name: Santos Teresa

texts.es:
Santos tiene 25 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 8 años de edad y dos meses, por el momento vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de pescado seco, este negocio tiene 6 años de existir, está ubicado en el mercado municipal, trabaja todos los días de la semana y junto a su madre lo atienden.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para  la compra de pescado seco, dicha inversión se debe a que se acerca la semana santa, tiempo en crece la demanda del pescado, esto será una gran ayuda para Santos, ya que estará aumentando el negocio y la capacidad para atender a los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener mejores ingresos, aprovechar la temporada para vender más cantidad y que le quede una mayor ganancia, al mismo tiempo poder construir su propia casa y dar lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is 25 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  She is a single mother and has two children: one is 8 years old and the other is 2 months old.  Santos currently lives with her mother and her business is selling dried fish.  She has had this business for six years and it is located in the town market.  Santos works every day of the week together with her mother.

Santos is currently requesting a loan to buy dried fish.  This investment is necessary because 'Semana Santa' (Holy Week) is approaching.  During this period, the demand for fish increases.  This will be a great help to Santos since she will be able to increase her business and her ability to serve her customers.

Santos' goals are to make more income, to take advantage of the season in order to make more sales and to make more profits so that she can build her own home and provide her children with what they need.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Karen Alexandra

texts.es: Karen N. Alarcón de 28 años de edad, es una joven empresaria  socia propietaria del negocio llamado “Almacen de Ropa Flower y Chic” ubicado en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos en las edades de 3 y 4 años.  Karen N. es una abogada  de profesión muy creativa e inquieta, por eso desde hace un años creó un taller de confecciones y adicionó a él un almacén de ropa en la línea infantil femenina, ambos negocios funcionando en el mismo local. En su taller cuenta con una  operaria  y Karen se encarga de su administración y de todo el mercadeo, su fortaleza radica en vender diseños exclusivos pues su socia y amiga, es una profesional del diseño de modas y se la pasa creando nuevos modelos. En su microempresa ambas muestran mucho interés de crecimiento y por eso desde que iniciaron operaciones,  sus ingresos han logrado cubrir sus costos fijos y generar utilidades. Su sueño ahora es adicionar a su mercado ropa infantil masculina,  línea en la cual sus clientes quieren que incursionen y están  dispuestas   a preparase para este propósito. La competencia en el mercado actual es fuerte,  pero se sostienen por la calidad de sus productos el servicio y la exclusividad de sus diseños, por eso sus inventarios de materia prima rotan cada 10 días y presenta un buen margen de utilidad no menor del 45%. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva comprará telas, hilos, encajes botones en mayor volumen, para obtener muy buenos descuentos y fortalecer su capital de trabajo actual.
texts.en:
Karen N. Alarcón, 28 years old, is a young businesswoman, part owner of a business called "Almacen de Ropa Flower & Chic" located in the city of Barranquilla, where she lives with her husband and two small children, aged 3 and 4. 

Karen N. is a lawyer by profession, but is very creative with lots of energy, and so a year ago she started a dressmaking workshop and added a shop selling a line of clothing for little girls. Both businesses operate out of the same location. In the workshop she has one worker and Karen is in charge of the administration and all the marketing. 

Her strength lies in selling exclusive designs, since her friend and partner is a professional fashion designer and spends her time creating new designs. In their micro-enterprise they both show great interest in growth and since they began operations their income has covered their fixed costs and generated profits. Their dream now is to add a line of clothing for little boys, something their customers have requested that they develop, and that they are willing to explore. 

The competition in the market today is fierce, but they hold their own through the quality of their products, their service, and the exclusivity of their designs. As a result, their raw materials inventory has a turnover of 10 days and they show a profit margin of no less than 45%. This is their first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the Kivacredit Karen will purchase cloth, thread, lace, and buttons in larger volume so she can get volume discounts and increase her daily working capital.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, lace, buttons and so on in greater volume so she can get volume discounts

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Doña Josefina, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, vive junto a sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y la elaboración de flores, ella realiza sus ventas por las mañanas y de dedica por las tardes a la elaboración de flores artificiales.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leña, maíz y otros materiales para elaborar flores,  ya que por el momento no dispone de mucha materia prima por lo que este préstamo le dará fortaleza para continuar en su negocio.
Doña Josefina  tiene como objetivo, trabajar diariamente por conseguir ahorros para mejorar el techo de la vivienda ya que esta deteriorado, también apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and lives in Lolotiquillo, in Morazán department.  She lives together with her children and her business is selling tortillas and making artificial flowers.  She makes her sales in the mornings and in the afternoons she makes her flowers.

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy firewood, corn and other materials for making her flowers since she doesn't have much raw material at the moment.  This loan will give her strength to continue in her business.

Josefina's goals are to work every day so that she can save the money she needs to improve her roof since it is in a bad state of repair and also to support her children.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and other materials for making artificial flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, chicken and condiments

loans.name: Julia Erminia

texts.es: Julia Erminia se dedica al destace de cerdo y una pulpería. Es una mujer trabajadora y lo ha demostrado por medio de sus negocios que ha sabido manejarlos muy bien. Con fondos propios fue que ella estableció este medio de vida. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido el tiempo, pues Julia tiene que estar al pendiente de ambos negocio, por lo que no es fácil ya que es algo agotador. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en: Julia Erminia runs a pulpería [small grocery store] and butchers pigs. She is a hard-working woman and she has demonstrated through her businesses that she knows how to manage them well. She established these means of livelihood with her own funds. One of the greatest challenges Julia faces is time, as she is going back and forth between the two businesses, which is not easy and is exhausting. She is requesting this loan to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, detergent, basic grains, and other products for her store.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, detergent, basis grains, and other products

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Don Ramiro, tiene 57 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de calzado, vive con su esposa doña María y su hija Noemy, ellos residen en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán; don Ramiro es comerciante de zapatos para caballeros y damas, su negocio está ubicado en la zona de comercio en Gotera, tiene aproximadamente 11 años de vender.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tacos, zapatos de vestir para dama, esta compra le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de mercadería a los clientes. Su objetivo es ayudar a su familia a mejorar la vivienda y mantenerse en el negocio por largo plazo.
texts.en:
Ramiro is 57 years old and sells footwear.  He lives with his wife María and his daughter Noemy in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  Ramiro sells men's and women's shoes.  His business is located in the commercial district of Gotera.  He has been selling for approximately 11 years.

Ramiro is requesting a loan to buy high-heeled shoes, ladies' dress shoes.  This purchase will allow him to offer his customers a wider variety of merchandise.  His goal is to help his family, to improve his home and to remain in his business long term.

loans.use: to buy high-heeled shoes, ladies' dress shoes

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Doña Adela, es una señora dedicada a vender refrescos y gaseosas, tiene 63 años D. edad, vive en compañía D. su esposo don Lucio C. y sus nietos, residen en San Francisco Gotera departamento D. Morazán.
Su negocio es la venta D. refrescos y gaseosas en su vivienda, por el momento quiere invertir en el negocio que posee su hija que es la venta D. comida en el mercado municipal, como una ayuda para que pueda crecer con el negocio. 
Con dicha inversión estará mejorando el negocio y ofrecerá mayor variedad D. productos a los clientes, dándole a su hija una mayor rentabilidad; Su objetivo es ayudar a sus nietos para que continúen estudiando, así también fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is a lady who sells soft drinks and soda.  She is 63 years old and lives with her husband, Lucio C., and her grandchildren in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.

Adela's business is selling soft drinks and soda from her home.  On this occasion, she would like to invest in her daughter's business which is selling meals in the town market.  She would like to do this to help her so that she can grow in her business.

This investment will help her daughter to improve her business and be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.  This will increase the profitability of her daughter's business.  Adela's goal is to help her grandchildren so that they can continue studying and also to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (for her daughter's business)

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra B. es una mujer D. 30 años, que vive en el barrio Santo Domingo con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades D. 10 y 4 años ; elL. por iniciativa propia decidió aumentar sus ingresos familiares, comprando mercancía  como ropa femenina y vendiendo a unos cuantos clientes, su sueño por fortalecer su negocio L. llevó a persistir constantemente y a trabajar para ampliarlo, así fue como empezó a conseguir nuevos clientes y ahora no solo venD. ropa sino también calzado en mayor cantidad y toda mercancía que solicitan sus buenos y rentables clientes.  Su meta y gran desafío es tener un punto D. ventas muy concurrido con gran variedad D. productos para ofrecer, para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con su respuesta oportuna.
