Su gran desafío es tener una casa propia a L. que pueda adicionar un local donD. adecuar su negocio. Así mientras desarrolL. su sueño,  maneja unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 15 días, un margen D.  utilidad no menor D. 40% y  continúa ordenando su desempeño, para cumplir mas adelante sus propósitos. En L. actualidad acuD. a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para acceder a un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, cosméticos sobre pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, lo cual garantiza que su inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en: Sandra B. is a 30 year-old woman who lives in the Santo Domingo neighborhood with her husband and their 2 children, aged 10 and 4.  She decided on her own initiative to start a business so she could increase the household income, buying merchandise such as women's clothing, and selling it to a small number of customers.  Her dream to strengthen her business led her to persist and work constantly to expand it.  In this way she started to attract new customers and now, not only does she sell clothing, but she also sell shoes, and she sells in large quantities, satisfying the demand of all of her good and profitable customers.  Her goal and great challenge is to have a busy point of sales where she could offer a large variety of products, so that she could respond to the needs of her customers in a timely manner.  Her greatest goal is to have her own home where she could also have space for her business.  While she works toward that dream, she manages accounts receivable that rotate every 15 days, and a profit margin no less than 40 percent.  She will continue to drive the performance of her business so that in the future she can accomplish her goals.  Now she has come to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan that she will use to purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. With these products she can fill outstanding orders from her customers, which will ensure that her investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics to fill her customer's orders

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Don Salomón , tiene  53 años de edad, es casado, tiene  7 hijos , es originario de la comunidad llamada Ocotolillo, en Estelí , de oficio agricultor ,lleva 20 años de edad, debido a su condición humilde  solo llego cuarto grado de primaria para poder llegar al colegio tenia que caminar 2 horas . Aprendió la agricultura  con su papa que se dedicaba a la caficultura y el trabajo jornal , a la edad de 6 años  ayudaba a arriar bueyes para siembra de granos básicos.  A los  23 años se caso . Con 10 metros de tierra que su padre le dejo comenzó a trabajar, se independizo y asi  ha ido aumentando a 5 metros  mas de tierra.
Solicito el crédito para darle mantenimiento de la finca del café y aumentar el área de siembra. Con esto espera que su producción de quintales de café aumente, mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su capital de trabajo. Dentro de sus planes esta tener una finca productiva en un 80%  de granos de café mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
Tiene como meta preparar a todos sus hijos para que puedan ir a la universidad y sean personas de bien y útiles a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Salomón is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. He is originally from a community called Ocotolillo, in Estelí department. He has been a farmer since he was 20 years old. Due to his humble means, he only reached the fourth grade of primary school. He would have had to walk two hours to reach the high school.

He learned farming from his father, who worked as a coffee farmer and day laborer. When he was just six years old, Salomón helped drive oxen for planting basic grains. He married when he was 23 years old. He became independent when his father left him ten meters of land that he began to work, and since then, he has expanded his land by another five meters.

Salomón is requesting this loan to perform maintenance on his coffee farm and to increase the area that he will plant. He hopes that this will increase the amount of coffee he produces, thereby improving his sales and boosting his working capital. His plans include having a farm that produces 80% coffee beans, and improving the infrastructure of his house.

His goal is to prepare all of his children so that they can attend university and become good people who are useful to society.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee farm and to increase the area that he will plant

loans.name: Dina Argelia

texts.es:
Doña Dina, tiene 67 años D. edad, es dueña D. una ferretería, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera,  departamento D. Morazán, vive con su hijo llamado  Anner; él negocio lo atienD. en su casa durante la semana D. lunes a sábado y el domingo se traslada al mercado, a ofrece los artículos.
Ella quiere invertir al negocio, comprando martillo, barra D. metal, pegamento industrial, y a través D. este préstamo podrá conseguir la mercadería para fortalecer el negocio,  ofreciendo mejor variedad D. herramientas y dando para una mejor atención a los clientes.
El objetivo D. doña Dina es tener mayor estabilidad en el negocio, por largo plazo, para garantizar los ingresos para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Dina is 67 years old. She is the owner of a hardware store. She lives in San Francisco Gotera,  departament of Morazán. She lives with her son, named  Anner. She works at the business in her house during the week from Monday through Saturday. Sundays she goes to the market to sell her items.  

She wants to invest in the business, buying hammers, metal rods and industrial glue. In this way, she will be able to have the merchandise to strengthen her business, offering a better variety of tools and giving her customers better service. 

Dina's goal is to have more stability in her business in the long term, and guarantee income for her and her son.

loans.use: to buy tools (hammers, metal rods, industrial glue).

loans.name: Alfonso De Jesus

texts.es: Don Alfonso se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, desde hace 8 años. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 16 y 10 años, que están a su cargo. Empezó con esfuerzo propio, ya que necesitaba un medio de ingreso que le generara lo necesarios, este negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, y él desea que su negocio crezca, es por eso que él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts, vestidos, trajes, camisetas y sabanas. Su meta es agrandar su inventario para tener una mayor producción.
texts.en: Alfonso has had a business selling used clothing for 8 years.  He has two minor children aged 16 and 10, who are in his care.  He started his business with his own efforts, since he needed to have a means of generating income to pay for the necessities of life.  This business has allowed him to provide for his family, and he wants to see the business grow.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, suits, T-shirts and bed sheets.  His goal is to expand his inventory so that he can increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, suits, T-shirts and bed sheets

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin Gabriel B. L., tiene la edad de 25 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su mamá. El pretende comprar con el dinero los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno y el cultivo en buenas condiciones por lo cual quiere asistirlo para esta próxima cosecha llegar a tener mayores ingresos y producciones. El cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta área del café y también quiere crecer como caficultor de la zona y generar ingresos para su bienestar y el de su madre.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Martin Gabriel B. L., age 25, is single and lives with his mother.  He wants to use the money to buy supplies to help with his coffee crops.  He states that with the land and the crops in good condition, which he wants to help happen in the next harvest, he will come to have greater income and production.

He has a lot of experience in the field.  He also wants to grow as a coffee grower in the area.  This will generate income for his and his mother’s well-being.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his coffee crops

loans.name: Amistad Y Progreso - Pincha Group

texts.es:
Karim, 21 años D. edad,madre soltera, 1 hijo, socia D. L. Alcancìa comunal "Amistad y Progreso - Pincha".
Karim se dedica a L. venta D. artìculos D. primera necesidad en su pequeña tienda D. abarrotes; aunque no esta muy surtida es muy concurrida por sus vecinos ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona cèntrica.
Karim solicitò el prèstamo para poder abastecer D. nuevos productos su negocio.
En L. fotografìa, Karim esta vestida con ropa deportiva color azul y zapatillas blancas, es L. tercera D. L. derecha.
(El socio Eliseo D. M. no se encuentra en L. fotografia grupal por motivo D. que su jornada D. trabajo no se lo permite; èl es moto-taxista)
texts.en:
Karim, 21, is a single mother of one son.  She’s a member of the “Amistad y Progreso-Pincha” (Friendship & Progress-Pincha) communal bank.

Karim sells basic need items in her small grocery store.  Although it’s not very well stocked it’s quite popular with the neighbors because it’s in a central location. Karim requested a loan to stock the store with new products.

In the photo, Karim is wearing blue athletic wear and white slippers; she’s third from the right.  (Member Eliseo D. M. does not appear in the group photo because his work schedule does not allow it; he’s a mototaxi driver).

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro, se dedica a la crianza y venta  de cerdos, tiene 65 años de edad, reside en El Divisadero departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa  y juntos realizan las labores sobre el mantenimiento de los cerdos, de este negocio dependen para subsistir.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar concentrado para los cerdos, con esta inversión estará aumentando el alimento para cerdos y la oportunidad de generar más ventas, ya que estarán mejor cuidados para engordar fácilmente.
Tiene como objetivo comprar más cerdos y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Pedro raises and sells pigs. He is 65 years old and lives in El Divisadero, departament of Morazán. He lives with his wife and together they do the work to take care of the pigs. They depend on this business to make their living. 

He is asking for a loan to buy feed concentrate for the pigs. With this investment, he will be increasing the feed for the pigs and the opportunity to make more sales, since they will be better cared for and will fatten up more easily. 

His goal is to buy more pigs and for his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda, es originaria de San Juan de Limay, esta casada, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Ella se dedica a llevar contabilidades. Comenzó a los 23 años de edad a trabajar en este negocio, ella estudiaba contaduría publica los sábados y los días de  semana trabajaba llevando contabilidades, ella misma con sus esfuerzos logro pagar su carrera universitaria sin la ayuda de nadie, ya que  su padre era agricultor y su madre ama de casa y no podían pagarle estudios profesionales. Este ha sido su primer negocio, actualmente brinda servicios de contabilidad y tiene 5 clientes a los cuales tiene 7  y 10 años de trabajar con ellos. Su esposo trabaja reparando celulares y así cooperar en el hogar. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar material de construcción como  cemento, arena, pintura,  y pago de mano de obra para remodelar su oficina y su vivienda.   Le ayudara a darle una mejor presentación a su negocio que lo tiene ubicado dentro de su vivienda, así atraerá mas clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
Tiene como planes futuros dar a conocer sus servicios contables atraves de medios radiales, poner un pequeño negocio de elaboración de refresco. Así ayudarse para ahorrar y pagarles estudios profesionales a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Teodolinda, originally from San Juan de Limay, is married, and has 2 children, aged 18 and 15 respectively. She is an accountant.  Teodolinda began this work when she was 23 years old. She studied public accounting on Saturdays, while on week days she worked at accounting. She paid her own university expenses without anyone's help. Since her father was a farmer and her mother a house wife, they couldn't pay for her professional studies. This has been her first business. She offers services to 5 clients and has from 7 to 10 years of working with each of them.  Teodolinda's husband repairs cell phones and thus helps in the home.

Teodolinda requests a loan to buy construction materials, including cement, sand, and paint, and to pay for labor to remodel her office and house. This will help give her business, located in her home, a better appearance, bringing in more clients and augmenting her income.

Among her future plans are to make her accounting services better known through radio advertising, and to install a small refreshment-making business. This will help her to save and to pay for her 2 children's professional studies.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS, INCLUDING CEMENT, SAND, AND PAINT, AND TO PAY LABORERS TO REMODEL HER OFFICE AND HOME

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris K. is  41 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. She also has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is an orphan and Doris opted to assist her with her schooling. In 1999, Doris established her food stuff business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. She opens her business seven days a week, nine hours a day. She is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase large quantities of garri (couscous-like grain), palm oil, and bulgur. Doris intends to use the proceeds of this loan to pay school fees for her children and help her husband provide a livelihood for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase garri, palm oil, and bulgur

loans.name: José Glaitón

texts.es: Jose P. M. es un hombre muy amable que vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 22 años; desde su casa en Villas de San Pablo se dedica a la venta de víveres y se siente muy contento porque su comunidad crecerá cada día más y esto representan nuevos clientes futuros y mayores utilidades.   Inició su negocio desde hace dos años,  con la venta de algunos productos de la canasta familiar y poco a poco ha ido creciendo, hasta lograr tener  otro puesto de ventas que ha ubicado  en un lugar de alta circulación de clientes, como lo es el Centro de Barranquilla. Su meta es trabajar la venta al por mayor y organizar su estructura en un depósito, crecimiento  con lo cual aumentaría sus ingresos familiares. Su mayor desafío es la competencia,  pero su cordial y oportuna atención,  lo ayudan a que en el mercado sea el preferido; así se sostiene, mientras su rentabilidad es no menor del 30% y espera que con su nuevo crédito logre aumentar a mas del 35%,  pues está aplicando a su credikiva a muy bajo costo, y con esta  financiación planea comprar víveres, ranchos de contado y en un mayor volumen,  como arroz, enlatados, productos de limpieza, aceites y artículos varios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Jose P. M. is a very kind man living with his spouse and two children who are 18 and 22 years of age.  He sells groceries at his home located in Villas de San Pablo.  He feels happy because his community will grow more each day and this represents more future customers and higher profits.

He started his business two years ago selling a few basic items and gradually has been growing.  He now has a second sales stand located in a spot with much foot traffic like downtown Barranquilla.

His goal is to work in wholesale sales and to organize his structure into a warehouse.  This growth will lead to increased family income.  His greatest challenge is competition but his cordial and timely attention to customers helps him be preferred in the marketplace.  

This is how he supports himself.  His profit margin is no less than 30% and he hopes the new loan will increase it to over 35% because he’s applying for his Kiva loan at a very low cost.  He will use this loan to pay cash for groceries like rice, canned goods, cleaning supplies, oil and assorted items for the home in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Adjo Kafui

texts.fr: Madame Adjo fait la restauration. Ce commerce lui permet d’assurer parfaitement tous les besoins de sa famille et son enfant.   Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a débuté en 2007 ce commerce et a son hangar sur le boulevard 30 Août à côté de l’école Kouvahey. Elle reçoit tellement de demandes de ces clients, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz  Djino, 1 sac de riz Oncle Bomb, 3 cartons de produits congelés et 3 bidons d’huile. Elle a 31 ans et est mariée à un pasteur. Elle est résidente du quartier  Avenou.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo is in the catering business. This activity allows her to provide completely for all her family's needs and those of her child.

She gets her supplies from the Grand Market of Lomé. She started this business in 2007 and her shed is located on the August 30 Boulevard, next to the Kouvahey school. 

She receives so many orders from her customers that she is requesting a loan to buy 5 bags of rice Djino, 1 bag of rice Oncle Bomb, 3 boxes of frozen items and 3 jugs of oil. 

She is 31 years old and is married to a minister. She lives in the Avenou district.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, frozen items and jugs of oil

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Susana, de 38 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vive con sus cuatro hijos: Adolfo de 26 años de edad, Elizabeth de 14, Raquel de 10 y Gerson de 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica al negocio desde hace tres años, posee un puesto en la calle sobre el mercado de San Francisco Gotera, su dedicación al comercio nace por la necesidad de obtener dinero para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la reparación del vehículo donde transporta la mercadería del negocio, ya que últimamente está presentando desperfectos mecánicos y es un riesgo para ella continuar transportándose así.
Este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir este gasto y contar con un vehículo en buenas condiciones; el objetivo de Susana velar por las necesidades del hogar y sacar a sus hijos adelante con estudios superiores que les ayude a superarse.
texts.en:
Susana is 38 years old and lives in Delicias de Concepción, located in the Department of Morazán, with her four children: Adolfo (26), Elizabeth (14), Raquel (10) and Gerson (6). She has worked selling fruits and vegetables for three years and she has a street stand near the San Francisco Gotera market. She works in this business because she needs to earn money to cover her childrens’ needs.

She is requesting a loan to repair the vehicle that she uses to transport the merchandise for her business, as it has been having mechanical problems lately and it is risky for her to continue traveling like this. This loan will help her to cover this expense in order to have a vehicle in good condition.

Susana’s goal is to look out for the household’s needs and to get her children ahead in life with post-secondary studies.

loans.use: to repair the truck she uses to transport merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 32 años de edad. Actualmente, María vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas, Cusco, Perú. Ella trabaja en la empresa SILSA (Servicios de Limpieza Integrados). La empresa SILSA actualmente se encarga de hacer limpieza del Seguro Social del Cusco y ahi trabaja Maria. En esta oportunidad Maria requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para hacer pintar la casa y otros arreglos que necesita la casa. El sueño de María es abrir un snack.   

Maria es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Los Diamantes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the city of Cusco and she is 32 years old. Maria currently lives in the imperial city of Los Incas, in Cusco, Peru. She works with the company named SILSA (meaning Integrated Janitorial Services). The company named SILSA is responsible for the janitorial services to the hospital in Cusco and that is where Maria works. Maria currently requires a loan to meet some personal needs, specifically to have her house repainted and to carry out other improvements necessary for the house. Maria’s dream is to open a snack bar. 

Maria is a responsible person and she is a member of the communal bank named “The Diamonds” of Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to have her house painted and to carry out other necessary home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto G. Godínez, tiene la edad de 47 años de edad, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende comprar con el dinero los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno y el cultivo en buenas condiciones por lo cual quiere asistirlo para esta próxima cosecha llegar a tener mayores ingresos y producciones al igual mejorar  su calidad de producción. El cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta área del café y también quiere crecer como caficultor de la zona y generar ingresos para su bienestar y el de sus padres. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rigoberto G. Godínez, 47, is single living with his parents.  He intends to use the money to buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.  He has the land and the plants in good condition so he wants to assist them so that the next harvest will produce higher income and crop yields as well as to improve the quality of his products.  He has a lot of experience growing coffee and he also wants to grow as a coffee producer in the area thus generating income for his and his parents’ wellbeing.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hadn’t had any previous loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with the best terms and an interest rate that is much lower.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid B. vive en el barrio Los Almendros del municipio de Galapa, población donde tradicionalmente las artes, la música y el folclor forman parte de su tradición cultural; allí se dedica a la confección en un taller ubicado en su propia casa, negocio  heredado de su madre quien le enseñó el oficio de la modistería y con el cual se ha sostenido desde hace 30 años, construyendo toda su experiencia emprendedora. Astrid considera que su m microempresa ha sido muy importante en su autonomía e independencia, pero sobre todo porque con el ha logrado salir adelante en la educación y el sostenimiento de  con su único hijo, que hoy se encuentra en la edad de 23 años. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a la linea de Kiva, con él cual comprará telas e insumos de confección, inversión que garantiza sea exitosa porque está sobre pedidos y especialmente por la calidad de las prendas de vestir que Astrid produce y comercializa.  Su sueño es organizar mejor su taller para garantizar mejores tempos productivos y dar una respuesta bien oportuna a su clientela, mientras en la actualidad  maneja una rentabilidad no menor del 40% que desea ampliar iniciando por este su primer financiamiento con esta organización a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Astrid B. lives in the “Los Almendros” neighborhood in the municipality of Galapa, a location where art, music and folklore are traditionally part of their culture; she has a dressmaker's shop in her house, business inherited from her mother, who taught her dressmaking and with which she has supported herself for 30 years, having a full entrepreneurial experience.  Astrid considers that her micro-enterprise has been very important in her autonomy and independence, but for above all because she has been able to get her only son ahead, through education and financial support , he is now 23 years old.  This is her first loan with “Mario Santo Domingo” foundation through Kiva, with which she will buy fabric and tailoring supplies, an investment that guarantees success because she has many orders due to the quality of the clothing pieces Astrid produces and sells.  Her dream is to organize a better shop to be more productive and provide timing services to her clients, currently she has profitability of not less than 40% that she hopes to increase thanks to the loan with this organization through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Josué Gamabiel

texts.es:
Josué tiene 27 años de edad, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, está soltero, vive con su padre, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace un año y medio, aprendió el oficio en otro taller donde inicio como trabajador, el horario que posee es de 7:00 a 5:00pm, su manera de trabajar es por pedidos.
Actualmente necesita invertir en madera de diferentes clases, para poder fabricar los muebles encargados, este crédito le ayudara a tener en su inventario el material necesario y atender la demanda.
Su Objetivo es superarse poco a poco, tener un taller más amplio y mejorar su trabajo, para satisfacer a los clientes.
texts.en:
Josué is 27 years old, single, and lives in Osicala, located in the Department of Morazán, with his father. He has worked as a carpenter for a year and a half and he learned the trade in another shop where he started as a worker. He works from 7am to 5pm and works by request.

He currently needs to invest in different types of wood in order to be able to make the furniture requested. This loan will help him to have the necessary material in his inventory and meet the demand.

His goal is to get ahead in life little by little, to have a larger workshop, and to improve his work in order to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy different types of wood.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sabina tiene 48 años de edad,  es conviviente  y tiene 5 hijos, Sabina actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal “Ríos de Agua Viva” grupo  conformado por  7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Sabina  trabaja desde hace 2 años vendiendo salchipapa en un carrito sanguchero, a su vez cría animales gallinas, cerdos y los vende sabina nos cuenta que nada ha sido fácil tuvo que empezar desde abajo para lograr lo que hoy en día tiene, su motivación fueron sus hijos, ya que ella deseaba darles una mejor calidad de vida y que no pasen pobreza , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  sus hijos mayores son profesionales y piensan poner un taller de  confección de ropa. Sabina a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería. Sabemos que sabina   cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.

La foto pequeña corresponde al Sr. G. H. Nilton Fernando, No estuvo en el momento de la toma pues por problemas de su trabajo llego un poco tarde
texts.en:
Sabina, 48, has a spouse and five children.  She is a member of the “Ríos de Agua Viva” (Rivers of Living Water) communal bank which has 7 members involved in various commercial activities.

Sabina has been working for the last two years selling salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage) from a cart.  She also raises chickens and pigs that she sells.  She tells us that nothing has been easy.  She had to start from the bottom to attain what she has today.  Her motivation was her children because she wanted to provide them with a better quality of life so that they wouldn’t suffer poverty.  Thanks to her effort and dedication her older children are professionals and are thinking about setting up a dressmaking shop.

Sabina has requested a new loan to buy merchandise.  We know that Sabina will reach her goals with much work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

The small photo depicts Sr. G. H. Nilton Fernando. He was not present when the picture was taken because he arrived late from his job.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ronal Cruz

texts.es: Ronal tiene 53 años, vive en la zona de achuapa con sus dos hijos menores de edad. El se dedica a la compra y venta de muebles, desde hace más de 16 años, cuenta con la ayuda de dos personas que le brindan apoyo en la elaboración de los diferentes muebles que realiza como sillas, comedores, escritorio, cómodas entre otras. Desea utilizar su crédito para la compra de pega, clavos, herramientas, maque, alcohol, tela entre otros.  Este es su primer  crédito por lo que se encuentra muy alegre con esta oportunidad. Es bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ronal, age 53, lives in the Achuapa zone with his two minor children.  He has been buying and selling furniture for over 16 years.  He has two people who help him make the different furniture he makes like chairs, dining room furniture, desks, dressers, and others.

He wishes to use the loan to buy glue, nails, tools, varnish, alcohol, fabric, and other items.  This is his first loan, and he is very happy about this opportunity.  He is very devoted to his family, and he always watches out for their well-being and their progress.

loans.use: to buy glue, nails, tools, varnish, alcohol, fabric, and other items

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es:
Juan Rafael R. G., tiene la edad de 54 años de edad, está casado  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende comprar con el dinero cerdos para el engorde y mejorar las instalaciones de sus chiqueros para tenerlos en mejores condiciones para su explotacion. El cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para seguir adelante con el proyecto y fortalecerlo aun más. El pretende generar ganancias para su bienestar familiar y darles una vida más digna y con mayores facilidades a sus hijos, al igual darles es estudio para que sean unos profesinaloes en el futuro.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Rafael R. G., 54, is married living with his two children and his wife who are his main priorities.  He intends to use the money to buy pigs to raise and to improve the pigsties to have them in better condition for their exploitation.  He has the required experience to continue forward with the project and strengthen it still more.  He intends to generate profits for his family’s wellbeing and provide them with a more proper life and more ease for his children as well as a good education so that they will become professionals in the future.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.   He hadn’t had any previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to improve the pigsties.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is a 38 year-old businesswoman. She is married to a driver. She has four children, three are going to school and the other is in business. 

In 1996, Mariatu established her clothing business. She was taught business at a very early stage of her life by her mother, so when she grew up she decided to do business to earn her living and help her husband in supporting their children. 

She opens her business seven days a week and nine hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL). Mariatu requires a loan to help her buy more cotton materials for her business. In the future Mariatu plans to build a house and help her husband educate their children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of cotton for her business

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 37 years old and married to Maureen Jemptum who runs a salon. Geoffrey rears poultry on his farm thus supplying eggs to the nearby centre of Ndurio in the town of Kapsabet. He has been in business for a period of six years earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000

Geoffrey has taken out his first loan from KADET LTD of Ksh 10,000. He wants to use the money to pay for chicken feeds and also add chicks to the poultry house. 

The profits will be used to expand the poultry house and purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. He hopes to become a major supplier of eggs in the town.

loans.use: to buy chicken feeds

loans.name: Tchaa

texts.fr: Monsieur Tchaa exerce comme activité professionnelle  la cuisine. Mais pour arriver à satisfaire parfaitement sa famille et ses 3 enfants, il a associé l’activité de  meunier.  Il a employé  une personne dans l’atelier.  Il a commencé en 2004 ce commerce et a son atelier à Agoé derrière le camp de police, un quartier populaire de Lomé. Son activité  marche à merveille et il envisage ouvrir un second atelier de meunier, il demande un crédit pour acheter un moulin.  Il est marié et à 35 ans, il habite quartier Forever. Le monsieur en question est debout et habillé en chemise blanche
texts.en:
Mr Tchaa's professional activity is cooking. However, to fully meet the needs of his family and of his three children, he added the activity of miller.

He has hired one person in his workshop. He started this business in 2004 and his workshop is located behind the police station in Agoé, a popular district of Lomé. His activity is going wonderfully and he is planning on opening second miller workshop. He is requesting a loan to buy a mill.

He is married and 35 years old. He lives in the district of Forever. The man in question is standing and wears a white shirt

loans.use: to purchase a mill

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline Rugut is 45 years old and married to John Rugu, a driver. They have two children, aged 18 and 16 years old. Angeline rears poultry for both eggs and meat on their farm in Chemundu village in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of eight years, getting a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Angeline has borrowed a loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, this being her fifth loan after she successfully serviced her previous loans well She intends to use the money to buy feed for the chickens (KES 28,000) and also to order more chicks (KES 22,000). The profits will be used to extend the poultry farm and also improve their living standards.

Her dream is to own a dairy farm and also to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items needed in her salon, such as hair and beauty products and a blowdryer.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia P. vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de un año  en el barrio Nueva Esperanza;  desde esta comunidad inició su negocio de ferretería, con un punto de ventas en el que vende tornillerías, soportes, repuestos, pinturas, gomas, pegantes tuberías de PVC y  gradualmente ha ido metiéndole mercancías variadas como chancletas plásticas. Su negocio nació debido a la experiencia de la pareja en las ventas que consolidaron, cuando  consideraron que la comunidad del barrio requería hacer reparaciones domiciliarias y tenia que trasladarse al centro de Barranquilla; esta fue la   razón por la cual ubicaron   un sitio para vender   productos de ferretería al detalle,  muy cerca al sitio de su vivienda donde establecieron un pequeño punto comercial, con tal de que Claudia  no tuviera que  abandonar sus responsabilidades en su hogar y los clientes se ahorraran el transporte para comprar pequeños detalles. Claudia y su cónyuge han construido con esta unidad de negocios muchos sueños,  entre los que esta el de diversificar puntos de ventas especializados en muchos sectores de la ciudad de Barranquilla, así mas adelante fortalecerían sus ingresos para darle curso a construirle un mejor mañana a su hijo, con el que sueña que sea exitoso y muy profesional en lo que emprenda. Con su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará mercancías de mayor salida en su negocio como pegantes, cintas plásticas, tuberías, cableado, alambre dulce, tornillos, tuercas en mayor volumen, inversión que será exitosa pues es la única ferretería y muchas veces deja de vender porque su mercancía rota muy rápido; Su principal desafío es el tamaño del local  pues por ser muy pequeño no puede aumentar sus inventarios como ella quisiera.
texts.en:
Claudia P. lives with her husband and her one year old son in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood.  She started her hardware business in this community.   From her sales spot she sells bolts, brackets, replacement parts, paint, adhesives, and glue for PVC pipes.  She has been gradually adding different merchandise like plastic flip flops.

The business was born because the couple joined their sales experience.   They considered that the neighborhood community needed to make household repairs, and they had to move to the city of Barranquilla.  That is the reason that they located a place to sell retail hardware.

They established a small commercial location close to where they live.  That way Claudia did not have to neglect her household responsibilities.  Also, the customers saved on the transportation to buy small items.

Claudia and her husband have created many dreams with this business.  One of those is to diversify their sales locations specializing in many areas of the city of Barranquilla.  That will strengthen their income in the future in order to build a better future for their son.  She dreams of him being successful and very professional in what he undertakes.

This is her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy merchandise that has a high turnover in her business.  She will buy things like adhesives, plastic belts, pipes, wiring, soft wire, screws, and a large volume of nuts.  This investment will be successful because theirs is the only hardware business.  Many times they have to stop selling because their merchandise turns over very quickly.  Her biggest challenge is the size of her place.  It is very small, and she cannot increase her inventory as she would like to.

loans.use: to buy high turnover merchandise like adhesives, plastic belts, pipes, wiring, soft wire, screws, and a large volume of nuts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth A. Arévalo, Con su primer credikiva compró artículos D. papelería como cartulinas, cuadernos, lápices, artículos D. belleza como polvos y cosméticos; con su nuevo credikiva al que está ahora aplicando, comprará con una parte un congelador D. 500 botellas todo con el fin D. aprovechar su clientela y generar mas ingresos por productos como los refrescos que le gustan a sus clientes, así mismo el resto lo invertirá en artículos D. aseo e higiene personal para la venta.
Estas fueron  las palabras con las que despidió a su asesora cuando la visitó: dígale mis financiadores que estoy agradecida por el préstamo que me hicieron y espero quedarles bien como con este,  para que me sigan apoyando y D. esta manera logrando satisfacción mutua y recomendaré a nuevos clientes”. Si usted quiere leer la historia D. Elizabeth A. pueD. acceder al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/178033
texts.en: Elizabeth A. Arévalo used her first Kiva loan to buy stationery products such as card, exercise books and pencils, and beauty products such as powders and cosmetics.  She will use part of the new Kiva loan that she is currently applying for to buy a 500-bottle chiller cabinet in order to make more income selling products such as soft drinks that her customers like.  She will invest the rest in buying toiletries and personal care products to sell.  These were the words she said to her advisor when she was leaving after having visited her "Tell my financial backers that I am grateful for the loan they gave me and I hope to please them through this loan as well, so that they continue supporting me.  In this way, we will all be happy and I will recommend new clients".  If you would like to read Elizabeth A.'s story, you can access it here: http://kiva.org/lend/178033

loans.use: to buy a chiller cabinet and merchandise

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOP NABY est créé depuis le 03 décembre 2007. Il regroupe 13 femmes qui sont du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KIR DIOM

Madame MADA G. (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de thé et de sucre. Elle fait aussi la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide . Elle pratique cette activité de puis environs 10 ans

Son crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises cité ci-dessus afin de réaliser son activite de petit commerce

Son objectif est subvenir à ses besoins tout en participant à la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP NABY was created on December 3, 2007. It brings together thirteen women who are from the same village. They are united by ties of friendship and kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of KIR DIOM.

Ms. MADA G. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group's leader. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She has a small-scale business involving tea and sugar. She also processes and sells peanut oil. She has been in this business for about ten years.

Her loan will enable her to stock up on the merchandise mentioned above in order to carry out her work. 

Her goal is to meet all her needs while helping to support the family financially.

loans.use: to buy tea and sugar; and peanuts for making peanut oil

loans.name: Warner

texts.es:
Warner Álvarez V.  es un hombre muy trabajador, conocido por su gran carisma y don de gente en Guanacaste.
El trabaja en el área  de turismo, y necesita un préstamo de ₡594 000 ( quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para mejorar  las condiciones de su casa. El quisiera más adelante invertir para la construcción de habitaciones de  alquiler, ya que en la zona hay mucho turista.
El es  socio de la empresa de crédito Comunal  la Garita, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Warner Álvarez V. is a hard-working man known in Guanacaste for his great charisma and his ability to get along well with people.
He works in tourism, and he needs a loan of ₡594 000 ($1200 USD) to puchase the necessary materials to improve the condition of his house.  He would like, later on, to invest in the construction of rooms for rent, since there area a lot of tourists in his area.
He is a member of the comunal credit company "Comunal la Garita", one of the 110 member businesses of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Nuria Grisel

texts.es:
Nuria, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 37 años de edad, vive con sus hijos: Milagro de 13 años, Marilia de 11 y Julio de 6 años de edad, todos dependen de ella, su negocio es la venta de tortillas, lleva 8 años dedicándose a este oficio, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 6:00pm, este surgió por iniciativa propia.
Ella necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en una cocina de plancha, para hacer las tortillas, ya que quiere mejorar su producción y esta cocina le permitirá ser más eficiente y rápido el trabajo, atendiendo en menos tiempo a los clientes.
Para Nuria su principal objetivo es mantener el negocio ya que de él depende tanto ella como sus hijos, a los cuales quiere darles la oportunidad de estudiar y que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Nuria is 37 years old and lives in Corinto, located in the Department of Morazán, with her children: Milagro (13), Marilia (11) and Julio (6), all of whom are dependent of her. She started a tortilla-selling business eight years ago out of her own initiative and she works from 6am to 6pm every day.

She needs a loan to invest in a griddle for making tortillas, as she wants to improve her production. This griddle will allow her to be more efficient and quick in her work, taking less time to attend to her customers.

Nuria’s main goal is to maintain her business, as both she and her children depend on it and she wants to provide them with the opportunity to go to school so that they can get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a griddle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large volume of products such as canned tuna and sardines which sell very well, particularly during Holy Week

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Con el financiamiento al que aplica Nubia tiene planeado comprar víveres, ranchos, carnes frias, ropa y electrodomésticos menores, que traerá de Maicao, municipio fronterizo con Venezuela un país vecino y venderá en Soledad y Barranquilla en el departamento del Atlántico. Son muchos los pedidos que Nubia tiene de sus clientes y  necesita responderles, para conservarlos y con ello lograr que su inversión sea exitosa, porque  tiene pleno conocimiento que le pagarán de contado y a más tardar en la siguiente quincena del mes, como lo han pactado.  
“A las personas en Kiva que me dieron el crédito, les agradezco que confiaran en mi,  yo no los defraudaré” estas fueron las palabras con las que Nubia I.  se despidió de su asesor de Créditos cuando éste fue a visitarla para renovar su credikiva, el cual es el segundo que recibirá.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Nubia Iglesia ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/187901
texts.en:
Nubia plans to use the loan that she is currently applying for to buy food products, cold cuts, clothes and small electrical appliances that she will buy in Maicao, a town on the border with neighboring Venezuela.  She will sell her products in Soledad and Barranquilla, in Atlántico department.

Nubia has a lot of orders from her customers and she needs to fill them in order to retain her customers and ensure that her investment is successful.  She is fully aware that her customers will pay her cash and, at the latest, the following fortnight as agreed.  "I would like to thank the people at Kiva who gave me my loan for trusting in me.  I will not let them down".  These were the words with which Nubia I. said goodbye to her loan advisor when he went to visit her to renew her Kiva loan (the second that she has received).  If you would like to know more about Nubia Iglesia's story, click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/187901

loans.use: to buy cold cuts, food products, small electrical appliances and clothes

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, reside en Sensembra departamento de Morazán, está viviendo con su esposa y cuatro hijas: Zulma de 9 años, Rosaura de 8, Griselda de 5 y Yesenia de 2 años de edad, su familia depende económicamente de sus ingresos, él está dedicado a la granja de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde, aprendió este negocio junto a su esposa, tiene como ventaja principal el buen numero de clientes y sus dificultades es la constante variación en los precios del concentrado.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de concentrados y adquirir más gallinas ponedoras, esto le ayudara en primer lugar a contar con lo necesario para alimentarlos, en segundo aumentar la granja, logrando mayor capacidad para producir y vender a los clientes.
Su objetivo como comerciante es que su negocio sea fuerte, que sus hijas logren aprenderlo y de esta manera este vivo por largo plazo.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and lives in Sensembra, located in the Department of Morazán, with his wife and four daughters: Zulma (9), Rosaura (8), Griselda (5) and Yesenia (2). His family financially depends on his income and he works raising both laying hens and chickens for fattening. He learned this business together with his wife. The primary advantage is the high number of customers and the difficulty is the constant change in the prices of feed.

He currently needs a loan for the purchase of feed and to obtain more laying hens. This will help him to have the necessary materials to feed them and to expand the farm, thus having a higher production and sales capacity.

His goal as a merchant is for his business to be strong and for his children to learn the trade so that it continues in the long term.

loans.use: to buy feed and more laying hens.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús tiene 65 años, su negocio es una pulpería. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este medio de vida diariamente. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan en busca de materia prima, necesario para su negocio. El inicio este negocio con esfuerzo propio, pues ha sido un gran sacrificio el salir adelante, fue hace mucho tiempo atrás de manera muy simple y humilde obteniendo buenos resultados. Este financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, sopas, pan, entre otros.  Con deseos de crecer en la vida realiza su trabajo todos los días.
texts.en: Manuel De Jesús is 65 years old and his business is a grocery store.  He has been working in this business daily for more than 11 years.  Most of his customers come to him looking for supplies.  Manuel started his business through his own effort.  It has been a great sacrifice working to get ahead in life but he has worked simply and humbly and obtains good results.  He will use this loan to buy basic grains, detergents, candies, soups, bread and other products.  He carries out his work every day with the goal of growing in life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, candies, soups, bread and other products

loans.name: Hacia Un Futuro Mejor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Reymundo is the coordinator of his group, Hacia un Futuro Mejor 1 & 2  (To a better future). He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and 3 of their five children. 

Reymundo is excited to be requesting his 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for 8 months, selling miscellaneous products. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying rice, flour and other foods.  His business is a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food.  Normally these colmados are in the neighborhood so that there is only a short walking distance from any home. He will use the profits to proviD. for his home, and to pay for his children's education.  One of his dreams is to see them become professional. 

This Esperanza associate's story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). His group is located in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s most rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, onion, oil, canned products, etc.

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es:
María de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y ropa, reside en San Miguel, junto a un hijo de 6 años de edad, viven en casa propia, ella trabaja en el mercado municipal de San Miguel, vendiendo las frutas y la ropa en un puesto fijo, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre desde que era pequeña creció ayudándole a vender.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como blusas, camisas, short, entre otras prendas de vestir, esta compra es oportuna ya que viene la época donde la mayor demanda las presentan los shorts y camisas, por el verano, dándole a ella la oportunidad de estar preparada para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio y ayudar a su hijo para tenga todo lo necesario y también pueda iniciar ya sus estudios.
texts.en: Maria is 28 years old and lives in her own home in San Miguel with her 6 year old child.  She sells fruit and clothing in a stall at the San Miguel municipal market.  When she was young, she helped her mother selling and learned the business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as blouses, shirts, and shorts, amongst other clothing.  This purchase is important because the demand for these items is approaching and having them by summer will give her the opportunity to meet the demand.  Her goal is to grow the business and help her child to have everything needed to start his studies.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as blouses, shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Irma Lizeth

texts.es:
Doña Irma de 45 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad, es empleada como ordenanza del Órgano Judicial, actualmente tiene la dificultad en su vivienda que el techo ya esta deteriorado y ella no cuenta con los fondos necesarios para reestructurarlo, por lo que esta situación la lleva a solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad necesaria para realizar los trabajos.
Su propósito es adecuar el techo antes de que inicie la temporada de invierno,  ya que sería lo más indicado el tener en las mejores condiciones la vivienda, dando más seguridad a su familia y cuidando todos sus muebles y electrodoméstico por posibles lluvias.
texts.en: Irma is 45 years old and lives in San Miguel with her family, two children aged 21 and 17.  Her residence is used as the office of the Judicial Branch and there is a problem with the roof, which has deteriorated.  She does not have the funds to reconstruct it and therefore, is requesting a loan in the amount necessary to begin construction before the start of winter.  This will provide better housing, giving her family and possessions more security against possible rain.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Lesvia Neris

texts.es:
La señora Lesvia Neris P. H. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el barrio Alto de los Toros de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, ademas vende ropa americana y calzado.
Su pulperia la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitacion, la ropa y el calzado los vende en diferentes colonias y barrios de San Lorenzo.
La señora Lesvia utilizara el credito para comprar abarroteria al por mayor, asi tendra mas surtida su pulperia y generara mas ganancias.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y que este le genere buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesvia Neris P. Hernández, 44, lives in the Alto de los Toros neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo; she sells groceries and also American clothing and shoes.  Her grocery store is located in her home and she sells the clothes and shoes in various neighborhoods of San Lorenzo.

Lesvia will use the loan to buy assorted groceries at wholesale so that her store will be better stocked thus generating more profits.

Her goal is to have her business grow and that it generates good income for better quality of life for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ximena Del Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Ximena Álvarez es socia del banco comunal Virgen de Bronce, vive por el sector de la Convención del 45 en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad está bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, tiene muchos lugares turísticos y su gente es amable, cordial, muy culta y llena de tradiciones.

Doña Ximena tiene 35 años, es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad quien estudia en un colegio de la ciudad de Cuenca. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña. Ximena es profesora de una escuela en donde es Psicóloga Clínica, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 10 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio día.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de material didactico como juegos de rompecabezas, imagenes, folletos, etc. para sus alumnos.

Su meta es tener un Centro Educativo propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ximena Álvarez is a member of the “Virgen de Bronce” communal bank.  She lives around the Convención del 45 neighborhood in the city of Cuenca.  This city is bathed by four rivers and is named Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.  It has many tourist attractions and its residents are kind, cordial, very cultured and filled with tradition.

Ximena is 35 years old, divorced and she has a 15-year-old son who goes to school in Cuenca.  She does not own her house; she rents.

Ximena is a Teacher at a school where she is a Clinical Psychologist.  She’s been in this line of work for 10 years and works half days Monday through Friday.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for a year and will use the loan to buy teaching aids like jigsaw puzzles, prints, pamphlets, etc. for her students.

Her goal is to own an educational center.

loans.use: to buy teaching aids like jigsaw puzzles, prints, pamphlets, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia Ines

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Ofelia  y nos cuenta un poco de su vida, ella tiene 50 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y  de esta unión tiene dos hijos que ya son  mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante de mariscos.

Ella tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de la ciudad de Santa Ana, en el cual prepara varios platos, vende desayunos y almuerzos, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 13h00 con la ayuda de su hija, nos cuenta que  este año empezó en este local por que antes  vendía la comida en su casa, con el crédito anterior adecuo el local y  ahora le va mucho mejor.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos y una parte para comprar pescado para el negocio del esposo. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Nueva Luz” (New Light) communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Santa Ana which is known for its beautiful scenery and beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

We chatted with Ofelia here and she told us a bit about her life.  She’s 50 years old and is in a common law relationship.  From this relationship she has two adult children; one of them still lives with her.  Her husband is a seafood merchant.

She has a small eatery in Santa Ana’s market where she prepares a variety of dishes; she sells breakfasts and lunches.  She works daily from 5am until 1pm with help from her daughter.  She tells us that she started in this locale this year because she used to sell the food at her house.  She used the previous loan to equip her locale and now she’s doing much better.

This loan will be used to buy products needed to prepare her dishes and part of it will be used to buy fish for her husband’s business.  

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are a great help.  Her dream is to continue forward and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for meal preparation and fish.

loans.name: Margen Omar

texts.es:
El señor Margen A. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Independencia de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a prestar los servicios de moler maiz, tiene un molino en su casa de habitacion, el trabajo de Margen es moler maiz y todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para poder atender a sus clientes que son muchos. Margen presta este servicio solo por las mañanas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa para la venta a sus mismos clientes que llegan a su casa cuando van a moler el maiz y tambien piensa salir a vender ropa por las tardes cuando ya a terminado de moler el maiz.
la comunidad donde vive se encuentran los negocios de meloneras y azucareras, aqui hay un buen potencial de clientes para la compra de ropa.
su meta es crecer con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y para su familia.
texts.en:
Margen A. is 36 years old and lives in the Independencia neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. He works providing corn milling services and he has a mill in his house. Margen’s job is to mill corn and he gets up at 4am every day to be able to attend to his customers, of which there are many. Margen provides this service only in the mornings.

He will use the loan for the purchase of clothing to sell to his same customers that go to his house to mill corn. He also plans to go out and sell clothing in the afternoons after he finishes milling the corn. The community where he lives has many melon and sugar businesses, so there is a good potential for clothing sales.

His goals are for his business to grow and to have a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing

loans.name: Francisca Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que además de cuidar a sus hijos y su hogar también se  dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, nos cuenta que ella compra los animalitos, los tiene por un espacio de tiempo suficiente hasta que estén listos y luego  vende los chanchos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y los pollos los vende enteros o por libras  a personas de la localidad o entrega en tiendas en Santa Ana.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para pollos como para los chanchos. Está en el Banco comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
  
Su sueño es tener una granja con tecnología.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Luz Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana. This city is known for its beautiful scenery and beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

Here we met Francisca who is 39 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage who are in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a great housewife who, in addition to looking after her children and the house, works raising chickens and pigs. She tells us that she buys the animals, keeps them until they are ready, and then sells the pigs to merchants that come to her house and sells the chickens whole or by the pound to people in the area or to stores in Santa Ana.

This loan is for the purchase of more chickens, feed, and medicines for the chickens as well as the pigs. She has been with the bank almost since the beginning and she likes the benefits provided by the institution.

Her dream is to have a farm with technology.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicines for chickens and pigs

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo es originario de la localidad de Francisco Serrato, cuenta con 45 años de edad. Él término la escuela primaria y ya no pudo seguir estudiando por que sus padres no tenía la solvencia económica para pagar los útiles escolares ya que tenía mas hermanos pequeños y por eso desde muy chico empezó a trabajar en México ayudándo en un negocio de frutas. Don Gonzalo está casado con la señora Otilia quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y realiza tejidos, bordados en servilletas, manteles, etc., ellos tienen 8 hijos. Él pidió su préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en el negocio de abarrotes, frutas y verduras; él lleva con su negocio de abarrotes y frutas 10 años aproximadamente, diario se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a surtirse a la central de abastos y cada 15 días va a ver a sus hijos menores a Francisco Serrato ya que sus 4 hijos mayores le ayudan a atender el negocio en México. Él comenta que tiene su puesto en la ciudad de México por que en su comunidad se venden muy baratos los productos y en México gana más. El tiene la necesidad de seguir apoyando a sus cuatro hijos menores para que estudien una carrera comenta: “Quiero que se preparen, que tengan una carrera técnica ya que a mis otros cuatro hijos no les pude ayudar a terminar sus estudios porque me tenían que ayudar con los gastos de los menores. Quisiera llevar a mi familia a la ciudad de México pero también me gusta mi pueblo”. Una de sus metas es mejorar su puesto, surtiendo mas mercancía que él no vende, y quiere poner otro puesto para que uno lo trabajen sus hijos mayores y otro él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is originally from Francisco Serrato.  He’s 45 years old.  He finished elementary school but was unable to continue studying because his parents lacked economic solvency to pay for school supplies and he had younger siblings.  Because of this he started working in Mexico City while still very young helping out in a fruit selling business.

Gonzalo is married to Otilia who is a fruit merchant and also knits making embroidery on napkins, tablecloths, etc.  They have 8 children.

He requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in the grocery, fruit and vegetable business.  He’s been in this business for about 10 years.  He rises daily at 4am to stock up at the wholesale market and every two weeks he goes to Francisco Serrato to visit his younger children since his four older children help him tend to the business in Mexico City.  He comments that he has his stand in Mexico City because the products sell very cheaply in his community and he can earn more in Mexico City.

He needs to continue supporting his four younger children so that they will study a career.  He comments:  “I want them to prepare themselves; that they have a technical career since I was unable to help my other four children finish their studies because I needed them to help me meet the expenses of the younger ones.  I’d like to bring my family to Mexico City but I also like my town.”

One of his goals is to improve his stand stocking more merchandise that he currently doesn’t sell; he also wants to set up a second stand so that his older children can run one and he and his wife can run the other one.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Neffer Violeta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Neffer, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada la misma que puede ser de dos a tres meses, también nos cuenta que cría gallinas criollas las cuales se venden a mejor precio que los pollos de granja por su sabor ya que son deliciosas. Ella  vende sus animalitos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y también vende los pollos  enteros o por libras  a personas de la localidad o entrega en tiendas en Santa Ana.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos y alimentos y medicinas para los pollos para que tengan un mejor crecimiento. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco comunal y le gusta por el cumplimiento tanto de las socias como de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener una granja más grande y una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, in the city of Santa Ana, there is a meeting of the communal bank "Nueva Luz" (New Light) members.  The city is known for its beautiful landscape and lovely fresh water spas, which are visited by many tourists.

This is where we meet Señora Neffer, who is 56 years old, married and together with her husband has four grown, independent children.  Her husband works as a driver.

Señora Neffer is a grand homemaker who also makes her living raising chickens.  She has a small farm where she can raise up to 200 chickens per season, which can be two or three months.  She also tells us that she raises Creole chickens, which, because of their flavor, sell at a better price than the Farm chickens; they are delicious.  She sells her poultry to traders who come to her house.  She sells the whole chicken or by the pound to people from the neighborhood, and she delivers chicken to stores in Santa Ana.

This loan is for the purchase of more chickens, chicken feed and medicines to help the chickens reach a better size.  This is her third cylce with the communal bank, which she likes because the members as well as the institution fulfill their obligations.
 
Her dreams are to have a bigger farm and a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed and medicine.

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es: El Señor José Juan tiene la edad de 24 años, es originario de la comunidad de Francisco Serrato en el estado Michoacán, el está pidiendo su préstamo a Fundación Realidad para la compra de frutas y legumbres como plátanos, aguacates, zanahorias, etc. Don Juan tiene su puesto en la ciudad de México, en el mercado de la Merced, desde hace 8 años, pero tiene una experiencia desde hace 17 años ya que él empezó a trabajar en el puesto de sus papás a la edad de 8 años, y comenta que ya no siguió estudiando por ayudarles a ellos. El señor José Juan vive en unión libre desde hace 8 años con la señora Crisanta que se dedica a ayudarle a su marido en el puesto que tienen en el mercado de México, ellos tienen 2 hijos  de nombres Jacqueline de 5 años y Emmanuel de 2 años. Él es una persona muy trabajadora ya que se levanta diariamente a las tres de la mañana para surtirse en la central de abastos de la ciudad de México. Don Juan comenta que ahorita uno de sus retos es terminar su casita que está haciéndole a su familia que poco a poco le ha estado metiendo ya que a ahorrado para hacerlo y gracias a los préstamos, él a surtido muy bien su puesto de frutas y legumbres y así le da mas ganancias y así va poder terminar su casa para sus pequeños hijos. Comenta que sus planes y metas  en la vida es terminar su casita y que espera pronto lograrlo, seguir invirtiéndole a su negocio y poder rentar un local para vender sus frutas y legumbres. El señor Juan dice que con las ganancias que saque de la venta de la fruta va a comprar varilla, cemento, arena y otras cosas más para la construcción y poder terminar su casa.
texts.en:
José Juan, 24, is originally from the community of Francisco Serrato in the state of Michoacán.  He is asking Fundación Realidad for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables like, bananas, avocadoes, carrots, etc.  He has had a stand in Mexico City’s La Merced Market for 8 years and comments that his experience goes back 17 years because he started working in his parents’ stand when he was 8 years old.  He comments that he did not stay in school because he was helping them.

José Juan has lived for the last 8 years in a common law relationship with Crisanta who helps her husband with the stand they have in the market in Mexico City. They have two children: Jacqueline, 5 and Emmanuel, 2.

He is a very hard working person who rises daily at 3am to stock up at Mexico City’s wholesale foodstuffs market.  Juan comments that right now one of his challenges is to finish his house that he’s building for his family.   He’s been investing his savings into it bit by bit and, thanks to the loans, he has been able to stock his fruit and vegetable stand very well which produces more profits.  This way he will be able to finish his house for his little children.

He comments that his life plans and goals are to finish the house, which he hopes to do soon, and to continue investing in the business to be able to rent a locale to sell his fruit and vegetables.  Juan says that he will use the profits he makes from the fruit and vegetable sales to buy iron rods, cement, sand and other building materials to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El señor Anastasio tiene 49 años de edad que es dueño de una tienda de abarrotes. Él quiere un préstamo para comprar productos para su tienda como azúcar, frijoles, huevos, aceite, refrescos, jabón, alimentos enlatados, cloro, velas, y mucho más. Decidió abrir esta tienda de abarrotes hace aproximadamente 2 años por que no había ninguna tienda cerca de su comunidad. Ahora, todos sus vecinos se benefician de su tienda ya que no bajan hasta el pueblo por los insumos que ocupan y no tienen caminar grandes distancias. Además, Anastasio vende vacas, caballos y borregos. 
Él no tiene muchos animales para vender pero los ingresos adicionales ayudan a su familia. El esta casado con la señora Bernardina, también apoya a la familia ya que es costurera y ayuda al señor Anastasio en la tienda de abarrotes. Una de sus metas es vender productos de mercería como agujas, hilos, estambres y telas etc. Así mismo el espera ayudar a una de sus hijas a pagar la escuela de su nieto porque ella es madre soltera. Él está agradecido a Dios por su trabajo y su habilidad para proveer para su familia.
texts.en:
Anastacio is 49 years old and owns a grocery store.  He desires a loan to buy products for his store, including rice, beans, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, soap, canned goods, bleach, candles, and much more. He decided to open this grocery store approximately 2 years ago because there was no store near his community. Now, all the neighbors benefit from his store because they no longer have to go down to town for their supplies and don't have to walk long distances.

In addition, Anastacio sells cattle, horses and sheep. He doesn't have many animals to sell but the additional income helps his family. Anastacio is married to Bernardina who helps the family by doing seamstress work, and she also helps Anastasio in the grocery store.

One of his goals is to start selling sewing products such as needles, thread, woolen yarn, cloth, etc. Also, he hopes to help one of his daughters pay for his grandchild's schooling, because she is a single mother. He thanks God for his work and his ability to provide for his family.

loans.use: TO BUY INVENTORY FOR HIS GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de sus hijos vive en su casa. Este es su segundo ciclo en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, pero nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de damas aunque también elabora camisas y ropa de niños, trabaja bajo pedido de personas particulares y en temporada de inicios de clases también elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde  pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
The members of the “Nueva Luz” (New Light) communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Santa Ana known for its beautiful scenery and beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

We met Rosa, 52, here.  She’s a single mother of two adult children.  The younger of her children still lives at home.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the unity of her fellow members.

She has a small dressmaking shop in her house where she’s been sewing for many years making all kinds of clothes but she tells us that what she likes making the most is ladies clothes although he also makes shirts and children’s clothes.  She works based on prior orders from individuals and during the start of school terms she makes uniforms for the local schools.  She works every day from 6am until 10pm and sometimes even later when she has orders to fill.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other sewing supplies.

Her dream is to have a larger workshop and a store downtown where she can sell her works.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: La señorita Roció vive en  la zona de canal, vive en alquiler es soltera, ella realiza la venta de anticuchos en Cochabamba en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad, ella realiza su venta de lunes a viernes , ella vive con su madre señora mayor  de edad , el préstamo lo invertirá para comprar accesorios de cocina y una parrilla nueva más grande, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora siempre pensando en superase salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, su deseo es el poder alquilar un lugar y abrir su pensión para así poder brindar mejor atención a sus clientes, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en: Rocío lives in the Canal area, is single, and lives in a rented home.  She sells anticuchos (grilled meat kebabs) in Cochabamba on one of the city’s central streets.  She makes her sales from Monday to Friday.  She lives with her elderly mother.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of cooking accessories and a new, larger grill.  Rocío is a young and hardworking person who is always thinking about getting ahead in life and improving her quality of life.  She wants to be able to rent a place and open a guesthouse in order to provide better service to her customers.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy cooking accessories and a new grill

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
El señor Alejo es originario y vecino de la localidad de Francisco Serrato perteneciente al Estado de Michoacán, esta población con unos paisajes hermosos lleno de pinos, donde su principal actividad económica es la artesanía de ocochal, y la compra y venta de animales.
