Don Alejo cuenta con 43 años de edad comenta que él no estudio porque sus papás no tenían los recursos para mandarlo a la escuela, por eso desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa, cuando se caso tuvo que emigrar por varios años a la ciudad de México a la central de abastos como cargador, dice que es un trabajo muy pesado por eso se tuvo que regresar a su pueblo y empezó a invertir en el negocio de compra, cría y venta de borregos, caballos y vacas y así estar más al pendiente de su familia, el empezó con su negocio hace 10 años, él vende sus animales en el mercado de abastos en zitacuaro, y a veces los vende en su misma localidad. Don Alejo pidió a Fundación Realidad su préstamo invertir en borregos para criarlos y después venderlos. Su necesidad es sacar adelante a sus 10 hijos aunque no todos viven con él,  pero los que viven con él estudian y tiene que darles para la escuela y sus pasajes. 
Don Alejo vive en unión libre con la señora María Juana que se dedica a la  hechura de servilletas, y al hogar. Su meta en especial es comprarse una camioneta grande para vender sus animales en otros lugares. Dice que con las ganancias que le queden de la venta de los animales invertirá y comprara mas borregos y les comprara alimento, vacunas y desparacitantes para que crezcan bonitos y venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Alejo is a native and resident of the Francisco Serrato area, which belongs to the State of Michoacán. It has beautiful scenery filled with pines and their main businesses are crafts made from ocochal and the purchase and sale of animals.

Alejo is 43 years old and he comments that he did not go to school because his parents could not afford to send him there. As a result, he began to work when he was very young in order to help with household expenses. When he got married, he had to move to Mexico City for several years to work as a loader at the wholesale food market. He says that it was very hard work, which is why he had to return to his town where he began investing in the business of buying, raising and selling sheep, horses and cows and thus be more aware of his family. He started this business ten years ago and he sells his animals at the market in Zitacuaro and sometimes in his own town.

Alejo requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in sheep to raise and then sell. He needs to get his ten children ahead in life, although not all of them live with him. However, those that do live with him study and he has to provide them with money for school and their transportation fees.

Alejo has a common-law marriage with María Juana who works making napkins and works at home. His goal is to buy a large truck to sell his animals in other places. He says that he will invest his earnings from the animal sales and he will buy more sheep, feed, vaccines and antiparasitics so that they grow well and he can sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy sheep to sell

loans.name: Graciela Del Carmen

texts.es: Graciela Del Carmen tiene 47 años. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdo, hace más de 6 años que sabe de este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven ya que su familia tenía esta misma actividad, y a ella le gustaba ayudar a su familia para que así salieran adelante. Al ver que esta actividad era rentable decide establecer su propio negocio y es así como este negocio le queda a ella para sufragar los gastos de su familia y proporcionarles a sus 2 hijos lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, alimentos, entre otros.
texts.en: Graciela del Carmen is 47 years old.  She has worked buying and selling pigs for more than six years.  When she was young, her family worked in this same business and she liked to help her family so that they could get ahead in life.  Upon noticing that this was a profitable business, she decided to establish her own business and this is how she came to having it as a means to defray her family’s expenses and provide her two children with what they need.  The loan she is requesting is for working capital to purchase pigs, feed, and other items.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and other items

loans.name: Jesefa Alejandrina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Josefa, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de  22 y 20 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad y aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella y su esposo tienen un puesto en el mercado de Santa Ana en el cual venden frutas como melón, sandia, piñas, papayas, plátanos, etc. Trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, nos cuenta que llevan 17 años que se dedican a esta actividad y que les va muy bien, las frutas compran a los agricultores o también en el mismo mercado a mayoristas.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas para la venta. Está en el Banco comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos han sido de gran ayuda.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Luz Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana. This city is known for its beautiful scenery and beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

Here we met Jesefa who is 52 years old. She has a common-law marriage from which she has two children who are 22 and 20 years old. They are in college and still live at her house. Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a stand at the Santa Ana market where they sell fruits like melon, watermelon, pineapple, papaya, bananas, etc. They work every day from 5am to 3pm. She tells us that they have been in this business for 17 years and it has gone well for them. They buy the fruits from farmers or at the same wholesale market.

This loan is for the purchase of more fruits to sell. She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because the loans have been a great help.

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy melon, watermelon, papaya, bananas, pineapple, and all types of fruit

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucía tienen 38 años de edad, es originaria de Francisco Serrato, esta localidad se encuentra en el estado de Michoacán, es una comunidad donde predomina la cultura Mazahua donde todavía las mujeres usan vestimentas e idioma de esa cultura. Doña Lucí está casada con el Señor Antonio García desde hace 21 años.
Comenta la señora Lucía que ella pidió su préstamo para comprar abono y para fumigar sus árboles de aguacate, guayaba y andrinas, su fruta la vende por cubetas en el mercado de Zitacuaro Michoacán, ella lleva con su negocio desde hace 4 años comenta que empezó a vender frutas para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y que también le empezó a poner empeño por que sacaba fruta de sus árboles y para que no se le echaran a perder mejor las vendía. Una meta que tiene doña Lucí es algún día tener su negocio estable en el mercado de Zitacuaro por que se le hace un poco complicado ir a vender su producto a diario y trasladarse con ellos ya que para Francisco Serrato no hay casi Transporte ya que nada mas hay dos salidas al día y eso se le complica, ella sueña con tener algún día un carrito para poder transportar sus mercancía.
texts.en:
Lucía is 38 years old and is a native of Francisco Serrato. This town is located in the State of Michoacán and is a community where the Mazahua culture is predominant and the women still wear the clothing and speak the language of this culture. Lucía has been married to Antonio García for 21 years.

Lucía comments that she requested her loan to buy fertilizer and to fumigate her avocado, guava and sloe trees. She sells her fruits by the pail at the market in Zitacuaro, Michoacán. She has had her business for four years and comments that she began to sell fruit to help her husband with the household expenses. She also began to make an effort because she picked the fruit from the trees and sold it so that it would not go bad.

One of Lucía’s goals is to someday have a stable business at the Zitacuaro market because it is a bit complicated for her to go to sell her products on a daily basis, transporting them from Francisco Serrato. There is almost no transport from the town, as there are only two departures each day, making it complicated. She dreams of one day having a car to be able to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Beatriz  se dedica a la venta de salchipapas un potaje muy consumido en Perú  con su negocio  ayuda a su esposo en la manutención del hogar, ella aprendió este oficio ayudando a  su madre que también tiene un negocio igual, con mucho esfuerzo ella junto dinero pudiéndose comprar  su propio carrito sanguchero, en la puerta de su casa puso su negocio  además de salchipapas también vende hamburguesas, sándwiches, alitas  y pollo broaster. Ella quiere trabajar muy duro para poder tener un local propio sus prestamos son de mucha ayuda para lograr su objetivo esta vez usara su préstamo en la compra de sus ingredientes al por mayor para así aminorar costos en su negocio, Beatriz  es integrante del grupo “LAS AGUILAS “y tiene el cargo de secretaria  son 8 socias que conforman el grupo.

   * BEATRIZ VISTE POLO FUCCIA,es la cuarta de las paradas(derecha)
texts.en:
Beatriz is engaged in the sale of salchipapas (fried potatoes and hot dogs), a very popular dish in Peru. With the earnings from her business she helps her husband in maintaining the household. She learned this business helping her mother, who also had the same business.

With much effort, she has put together enough money to buy her own “carrito sanguchero” (a special cart for frying). She has run her business out of the door to her house. In addition to salchipapas, she also sells hamburgers, chicken wings, and “pollo broaster” (fried chicken with scrambled eggs and fried potatoes).

Beatriz wants to work very hard in order to be able to have her own shop. Her loans have been a big help in achieving her objective. This time she will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her dishes at wholesale and, thereby, decrease the cost to her business. Beatriz is a member of the “Las Aguilas” (The Eagles) group and holds the office of secretary. The group has 8 members.

* BEATRIZ VISTE POLO FUCCIA is standing fourth from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients used to make the meals she sells.

loans.name: Bobbie

texts.en:
Bobbie G. is an independent insurance agent with The Woodlands Financial Group (TWFG) Insurance Services.  Bobbie, who has been in the insurance business for nine years, started her business with TWFG Insurance Services in 2007.  Her business offers personal and commercial insurance lines to customers, including health and life insurance.

Bobbie has two employees who work with her in Corpus Christi, as well as agents in Laredo, New Braunfels, and Lufkin (all cities in Texas).  Until now, Bobbie has relied on referrals and word-of-mouth advertising to bring in business, in addition to networking extensively with local realtors and the Hispanic Chamber of Commerce.  With this loan, she will print and distribute a brochure promoting the services TWFG offers.  Having already established a strong clientele in Corpus Christi, this mail-out will focus on reaching potential clients in nearby towns.  This marketing effort will hopefully generate new business and provide a better understanding of possible new markets.  Bobbie’s long-term goal is to open a second local office, and she will use the response from this mail-out to evaluate potential locations.

For Bobbie, owning her own business means that every day is interesting.  With the insurance industry as competitive and time-intensive as it is, she says that “burn-out” is a major problem for insurance agents.  She thinks that she stays engaged because she is always doing different things.  As a single mother, Bobbie says that owning her own business allows her to set her own schedule.  She loves being able to spend time with her son and attend his various activities.

This is Bobbie’s second loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  Her first loan provided the capital to start her business.  She says that without ACCION Texas-Louisiana’s help, her business never would have survived.

loans.use: to pay for advertising brochures.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia es originaria de la localidad de Donaciano Ojeda, tiene 25 años de edad y nos comenta que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria y que ya no continuo con sus estudios debido  a que sus padres no pudieron seguir apoyándola con los gastos de sus útiles escolares ni con los pasajes ya que se tenia que trasladar a otra población para estudiar la preparatoria. Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 4 años y está pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para comprar maíz, fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y no dañar la tierra, también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de ocoshal las cuales las vende en las localidades aledañas a su población, ella comprará con el préstamo agujas, hilo, jabón para lavar el ocoshal. Comenta que desde muy niña sus papás le enseñaron a cuidar los árboles y las plantas.
Ella vende su maíz en la central de abastos en Zitacuaro, una de las situaciones difíciles que ellos pasan es la falta de agua para regar sus siembras y tienen que rentar una bomba para acarrear el agua. Ella esta casada con el señor Marcelino el cual trabaja como cargador en la central de abastos en la cuidad de México, ellos tienen una niña de nombre Alelí la cual tiene 5 años y estudia el preescolar.
texts.en:
Natalia is from the town of Donaciano Ojeda.  She is 25 years old and tells us that she studied up to the third year of high school but didn't continue her studies because her parents couldn't continue supporting her with the cost of her school supplies nor the cost of transportation to another town where she was studying.

Natalia has been growing corn for 4 years.  She is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad to buy corn and organic fertilizer to feed the soil without damaging the earth.  Natalia also makes handicrafts from ocoshal leaves which she sells in neighboring towns.  She will use her loan to buy needles, thread and soap for washing the ocoshal leaves.  Natalia comments that her parents taught her to care for trees and plants from a very young age.  She sells her corn in the wholesale food market in Zitacuaro.  One of the difficult situations that Natalia experiences is the lack of water with which to irrigate her crops.  She has to hire a pump to deliver the water.

Natalia is married to Marcelino who works as a loader in the wholesale food market in Mexico City.  The couple have a daughter named Alelí who is five years old and attending pre-school.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Denny Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa de 30 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su trabajo ella empezó por medio de una amiga a vende productos de belleza por catálogo ya que pasaba por crisis económica y quería sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella trabaja sola y su horario es variable. Se pasa haciendo llamadas para coordinar con los pedidos de sus clientes y a la vez va a visitarlo para cobrar sus productos que lo deja a créditos.

Con el préstamo ella quiere aumentar más su productividad y comprarles uniformes a sus hijos. En un futuro quiere que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Teresa is 30 years old.  She is a woman who is inspiring in her work.  When she was going through a financial crisis and needed a way to keep her family afloat, a friend helped her to start selling beauty products through catalog orders.

She works alone and her work schedule varies.  She makes calls to coordinate her cusotmers' orders and goes to see them to collect on the products that she sells on credit.

With this loan, Teresa wants to increase her productivity and purchase school uniforms for her children.  In the future, she wants her business to keep growing and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business and school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: El señor Rosalio cuenta con 56 años de edad el se dedica al cultivo de aguacate, al las artesanías de ocoshal, venta de pan que él hace y al cultivo de maíz. El es originario de la localidad de Donaciano Ojeda un lugar lleno de Pinos ya que los vecinos de esta localidad cuidan sus bosques de los talamontes. Don Rosalio está pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para la compra de insumos para el cultivo de Maíz y aguacate como abono, semilla insecticidas y el pago de animales para hacer el arado para preparar la tierra para la siembra. El vende su maíz y aguacate en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro una población cerca de su localidad. El tiene aproximadamente 40 años dedicándose a esta actividad, comenta que su papá fue que le enseño a como cultivar todo tipo plantas. El también hace canastas, fruteros, paneras, alhajaros, jarros, jarrones en ocoshal las cuales el las vende en las localidades aledañas a su población. Dice que a el le enseño hacer este tipo de artesanías su esposa ya que a ella le enseño un maestro que dio una capacitación en su localidad. Don Rosalio esta casado con la señora Rosalina que se dedica a las artesanías de ocoshal, ellos tuvieron 6 hijos ya todos casados. La meta que tiene don Rosalio es terminar de hacer un local para su panadería ya que poco a poco han estado construyendo con muchos sacrificios este local dice que primero empezó con el horno y el espera en Dios que si termine este año su local que tanto sueña.
texts.en:
Rosalio is 56 years old and is an avocado farmer, makes ocochal (small pine leaves) crafts and farms corn.  He is originally from Donaciano Ojeda, a place full of pine trees since residents of this area protect their forests from loggers.

Rosalio is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad to buy farming supplies for his avocado and corn crops like seeds, insecticide, manure and to pay for animals to do the plowing to prepare the fields for planting.  He sells his avocados and corn in Zitácuaro’s wholesale foodstuffs market, a town near his location.

He’s been in this line of work for about 40 years.  He comments that his father taught him how to cultivate all kinds of plants.  He also makes baskets, fruit bowls, bread baskets, jewelry cases, jugs and jars out of ocochal which he sells in neighboring communities.  He says that his wife taught him how to do this type of craft and she learned from a teacher who taught a course in their location.

Rosalio is married to Rosalina who makes ocochal crafts.  They had six children who are all now married.

Rosalio’s goal is to finish building a locale for his bakery that he’s been building little by little with much sacrifice.  He says that he first started with the oven and he hopes to God to finish the much dreamed about locale this year.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for corn and avocado crops.

loans.name: Lilia Fernanda

texts.es:
Lilia de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó hace 13 años preparando panes y dulces en una pequeña panadería.

Ella trabaja diariamente de 8:00am a 11:00pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina amasadora para facilitar la preparación de sus panes y así aumentar sus ganancia para sacar adelante a su familia. En un futuro quiere seguir en su negocio y terminar de adecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Lilia is 34 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has been making bread and sweet treats in her small bakery for 13 years.

Lilia works from 8.00am to 11.00pm every day.  She would like to use her loan to buy a kneading machine in order to facilitate her bread making.  In this way, she hopes to increase her profits and get her family ahead in life.  In the future, she would like to continue in her business and finish fitting out her house.

loans.use: to buy a kneading machine

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

La señora Gloria es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy  fáciles para conseguir. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad que estudian en  escuela y colegio. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveres de consumo en su casa, en la cual vende desde  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  los productos los compra en Montecristi y Manta aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva en su tienda ya por 5 años y que le va bien ya que dia a dia trata de mejorarla.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, perfumes, cremas entre otros productos y otros artículos de primera necesidad.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mi Banquito” (My Little Bank) communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi a city known for the variety of typical products known within and outside the country like its famous "toquilla" straw hats, also known as Panama hats, despite being manufactured in Ecuador.

Gloria is a founding member of the bank and she likes it because the loans are easy to get.  She’s 35 years old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 7 years of age and who go to school and high school.  Her husband is a craftsman working with "tagua" (a nut, sometimes confused with ivory).

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oils, detergents, even Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works daily from 6am to 8pm and sometimes even later.  She buys her products in Montecristi and in Manta although most of her products are delivered to her store.  She tells us that she’s had the store for five years now and does well since she tries to improve it day to day.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, perfumes and creams, among other products and some other basic need items.

Her goals are to continue forward with her business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Lelis Azucena

texts.es:
Azucena de 41 años. Es una mujer trabajadora que se inspiro mediante una liquidación que recibió en su antiguo trabajo de camaronera abrió una pequeña tienda por su barrio. 

Ella trabaja diariamente comienza a las 6:00 am hasta la noche. Lo que le afecta en su sector es la delincuencia ya que cada vez se esta poniendo peligroso. Con el préstamo ella quiere como más productos como arroz cuadernos vitrinas para aumentar sus ganancias y mejora el negocio. 

En un futuro lo que mas desea es seguir adecuando su casa y que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Azucena is 41 years old. She is a hardworking woman who received severance pay from her old job as a shrimp fisher that inspired her to open a small shop in her neighborhood.

She works every day from 6 a.m. until evening. The biggest problem in her neighborhood is the ever-increasing amount of crime. She intends to use this loan to purchase more products such as rice and notebooks, as well as a display counter to increase her earnings and improve her business.

Her greatest wish for the future is to keep improving her house and for her children to have good careers.

loans.use: purchase products such as rice and notebooks, and a display counter for her store.

loans.name: Jazmin Belgica

texts.es:
Jazmín de 22 años, una joven emprendedora que inicio trabajando como empleada en una boutique en el centro de la ciudad, después su padre mediante un préstamo que hizo abrió una pequeña tienda que poco a poco fue creciendo.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente desde las 6:00 am hasta la noche en la tienda de sus padres. Lo que le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que es muy frecuente por su sector y la policía muy poca veces pasa haciendo operativos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, confitería para mejorar la productividad de su tienda. En un futuro lo que más desea es terminar de construir su casa, poner una papelería y ver a su hijo terminar en sus estudios
texts.en:
Jazmín is 22 years old, an enterprising young woman who started working as an employee in a boutique downtown, until her father received a loan that enabled him to open a small shop that has been slowly growing.

She currently works every day in her parents' shop, starting at 6 a.m. The biggest problem for the business is the amount of crime in the neighborhood, since the police don't patrol very often. She intends to use this loan to purchase rice, sugar, and snacks to increase sales in the store. Her greatest wish for the future is to one day build a house, set up a stationery shop, and see her son complete his studies.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, and snacks for her shop.

loans.name: Victoria Monica

texts.es:
Victoria de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó hace 20 años en la venta de lácteos como queso, leche, huevos en diferentes pueblos. Junto un capital y se instaló una pequeña tienda. Es separada tiene tres hijos de 27 ,17 y 10

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente de 6:00 am hasta la noche. Lo que le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que un día asaltaron a un repartidor de cola y cada vez está más peligroso por su sector. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería para su negocio y así aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere mejorar se vivienda y que sus dos últimos hijos terminen la universidad y sean unos profesionales
texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and is a hardworking woman who started to sell dairy products like cheese, milk and eggs 20 years ago in different towns. She saved money and set up a small store. She is separated and has three children who are 27, 17, and 10 years old.

She now works daily from 6am until the evening. What affects her business is the delinquency, as a soda delivery man was assaulted one day and her area is increasingly more dangerous. With the loan, she wants to buy merchandise for her business and increase her profits. In the future, she wants to make housing improvements and for her children to finish college and be professionals.

loans.use: to buy display cases, candy, and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: José, tiene 67 años de edad, es originario de la capital Managua localizada a 3 horas y media de la ciudad de Estelí pero fue criado en este departamento, fue casado, su esposa murió, tiene 12 hijos, los cuales viven aparte de oficio mecánico y también comerciante, estudio hasta  sexto de primaria  pues su pobreza no le permitió seguir estudiando mas. Inicio primeramente con su esposa que comenzó a vender productos alimenticios en su casa de habitación, mientras el trabajaba como mecánico, le ayudaba uno de sus hijos a atender la venta, al morir su esposa el se hizo cargo del negocio. Hoy en día la pulpería es su  medio de subsistencia y renta una casa para ayudarse a mantener el mismo  ya que de  todos sus hijos solo recibe ayuda de uno que vive en Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. Solicito el crédito  para comprar inventario a su pulpería con este crédito espera conseguir mas clientes, tener abastecido el negocio de productos variados, ofrecer un mejor servicio. Tiene planeado comprar un local mas céntrico donde pueda vender todos su productos  ya que el vende en las comunidades cercanas a Pueblo Nuevo en un vehículo   para que la gente tengas mas acceso a productos alimenticios. Tiene como meta próxima abrir una tienda productos lácteos para el municipio de Pueblo Nuevo
texts.en:
José is 67 years old and is a native of the capital Managua, located three and a half hours from the city of Estelí. However, he was raised in this department. He was married but his wife passed away and he has 12 children who live independently and work as mechanics or as merchants. He completed up to sixth grade, but his level of poverty did not allow him to continue studying.

He first started with his wife who began to sell food items at their house while he worked as a mechanic. One of his children helped to attend to the sales and when his wife passed away, he took over the business. Today, the small store is his livelihood and he rents a house, as he only receives help from one of his children who lives in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí.

He requested the loan to purchase inventory for his store. With this loan, he hopes to obtain more customers, have his business stocked with a variety of products, and offer better service. He plans to buy a more central locale where he can sell all of his products, as he currently sells them in the communities around Pueblo Nuevo from a car so that the people have more access to food products. His next goal is to open a store with dairy products for the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at his store

loans.name: Freyda Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 40 años, una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad como enfermera de un hospital, un día con la venta del carro de su esposo decidieron abrir una pequeña farmacia.

Ella trabaja diariamente de 6:00 am hasta la noche su esposo también de apoya en la farmacia. Lo que le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que cada vez es más frecuente por el sector. Con el préstamo ellos quieren comprar productos para la farmacia para así aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere seguir mejorando su casa para así también ampliar su farmacia y darle todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 40 years old and is a hardworking woman who began working as a nurse at a hospital. One day, she and her husband decided to open a small pharmacy after selling his car.

She works daily from 6am until the evening and her husband also helps out with the pharmacy. What affects her business is the delinquency, as it is becoming increasingly more common in the area. With the loan, they want to buy products for the pharmacy in order to increase their profits. In the future, she wants to continue improving her house in order to expand her pharmacy and provide her children with all the best.

loans.use: to buy display cases, pills, and notebooks

loans.name: Segundo Alberto

texts.es:
Segundo de 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que hace dos años abrió una pequeña tienda por que el vive al frente de una escuela y por el sector no había ese tipo de negocio.

Su trabajo lo hace con su esposa en horario de 6:30 hasta las 8:00 pm. Con el préstamo ellos quieren comprar aguas, colas, jugos. Y así seguir produciendo su negocio para sus clientes. En un futuro el quiere hacer su casa de cemento y poner un bar dentro de la escuela que está al frente de su casa para seguir adelante y darle todo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 35 years old. He's a hardworking man who opened a small shop two years ago. He lives across from a school and there weren't any similar business in the area.

He and his wife work in the shop from 6:30 in the morning till 8 at night. They intend to use the loan to buy bottled water, soft drinks, and juices to satisfy their customers' needs. In the future, he'd like to build a cinder-block house and open a shop inside the school in order to improve his situation and provide for his family.

loans.use: purchase bottled water, soft drinks, and juices for his shop.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés de 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad de artesana hace 20 años.

Ella labora de lunes a viernes con su artesanía y los fines de semana son las ventas de la misma. Lo que le afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia  ya que es más frecuente por su sector. Con préstamo ella quiere comprar hierro, bloques, tablas para su negocio. En un futuro quiere construir su vivienda de cemento y ampliar un taller tanto artesanal como mecánico para su esposo y así sacar adelante a su familia en lo que más necesiten.
texts.en:
Inés is 30 years old and is a hardworking woman who began her handicraft business 20 years ago.

She works from Monday to Friday with her handicrafts and sells them on the weekends. What affects her business is the delinquency, as it is more common in her area. With the loan, she wants to buy iron, blocks and tables for her business. In the future, she wants to build a cement house and set up an artisanal and mechanic workshop for her husband in order to get her family ahead where they need it the most.

loans.use: to buy iron, blocks, and tables

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 31 años, es una trabajadora que inicio hace un año vendiendo legumbre un día los cliente del pedían más cosa que decidió abrir una pequeña tienda.

Ella empieza a labora desde las 6:00 a m a 10:00pm todo los días. Le afecta mucho la delincuencia ya que por el sector donde vive es peligroso. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar mas producto para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, cuadernos, etc. Ella en un futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y poner más adelante una papelería con la tienda y así darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and is a hardworking woman who began selling vegetables a year ago. One day, the customers wanted more things so she decided to open a small store.

She begins work at 6am and finishes at 10pm every day. The delinquency affects her a lot, as the area where she lives is dangerous. With the loan, she wants to buy more products for her store such as rice, sugar, notebooks, etc. In the future, she wants to build a cement house and set up a stationery store with the grocery store in order to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and notebooks

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José cuenta con 26 años de edad y es originario de la localidad de Donaciano Ojeda un lugar donde todavía predomina la lengua mazahua, él esta casado con la señora Justina la cual se dedica hacer artesanías en ocoshal. Ellos tienen dos hijas pequeñas de nombres Rosa de 3 años e Iracema de un año.
Don José está pidiendo un préstamo para invertirlo en el cultivo de aguacate, también invertirá un poco en su horno para hacer pan ya que los fines de semana se dedica hacer pan, también nos comenta que le gusta ayudarle a su esposa a realizar y vender las artesanías que ellos realizan de ocoshal. Él tiene aproximadamente 20 plantas de aguacate y su deseo es seguir cultivando este tipo de plantas ya que en buena temporada llega a sacar 200 kilos y los vende en la central de abastos de la cuidad de Zitacuaro. Comenta que una de sus situaciones difíciles es la falta de agua ya que él y su padre tienen que rentar una bomba para jalar el agua desde un arrollo y a veces tienen que acarrear en garrafones el agua para ahorrarse lo de la renta de la bomba. Con este préstamo comprará abono, insecticidas para limpiar sus árboles de los animalitos que se comen las hojas y las flores de los árboles de aguacate, el dice que desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño al cultivo de estos árboles que crecen muy bonitos.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old and originally from the town of Donaciano Ojeda, where the Mazahua language still predominates.  He is married to Justina, who works making Ocoshal handicrafts.  They have two young daughters, Rosa who is 3 years old and Iracema who is one year old.  

José is asking for this loan to invest in the cultivation of avocados.  He will also use some of the money to purchase an oven to make bread, since he works making bread on the weekends.  He also likes to help his wife make and sell her Ocoshal crafts.    

He has about 20 avocado plants and he wants to continue growing this type of plant since in a good season he can get 200 kilos.  He sells them in the wholesale food market in the city of Zitacuaro.  One of the difficult situations he faces is a lack of water.  He and his father have to rent a pump to get water from a stream, and sometimes they carry the water in jugs to save the cost of renting the pump.

With this loan, he will buy fertilizer and insecticides to clean his trees of the animals that eat the leaves and flowers.  José said that his father taught him as a young child how to grow these trees that grow very nicely.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for avocado trees.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Marcelina es originaria de la localidad de Donaciano Ojeda Michoacán un lugar lleno de naturaleza donde todavía predomina la lengua mazahua, ella tiene 43 años de edad, ella no estudio debido a que sus papas nunca la mandaron a la escuela y antes las mujeres no estudiaban porque decían los papas “que ellas nada mas tenían que aprender a las labores del hogar para cuando se casaran estuviera preparada para hacer los quehaceres del hogar ya que antes los hombres eran machistas”. Doña Marcelina esta pidiendo un crédito a Fundación Realidad para invertir en su huerto de aguacates, ya que tiene  planeado comprar mas plantas de aguacate y fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y no dañar la tierra, también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de ocoshal las cuales las vende en las localidades aledañas a su población, La señora Marcelina tiene con su huerto aproximadamente 5 años y con la actividad de las artesanías de ocoshal tiene 4 años, dice que cuando es temporada de cosecha sale a vender el fruto a un cliente que es de Zitacuaro y también en la central de abastos de esa misma población, ella a veces vende por cubetas pero dice que le saca más ganancia si lo vende por bolsa. Doña Marcelina esta casada con el señor Pablo el cual es jornalero, ellos tuvieron 5 hijos pero nada mas dos viven con ellos. El préstamo le beneficiara porque gracias a este podrá darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y podrá mejorar su huerta de aguacate y podrá hacer más artesanías para vender por mayoreo. La meta que tiene la señora Leucadia para la venta del aguacate es seguir dándose a conocer en otros estados para que conozcan sus frutos que se dan en su localidad. Dice que con los ingresos que obtenga de la venta de los aguacates y de la venta del ocoshal seguirá invirtiendo en sus artesanías y en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Señora Marcelina is a native of the town called Donaciano Ojeda in Michoacán.  It is a place full of nature where the"mazahua" language still predominates.  She is 43 years old.  She never went to school because her parents never sent her and because back then the girls didn't study.  Their parents said "girls only need to learn the household chores so that when they are married, they will be prepared to take care of their homes."  Back then, the men were chauvinist.  Doña Marcelina is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in her avocado orchard; she plans to purchase more avocado plants and organic fertilizer to nourish the soil and not harm the earth.  She also earns a living making "ocoshal" (pine needle) handicrafts, which she sells in the neighborhoods that border her town.  Señora Marcelina has been tending her orchard for approximately 5 years, and she has been making her "ocoshal" handicrafts for 4 years.  She says that when it is harvest time, she goes out to sell her fruits to a customer who is from Zitacuaro.  She also sells in the wholesale food market of the same town.  Sometimes she sells by the bucket, but she says that she earns more if she sells by the bag.  Doña Marcelina is married to Señor Pablo, who is a day laborer.  They had 5 children, but only two live with them.  The loan will benefit them because thanks to the the loan they will be able to give their children a better quality of life, to improve their avocado orchard, and to make more handicrafts for wholesale.  Señora Marcelina's goal for selling avocados is to continue making herself known in other states so people will be familiar with the fruit from her locality.  She says that with the earnings from the avocado sales and the "ocoshal" handicrafts, she will continue investing in her handicrafts and in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for farming avocados.

loans.name: Progreso Mazahua Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se encuentra a unos metros de una presa, la gente de esta comunidad Rioyos Buenavista pesca diario, desde las 6 y 7 de la mañana la gente viene a la presa para pescar, la gente comenta que los peces grandes no se dejan atrapar tan facil y llegan a pesar como dos kilos o un poco mas los grandes, pero nesecitan una lancha para ponerse enmedio de la presa y atrapar a los grandes, el Grupo se llama Progreso Mazahua porque dan a entender que el grupo quiere progresar y como es una comunidad Mazahua donde los adultos hablan el dialecto y los niños lo aprenden en la escuela, por eso el grupo desidio llamarse de esta manera, el grupo lo integran 9 personas, 7 mujeres y 2 hombres, en el grupo hay gente que tiene comercio como actividad pero tambien es gente que tiene animales, reces, caballos pollo y borregos, La Sr. Teresa es la encargada del grupo es la representante, ella se dedica al bordado de telas y costuras, hace manteles, abrigos, servilletas, tambien le hace a sus dos hijos su ropa, son chambritas como bulgarmente se le conoce en las comunidades. Doña Teresa tiene 39 años de edad, tiene 9 años de casada y dos hijos pequeños, el mayor va a cumplir 5 años y el menor 2 años, todavia no van a la escuela, su esposo trabaja en el negocio de compra y venta de reces, cria animales. Viven en casa propia y doña Teresa quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gastos en su casa por eso hace bordados para vender, nos comenta que lo dificil en su negocio es buscar los clientes para que compren las costuras eso es un poco dificil porque en la actualidad poca gente se interesa en comprar un arte,"el prestamo me va hacer de mucha ayuda haciendo las costuras y de ahi sale para poder ayudar en los gatos y con las ganancias hacer otra cosa, por ejemplo otro negocio y ver la forma de mejorar y pagar el prestamo, Mis deseos con el prestamo son mejorar y poder sacar provecho de las ganancias". Los nombres de los 9 integrantes son los siguientes:
1.-Zenaida G. R., tiene 60 años
2.-Juana P. R., tiene 54 años
3.-Alejandra L. P., tiene 30 años
4.-Teresa E. M., tiene 39 años
5.-Julia R. A., tiene 69 años
6.-Matilde R. R., tiene 30 años
7.-Norma Angelica H. C., tiene 34 años
8.-Andres I. V., tiene 29 años
9.-Andan E. E., tiene 60 años
texts.en:
This group is located a few meters from a dam because the people from the community of Rioyos Buenavista fish every day.  At 6:00 or 7:00 am, people come to the dam to fish.  They say that the big fish are not easy to trap and weigh about two kilos or more, but they need to take a boat to the middle of the dam to catch them.  

The group is called Progreso Mazahua [Mazahua Progress] because the group wants progress, and they come from the community of Mazahua, where adults speak the Mazahua language and children learn it in school.  The group has nine members, seven women and two men.  Members of the group are involved in trade, but also people who have animals: cattle, horses, poultry, and sheep.

Teresa is the representative of the group.  She works doing embroidery and sewing.  She makes tablecloths, jackets, napkins, and she makes her children's clothes.  Teresa is 39 years old and has been married for nine years.  She has two young children.  The oldest is about to turn five and the youngest is two years old.  They don't go to school yet.  Her husband works buying and selling cattle and raises animals.  They live in their own house.  Teresa wants to help her husband with the household expenses, so she sells her embroidery.  She said a difficulty she has in her business is finding customers who want to purchase her products because few people are interested in purchasing art right now.  "The loan will give me a lot of help making embroidery and from there I can help with the costs and with the income I can do something else, for example, another business and see the way to improve and pay the loan.  My wishes with the loan are to improve and and take advantage of the profits."  

The names of the nine members are:
Zenaida G. R., 60 years old
Juana P. R., 54 years old
Alejandra L. P., 30 years old
Teresa E. M., 39 years old
Julia R. A., 69 years old
Matilde R. R., 30 years old
Norma Angelica H. C., 34 years old
Andres I. V., 29 years old
Andan E. E., 60 years old

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for embroidery.

loans.name: Los Espinales Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Nazaria pertenece al grupo llamado “LOS ESPINALES” comenta que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque donD. ellas viven hay muchos árboles D. espino y por eso le pusieron así al grupo. Ella es originaria D. la localidad D. Macho D. Agua ubicado en el estado D. Michoacán. Doña Nazaria tiene 30 años D. edad, comenta que estudio hasta el quinto año D. primaria y que ya no continúo con sus estudios porque sus papas eran personas D. bajos recursos y no tenían dinero para comprarle las libretas. Doña Naza como es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos se dedica a la cría y venta D. borregos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desD. muy temprana hora del día saca a pastear a sus borregos, a un terreno que tienen donD. ella y su esposo siembran pastura para que coman sus animales, comenta que con el préstamo que esta obteniendo comprara borregos, alimento, vacunas, desparacitantes, vitaminas para que los borregos crezcan rápido y pueda venderlos a un buen precio, ella tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente  2 años y empezó con este tipo D. negocio por que dice que si deja ganancias y son fáciles D. criar y no se les invierte mucho a ese tipo D. animales. Ella venD. sus borregos en su localidad y aveces va a la central D. abastos D. Zitacuaro a ofrecer sus borregos. La meta que tiene doña Nazaria es poderles hacer un corral donD. no pasen fríos sus animales para que no se le enfermen. Ella esta casada con el señor Genaro el cual es jornalero y tienen cuatro hijos los cuales están patrocinados por Visión Mundial, ella dice “Gracias a Visión mundial mis hijos pueden tener una mejor calidad D. vida y también gracias a Fundación Realidad por que así puedo tener una fuente D. empleo y así poder ayudarle a mi esposo con los gastos D. mi casa e hijos”. La Señora Agustina, es parte del grupo “LOS ESPINALES” es originaria D. la localidad D. Macho D. Agua  Michoacán, ella tiene 38 años D. edad y estudio hasta el tercer año D. primaria y ya no continuo con sus estudios porque le ayudaba a trabajar a sus papas y no le alcanzaba para sus útiles que ocupaba en la escuela, y también que su papa le decía “las mujeres nacieron para trabajar en la casa y cuidar a los hijos no andar en la calle según trabajando por eso tienen a sus esposos para que las mantengan”  y por eso no la dejo seguir estudiando. Doña Agustina está pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para la compra D. unos borregos ella quiere incrementar el numero D. animales para así venderlos mas fácilmente por mayoreo, también nos comenta que comprara alimento y vitaminas. Comenta que lleva con esta actividad aproximadamente 3 años y que venD. sus borregos con un cliente D. Zitacuaro que hace babarcoa (comida mexicana). Doña Agustina esta casada con el señor Leonidas el cual es jornalero ellos tienen 5 hijos. La meta que tiene la señora es abrir una tienda D. abarrotes para tener otra fuente donD. pueda sacar dinero para la educación D. sus hijos. Las otras 5 integrantes se llaman Maria Lucia D. Jesús García, Natalia D. C., Rosa Maria V. M., Juana H. M. ellas quieren los préstamos para invertir en  la compra borregos para criarlos y después venderlos.
texts.en:
Maria Nazaria belongs to a group called, Los Espinales, she comments that they named the group that because where they live there are lots of Hawthorne trees and that is why they named the group that.  She is originally from Macho D. Agua located in the state of Michoacan.  Nazaria is 30 years old and states that she only completed 5th graD. in elementary and did not go on any further because her parents had minimal resources and could not buy her the books.
She is known as "Naza" by her friends and neighbors and dedicates herself to raising and selling sheep.  She is a very hard working person and takes her sheep to graze at a very early hour to a plot where she and her husband plant grass for their animals to eat. She states that with the loan she will purchase more sheep, feed, vaccinations, parasite medication, and vitamins so that the sheep grow quickly for her to sell at a good price.  She has been doing this for 2 years and started in this type of business because she says it is profitable and they are easy to raise and you don't have to invest too much into this type of animal.  She sells her sheep locally and sometimes takes them to auction in Zitacuaro.  Nazaria's goal is to build them a shed so they won't be cold and so they won't get sick.  She is married to Genaro who is 38 years old and is a day laborer.  They have four children who are sponsored by Vision Mundial (World Vision).  She states, " Thanks to World Vision my children have a better quality of life and also thanks to Fundacion Realidad ( Reality Foundation) because this way I have a source of employment to help out my husband with household expenses and with the kids."
Augustina is part of the group, " Los Espinales" and originates from Macho D. Agua, Michoacan.  She is 38 years old and studied until 3rd graD. and did not continue her education because she helped her parents out by working and didn't have enough to cover her school expenses; also her dad would tell her, " women were born to work around the house and take care of the kids, not be out in the streets so called "working", that is why they have their husbands to support them.", and that is why he wouldn't let her continue studying.  Augustina is soliciting a loan from Fundacion Realidad ( Reality Foundation) to purchase more sheep and increase her livestock to facilitate their sale in bulk, she also adds that she will be purchasing feed and vitamins.  She has been at this business for 3 years and sells her sheep to a client in Zitacuaro who makes barbacoa ( mexican food ).  Augustina is married to Leonidas who is a day laborer and they have 5 children.  Her goal is to open a store selling groceries in order to have another source she can draw money from for her children's education.  
The other 5 members are: Maria Lucia D. Jesús García, Natalia D. C., Rosa Maria V. M., Juana H. M. and they want the loan to purchase sheep to raise and sell.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and sell later.

loans.name: Camino Real Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Hilda pertenece al grupo llamado “CAMINO REAL” comenta que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque antes le decían así al camino que pasa por su casa y termina ese camino en las ruinas arqueológicas  de Zirahuato, Doña Hilda tiene 46 años de edad, comenta que estudio la secundaria y que ya no continúo con sus estudios porque la preparatoria le quedaba retirado de sus casa y no le alcanzaba el dinero que le daban para los pasajes. Doña Hilda como es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos se dedica a la venta de ropa como blusas, pantalones de niños y caballeros, pants, playeras etc. Ella tiene con este tipo de negocio aproximadamente 15 años y vende su ropa en diferentes localidades como Zirahuato, Benito Juárez, ella ofrece la ropa a amigas y conocidas, las vende al contado o en pagos. Comenta doña Hilda que ella empezó con esta actividad por que es una forma de ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Ella surte la ropa en la cuidad de Toluca estado de México en diferentes tianguis de esa ciudad. Una de sus situaciones difíciles por las que esta pasando es que ha dado en pagos ropa y luego no le pagan y ha tenido perdidas de dinero. Doña Hilda esta casada con el señor Benito el cual tiene una huerta de aguacate, durazno y cultiva flores de gladiola, ellos tuvieron 4 hijos ya todos casados. La meta que tiene doña Hilda es abrir un local en su casa para abrirlo diario y estar al pendiente de su casa. El Señor Gildardo, es parte del grupo “CAMINO REAL” el es originario de la localidad de Puentecillas un lugar muy cerca de las ruinas arqueológicas de Zirahuato, el tiene 49 años de edad y estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria y ya no continuo con sus estudios porque le ayudaba a trabajar a sus papas ya que eran mas hermanos. Don Gil como es conocido por sus amistades está pidiendo un préstamo a Fundación Realidad para el mantenimiento y compostura de un carro de taxi el tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente 14 años y dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo por que conoce a mucha gente y a varios lugares del país, aunque una de las situaciones difíciles por las que esta pasando es que ya hay mucha competencia y abecés no gana mucho auque su esposa le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, también la otra problemática que tubo es que desgraciadamente tubo un accidente y su vehiculo se la descompuso y quiere mandarlo arreglar ya que es su fuente de trabajo. Don Gil esta casado con la señora Maria Ortega la cual es maestra de un jardín de niños, ellos tienen 4 hijos pero tres ya son casados y nada mas una vive con ellos de nombre Yoselin la cual estudia la universidad en Morelia Michoacán. La meta que tiene don Gildardo es sembrar aguacate para hacer una huerta de este fruto y tener otra fuente de empleo para poder darles a su hija la menor una carrera que la respalde cuando este grande.
Los otros dos integrantes se llaman Eloy Sebastián Márquez y Mariela B. Guzmán ellos invertirán sus préstamos en frutas y verduras y tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Hilda belongs to the group called “Camino Real” (Great Highway). She said that they named the group this because this is the name of the road that goes by her house and ends in the archeological ruins of Zirahuato. Mrs. Hilda is 46 years old. She has studied in secondary school but she didn’t finish her studies because the preparatory school is far from her house and she didn’t have the money to pay for transportation. Mrs. Hilda is well known among her friends and neighbors. She sells clothes such as blouses, pants for children and men, bathing suits, etc. She has been doing this business for the past fifteen years. She sells her clothes in different places such as Zirahuato and Benito Juarez. She sells her clothes to friends and acquaintances that pay her in payments or by demand. She started this business as a way to help her husband with the family’s expenses.  She buys the clothes at different outlets in Toluca City in the state of Mexico. One of the difficulties that she has is that her customers pay her in payments but they don’t always pay their payments and she looses the money. Mrs Hilda is married to Mr. Benito who has a small farm where he grows avocados, peaches and also cultivates gladiola flowers. They have four children, all of which are married. Her goal is to open a clothing business in her home that can be open daily. 
Mr. Gildardo is part of the group called “Camino Real”.  He is originally from Puntecillas, a place that is close to the archeological ruins of Zirahuato. He is 49 years old and has completed his studies up to the third year of secondary school. He didn’t finish his studies because he had to help his parents as they had other children to support. Mr. Gil is known for his friendships. He is asking for this loan, from Fundacion Real, for the maintenance and repair of his taxi. He has been driving a taxi for fourteen years. He likes this job as he gets to know many people and places in the country. One of the difficulties that he has is that there is a lot of competition and sometimes he doesn’t earn a lot. His wife helps with the household expenses. The other problem that he has had is that he had an accident and his taxi was damaged. He needs to have it repaired, as it is the way he earns a living. Mr. Gil is married to Maria Ortega who is a kindergarten teacher. They have four children, three of which are married. None of the children live with them. Their daughter, Yoselin, studies at the university in Morelia, Michoacán. Mr. Gildardo’s goal is to have a small farm where he can grow avocados so that he has another source of income. He wants his daughter to have a good career that can support her when she grows up. The other members of “Camino Real” are named Eloy and Mariela. They will invest their loan money in buying fruits and vegetables and buying groceries.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men and children

loans.name: Librada Group

texts.en:
Librada is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default.

Librada is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 1,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Librada joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Librada is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products such as dried goods, can goods, kitchen wares and utensils to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as dried goods, can goods, kitchen wares and utensils for sell to her general store.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.
 
Se dedica a la venta productos Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja tres días a la semana por las mañanas ya que es más fresco y en las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a algunas de sus clientes que trabajan durante el dia y además porque a esa hora su esposo se hace cargo de cuidar a su pequeño hijo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender y que lleva 7 años dedicada a esta labor.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y es la fiscal de pagos del banquito.
 
Sus metas son tener un carro y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Mi Banquito’ has meetings every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi. This city is known for the diversity of local products recognized within and outside of the country, like the well known ‘toquilla palm’ straw hats, also called ‘Panama Hats’ even though they are made in Ecuador. 

There we met Mrs. Gloria who is 32 years old, married and has a four year old son. Her husband is an artisan and works with ivory nut. She sells Avon and Yanbal products like cosmetics, perfumes and ladies’ accessories. She works three morning a week because it is cooler, and in the evenings, because her husband can take care of their son. She sells door to door, takes orders and gives credit to be paid weekly. She has been doing this kind of work for seven years and loves it. 

She will utilize the loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams, jewelry and other products. She has been with the bank since its inception and is the person who oversees the payments at the bank. Her goals are to have a car and to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Liza Abelidas Group

texts.en:
Liza is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidnetal. She is 41 years old and is the group leader of this Four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

Liza is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail business, selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used towards working capital.

Liza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish to expand her business offering. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish for her retail business.

loans.name: Carmen Lucciola

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y dos de 16y 4 años, uno  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que el pueda financiar su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de granos y cereales como por ejemplo frejol, maiz, lentejas, maní, entre otros, trabaja cuatro días a la semana en el mercado de Manta, nos cuenta que su esposo lleva como 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios esto le ha dado para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar lentejas, frejol, maní, maíz, entre otros.

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Mi Banquito’ has meeting every two weeks in the Bajos de Montecristi. This city is known for its diversity of local products recognized within and outside of the country, like the famous ‘toquilla’ palm straw hats, also called ‘Panama Hats’ even though they are made in Ecuador. 

Mrs. Carmen is a founder member of the Communal bank and she likes it because the interests are much lower than at other credit institutions. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. One of them is an adult and the other two are 16 and 4 years old. One is a student. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good housewife and to help her husband with the family’s expenses, she is requesting the loan. He sells grains like beans, corn, lentils and peanuts among some. He works four days a week at the Manta market. She told us, he has been doing it for 15 years and, thanks to God, his work has provided enough to get ahead. 

She will utilize the loan to buy lentils, beans, corn and the like. Her dreams are to have good health and continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, lentils, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Prior to owning her salon, Maria cleaned houses and provided health care services. These were just the means to saving up enough money to open her own business. After getting a job in a salon, she decided it was time to get her own beauty license and open a salon that catered to the Brazilian community. She has built incredibly strong ties within the community and is known for superb customer service. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Maria will be purchasing new equipment for her salon. This will help upgrade her current equipment but, more importantly, it will put her one step closer to future expansion of her salon. Her dream is to expand her spa services and build on the already glowing reputation of her salon. 

In the end, Maria wants to provide herself with the opportunity to grow and have a strong foundation to rely on when she finally decides to retire.

loans.use: to upgrade salon equipment.

loans.name: Romulo Humberto

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

En este lugar conocimos don Rómulo, tiene 34 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 10, 7, 6 y 3 años, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.
 
El tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado Tarqui en la  ciudad de Manta. Trabaja todos los días desde las  3h00 hasta las 10h00, el se desplaza en la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para sus clientes, ellos lo prefieren porque siempre vende un buen producto. Tiene este negocio 8 años y nos cuenta que desde pequeño aprendió esta profesión ya que antes  su papá se dedicaba  a esto.
 
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiarse sin tener que pagar altos intereses.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, the members of the community bank "Mi Banquito" [My Little Bank] meet every 15 days.  That city is known for its diversity of typical products that are known inside and outside the country, for example its famous straw hats, also known as Panama hats, although they are made in Ecuador.

In this place we meet Rómulo, who is 34 years old, married, and has four children who are 3, 6, 7 and 10 years old.  The three oldest study in school.  His wife is a housewife.  

Rómulo has a fruit and vegetable stand in the Tarqui market in the city of Manta.  He works every day from 3:00am until 10:00am.  He works the early shift because the wholesale customers buy the best products and they like him because he always sells good products.  He has had this business for eight years and he learned the business from a young age because his father worked doing this too.  

This loan is to purchase fruits and vegetables.  He has been in the community bank from the beginning and he likes it because the loans do not have high interest rates.

His dream is to purchase land.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Félix

texts.es:
La señora Maria Feliz L. tiene ya mas de diez y siete años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta invertir en remodelas el local, comprar inmobiliario nuevo y comprar variedad de alimentos para la preparación de los guisados que utiliza para la venta de tacos, que vende en su negocio. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio y así dar un mejor servicio a su cliente. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para sacar a su familia adelante ya que en el negocio lo trabajan la señora Maria Félix y su esposo el señor  Tomas Llanas.
texts.en: For more than seventeen years Mrs. María Feliz has been making and selling food. She is requesting this loan in order to remodel her business location. She will buy new furniture and the various ingredients she needs to prepare the fried meats that she uses to make the tacos that she sells. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her business and thereby improve her customer service. She plans to pay off the loan with the earnings from her business. This is also the source of money she has to help her family progress. Both María Felix and her husband Tom work in this business.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and supplies for her business

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old and married, with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Geronima raises crops.

Geronima has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Geronima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer.

Geronima is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia G. is from the village of Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 63 years old. Herminia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Herminia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5125 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Herminia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Herminia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Genny Patricia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

La señora Genny  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 11 y 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el mismo que se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado de Tarqui en Mana. Trabaja todos los días desde las 4h00 hasta las 13h00, sus productos los compra en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas que llegan en la madrugada a entregar a los pequeños comerciantes como él.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque estos créditos son de mucha ayuda para poder seguir adelante en su negocio y así poder llevar el sustento diario a su familia. 

Su sueño es tener su casa bien acabada.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mi Banquito” (My Little Bank) meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi every fifteen days. This city is known for the diversity of traditional products that are known within and outside of the country. One example of this is the famous straw hat called a Panama hat, even though it is manufactured in Ecuador.

Sra. Genny is a founding member of the Communal Bank. She enjoys the convenience of accessing the loans. Genny is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 12, 11, and 2). The two older children attend school. Her husband is a merchant.

Sra. Genny is an excellent homemaker who is requesting a loan for her husband’s business. He sells fruits and legumes at the Tarqui Market in Mana. Her husband works every day from 4am to 1pm. He acquires his products at the same market from the wholesale distributors who arrive at dawn to sell to small merchants like him.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and legumes. Genny has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the fact that the loans have helped her husband’s business move forward and generate daily income for their family. Her dream is to have a well-finished house.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and legumes.

loans.name: Roserielle

texts.en:
Roserielle E. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zambonga del Sur. She is 19 years old. Roserielle is single. To make a living, Roserielle owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing in the local community. Roserielle has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Roserielle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roserielle is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase pillowcases, blankets and other products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roserielle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pillowcases, blankets and other products for sale

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia B. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing service based activities. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating passenger van services. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 13,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase tires and other accessories. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing engine. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
