Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing engine

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Vanesa V. le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas, colocar puerta al frente y pintar su vivienda al frente.
Esta solicitando el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar las mejorar que requiere su vivienda. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una tienda de muebles para el hogar, en el aria de vendedoras. 
Ya que su esposo el señor  Pedro Arturo De La Cruz se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como agente de ventas de una tienda de electrónicos y aparatos para el hogar.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Vanesa V. lacks the protection of windows and a front door, as well as paint on the exterior.

She is requesting a loan since she currently does not have the necessary funds to make the improvements that her home requires. Vanesa plans to repay the loan with the income that she earns from her job at a home furnishings store located in a shopping center.

Her husband Sr. Pedro Arturo De La Cruz is in charge of the family expenses with the salary he earns from his job as a sales agent at an electronics and home appliances store.

loans.use: To pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Byron Vicente

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

Aquí conocimos a Byron, tiene 20 de edad, esta solero y  vive en casa de sus padres, tiene cuatro hermanos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos  ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos las personas pueden poner sus propios negocios y ganarse la vida honradamente.

Trabaja de controlador en un bus de la localidad, pero además en sus tiempos libre se dedica a la venta de edredones y sabanas, nos cuenta que hace seis meses empezó con esta actividad y que aprovecho un crédito para  empezar con este negocio, el mismo que le ha dado buenos ingresos extra. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y labora tres días a la semana cuando no está trabajando en el bus. Nos cuenta que aprovecha las noches para visitar a sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar edredones y sabanas. 

Su sueño es tener una camioneta para trabajar mejor en sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mi Banquito” (My Little Bank) meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi every fifteen days. This city is known for the diversity of traditional products that are known within and outside of the country. One example of this is the famous straw hat called a Panama hat, even though it is manufactured in Ecuador.

It is in this place that one can find Byron. He is 20 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents and four siblings. Byron has been with the Communal Bank for two loan cycles and enjoys the fact that the loans help people manage their own businesses and earn an honest living.

He works as a ticket collector on a local bus, but he also sells quilts and bed sheets during his free time. Byron says that he began this business six months ago and took advantage of a loan to get it started. This has become a good source of additional income. He sells door-to-door three days per week when he is not working on the bus. Byron says that he takes advantage of the evenings to visit his customers.

This loan will be used to buy quilts and bed sheets. He dreams of having a truck so that he can travel and perform his work better.

loans.use: To purchase quilts and bed sheets.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita V. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora  Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Carmelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy was born in 1971, and she is married to Mr. Saret.They have four children, one of whom is a security guard, while the others are attending the local public school. Mrs. Navy sells Khmer cakes and sugar cane juice to earn some profit to support her family. Her husband is a teacher and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice, selling some of the rice and supporting his family with the rest. 

Mrs. Navy has a problem because her field is far away from irrigation systems. In order to improve rice production, she is applying for a loan to buy a water machine and will use the rest of the loan to dig a well. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy a water machine

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer A. is from the village of Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 34 years old. Jennifer is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a business venture in the food sector selling fish. Jennifer has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing nets to be used for fishing. Jennifer takes a post with his fishing boat used to catch fish. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jennifer from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets to be used for fishing

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Del Rosario G. le está haciendo falta pintar y acondicionar su vivienda por el interior y exterior de la casa.
No cuenta con el dinero necesario para la mejorar la vivienda donde vive ella y sus dos hijos quien esta bajo su responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene como empleada de limpieza de unas oficinas. 
Desea el bienestar y la seguridad de sus hijos y ella cuando estén en su casa.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Maria Del Rosario G. is lacking paint. The interior and exterior of her house also need to be remodeled. However, she does not have the necessary funds to make these home improvements. She lives with her two young children who are her responsibility since she is a single mother.

Maria plans to repay this loan with part of the income she earns from her job cleaning offices. She wants to provide for the welfare and safety of her children while she is at home with them.

loans.use: To remodel the interior and exterior of her home.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch K. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Kosal Oem, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have four sons and two daughters. Four are in school and the other two help their aunt sell food in Phnom Penh.

Touch is a weaver. She is requesting her third loan of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving; she will also use part of the loan to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials and repair her house

loans.name: Boun's Group

texts.en:
The eleven people who make up this village bank loan have selected Mrs. Boun to become the village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Boun was born in 1958, and she earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. 

Her husband, Mr. Bo is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has two children: one is a motorbike taxi driver and the other helps with the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn is 45-year-old widow with two children who are studying in the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she  grows rice both to sell and to feed her family. She is also a pig and a chicken breeder. 

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand it. So for this purpose Mrs. Orn is applying for a loan to buy two piglets, ten chickens, pig food, and a cow. The cow will be used for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed, chickens, and a cow

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang B. (in the photo) is 32 years old and his wife, Mrs. Savet Pin, is 42 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for almost ten years and have three children: two sons are lathe operators and their daughter is a garment factory worker.    

Samnang is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Samnang is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for his uncle. 

Samnang’s uncle is also a motor taxi driver. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old and breaks down so he spends a lot of money to make repairs often.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for his uncle

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun, who was born in 1980, is married to Hun. They have two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the youngest is three years old. Aun is a farmer and owns a one-hectare plot of land, where she can grow rice to sell some of rice yield and use the rest of the rice to support her family. Besides farming, she has a lot of free time. So, to improve this condition, Aun is seeking a loan to buy two piglets and a cow for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is a construction worker and he cuts fire wood for selling, too.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and a cow

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo H. (in the picture) is 43 years old and his wife, Chuth Chan, is 34 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2004, and have one young daughter.     

Sambo is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rhoda is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhoda is 42 years old. Rhoda has one child who is in school.

Rhoda has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. Rhoda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a bundle of used clothes to sell.

Rhoda has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Rhoda would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung and her husband, Phoeun, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land, where they can cultivate rice to sell some of the rice yield and use the rest of the rice to support their family. Ung is also a pig breeder. Since her breeding pig is getting older, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Ung is seeking a loan to buy two piglets, and with the rest of the loan, she is going to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of two children who are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: to buy two piglets

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. is currently the head of the group Tunas Mekar Asih. Ni Ketut S. has four children, all of whom are married. She lives with her husband. After getting her fourth loan of 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR), Ni Ketut S. bought 10 piglets at 150,000 IDR per head. S. was ready to buy feed from the sale of pork before. S. is very serious about this business, because with the profits they can meet all their needs. Every day for the kitchen she spends 20,000 IDR and to pay for electricity and water she spends 150,000 IDR per month. Ni Ketut S. and all the group members of Tunas Mekar Asih really hope that MUK will continue to provide loans until the group can actually be independent.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets.

loans.name: Beverly Gil

texts.en:
Beverly Gil is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Beverly Gil is 29 years old and has one child who is in school.

Beverly Gil has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Beverly Gil requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell.

Beverly Gil has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Beverly Gil would like to send her kid to school.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap M. is a security guard. His wife, Chanrotha Run, is a silk weaver. They have been married since 2000, and have three sons. Two attend school and the third is still very young. 

In the past, Sopheap was a motor taxi driver, but he quit the business and he is now a security guard. He commutes to work in Phnom Penh by his motorbike everyday. Unfortunately, the motorbike is old and breaks down and he spends a lot of money to make frequent repairs. Facing this, he wants to sell the old motorbike and supplement money from the loan to purchase a new motorcycle. 

Photo: Mr. Sopheap M. and his wife

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to drive to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting and build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Rorn was born in 1979.  She weaves silk cloth to sell to earn money to support her family.   Her husband, Mr. Voeun, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he grows rice to feed his family.   Although they try to work hard, they only earn a small  income.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Sa Rorn is asking for a loan to buy a breeding cow to start a new business. This couple supports three children who are still too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a water refilling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of bottled water for her water refilling business.

Malo has been in this business for five years. Malo earns more income from softdrinks.

Malo has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing her house and sending her kid to school.

loans.use: to purchase bottled water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chhon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chhon is a married man who was born in 1975.  He was selected to be the bank president of this village group loan by the other members.  The  member of this village loan will use their money to support their different purposes.

Mr. Chhon's wife, Mrs. Meas, is a grocery seller in the local village who is able to earn a small income to support her family. Since this business is going well, Mr. Chhon would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand his wife's business activities. This couple has two children: one is a student and the youngest one is a year old. 

Mr. Chhon is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land which he uses to grow rice for a living.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra was born in 1980 and is married to Mr. Nat.  They have three children who are all still too small to work or study.  Mrs. Ra is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  She is also a pig breeder.  Her husband is a construction worker and a motorcycle taxi driver.   

Mrs. Ra wants to start a new business and needs some money for this venture. To achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.  With the rest of the loan she will also buy one more piglet.

loans.use: buy a cow to start a new business

loans.name: Rup Laxmi

texts.en:
Rup Laxmi S., a 39-year-old married mother of two children aged 23 and 20, established her tailoring business in 2004. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family.

Rup Laxmi has already received and repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, she intends to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Noberto

texts.en:
Norberto D. is 41 years old, married and has two children. His oldest child is 12 years old.

Norberto is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He grows rice that he sells to the people in his community. He usually earns 5,000 PHP from this farming. Norberto also grows pigs in his backyard. He fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sombou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sombou K. (is in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Horn Hay, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter. 

Sombou is a weaver. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for another loan of $250 to purchase a cow for her sister to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her sister

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha is married to Mr. Heal. They have four children who are studying in the local public school and who also help their parents in their businesses.  This couple farms rice for a living.  They own a 3-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell as well as feed their family.   Mr. Heal is also a cake seller. 

In the rice field, they have some problem because their field has infertile soil. To improve their rice production, Mrs. Chantha is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.  Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide for her rice farm

loans.name: Ram Maya

texts.en:
In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.
 
This is 48-year-old Ram Maya M.. She is married and has three children aged 24, 18 and 16.  

In 2005, she established  her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She will use her most recent loan to buy materials for her business.  

In the future, Ram Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Riny

texts.en:
Mrs. Riny R. and her husband, Mr. Bunthan Kim, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have one son and one daughter. All of them are in school. Riny is a weaver, and her husband is a motor taxi driver.

Riny’s sister is a widow. She does not have her own house, and she is living with her father. Riny is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to build a house for her sister.

loans.use: To build a house for her sister

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan I., 57, is a married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 35 years old. 

Susan and her husband are both farmers. She helps in growing crops such as corn and rice. She also helps sell their harvest to the market.

Susan requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies. She hopes to have a sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica D. is 51 years old, married and has eight children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 14.

Veronica is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice and corn for 30 years. She usually earns about 6,000 PHP from this farming. This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Veronica wishes to have a bigger and better house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Pabitra

texts.en:
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. 

Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This is 29-year-old Pabitra G.. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 6.  

In 2007, she established  her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Patan BPW. She is using her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her store.  

In the future, Pabitra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 64 years old, married, and the mother of six children, the oldest 44 years old.  A farmer growing rice and corn that she sells to the people in her community of Banga, South Cotabato, Virginia does her best to support her family. She will use her loan to purchase farm fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Buyankhishig

texts.en:
Mrs. Buyankhishig is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Buyankhishig’s family used to live in Bayankhongor province which is 700 kms away from the capital city and in 1995 they moved to Ulaanbaatar in search of a better life. 

Since 1995 Buyankhishig has been running a meat supply business using her old contacts. She travels to the countryside and buys meat from herders and transports it to the city and sells if to butchers. She has gained a lot of experience in the meat business and she has permanent suppliers and buyers. 

Buyankhishig has managed to buy a plot of land and a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent to live in. Last year she bought a small truck to deliver her products. This time Buyankhishig is applying for a loan to buy more meat products from her suppliers to sell to butchers.

loans.use: To buy more meat in the country to sell to butchers in the city.

loans.name: Sophanran

texts.en:
Mr. Sophanran E. is 37 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sophan Hun, is 31 years old. They have been married since 2004 and have one daughter who is in first grade. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophanran is a car repairman who works in Phnom Penh. His wife is an accountant for a company in Phnom Penh as well. Sophanran is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her children. She is a widow and does her best to support her six children.

Catalina is a farmer and has been growing rice for 20 years. She usually earns about 3000 PHP from this farming. She also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Catalina works hard for her children.

Catalina's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
Mr. You Y. and his wife, Mrs, Srey Yoem Tan, have three children: one son and two daughters. One is in school while the other two are still too young to go. The family lives along National Road Number Six outside Phnom Penh City.

You is a fisherman. His wife sells his catch at the market as well as buying more fish from other fishermen to resell. You is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to carry the fish to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry fish to market

loans.name: Gulsunbubu's Group

texts.en:
Gulsunbubu J. is the leader of this group. She is 58 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two sons; both sons are engaged in cattle breeding. The family lives in a small mining town, Tashkomur, which is in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Gulsunbubu and her husband started to breed cattle a long time ago; they have been in this business almost 21 years. Reselling cattle after fattening they earn 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan the family would purchase a calf for breeding. In the near future she wants to finish building a shed for her cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Norovsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Norovsuren is 41 years old and a farmer. He lives with his wife and three children in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All three children study in secondary school. Mr. Norovsuren has grown up in a herder family and he likes animals. He is a plumber by profession but three years ago he decided to run a farming business. 

He has nine cows at the moment and sells milk to local shops and in the neighbourhood. His wife helps in his business. Last year Norovsuren built a barn for his cows and this year he is planning to buy two more cows to increase his milk output. Norovsuren is a very hard-working, enthusiastic person. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Monoglian nomadic tent.

loans.use: To buy two more cows to increase milk output.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy D., 57 years old, and her husband, Mr. Seun Sum, 59, live on an Island on the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have nine children, five sons and four daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, three are security guards and other three are in school.

Dy sells scarves, cotton and silk fabrics, and mosquito nets. She buys them from the weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces far away from her house. Her husband is a farmer and a carpenter who builds houses.

Dy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her sons who work as security guards to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sons to get to work

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is a married woman living in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. She is 65 years old and has seven children.

Enriquita is a farmer. She primarily grows rice to sell. She also grows vegetables that she sells as well. Enriquita works hard to build her business. She wants to be able to support her family financially.

Enriquita's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sagynbu's Group

texts.en:
Sagynbu N. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of a small mining town, Tashkomur, which is located in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 38 and married to a taxi driver. Together they are bringing up two children. The older daughter studies at school and the second child is a newborn. 

In order to earn additional money to meet family needs, 15 years ago with an initial investment of 2,000 KGS, the family started to breed livestock.  With money received from the loan, Sagynbu will purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she plans to start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry P. is 38 years old and married with two children, aged 8 and 14. 

He is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn that he sells to people in his community. He usually earns about 3,000 PHP.

Jerry needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. He requested a loan so that he can buy these. He wishes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sdeng

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sdeng (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Eam, live in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school. 

S. is now a rice farmer. Her husband is an electrician. She is requesting a loan of $300 to reinforce her house's foundation.

loans.use: to reinforce her house's foundation

loans.name: Chhun Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun Ly was born in 1967 and she is married to Mr. Sieng Ly. They have eight children: one is a driver earning a low salary, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others attend the local public school. 

Mrs. Chhun Ly is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice.  She sells part of the rice harvest and uses the rest of the rice to support her family. Her husband is a construction worker. Currently she wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money. So Mrs. Chhun Ly is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou S. (pictured above) is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Thout Srun, is 36 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have two sons. One is in school and another one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six outside Phnom Penh. 

Chanthou is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a driver. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital to her sister to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: to provide capital to her sister to purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily B. is a hog-grower in Surallah, South Cotabato. She sells the hogs to the people in her community. She also grows bananas and sells the fruit as well. Lily also makes an income out of providing general alteration and tailoring services to her community.

Lily has requested a loan to purchase feed, cloth and other tailoring materials. She hopes to have a stable business so she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and also cloth and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L. is 60 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Linda does her best to support her children.

Linda is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 30 years. She usually earns about 3,000 PHP from this farming. 

She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes for her harvest to increase.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul A., 30, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the Jalalabad region. Together with her husband, who works in construction, she is bringing up two children. Both children are preschool age (under seven). 

Six years ago, with an initial investment of 6,000 KGS, Jazgul and her husband started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening them, they earn 5,600 KGS per month. At the moment, they are breeding 19 animals, and with money received from the loan, Jazgul will purchase some more farm animals in order to increase the number of livestock. In the future Jazgul hopes to build a bigger house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth C. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. That Chan, live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children – one son and four daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment factory workers and another one is a construction worker.
Sareth stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband's and children’s salaries. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Mrs. SoV. V. is 39 years old and her husband, Mr. Bunthin But, is 40 years old. They have been married since 1993 and have five children. They live in a small village on National Road Number 2, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
SoV. and her husband are farmers. Besides farming, Mr. Bunthin But is also a construction worker. SoV. is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase neighboring land to expand her property and buy a water pump to spray her rice farm.
The photograph shows Mrs. SoV. V. and her young son peeping out behind her.

loans.use: to purchase neighboring land and a water pump

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
57-year-old Lutgarda lives in Surallah, South Cotabato, with her family. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 37 years old and the youngest is 22.

Lutgarda is a farmer and primarily grows rice to sell to her community. She also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them as well.

Lutgarda's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en: Cholpon U. is the leader of this group. She is 37 and married to a tax inspector. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Cholpon sells stationery at the market. She started this business a year ago with the initial investment of 20,000 soms. Now she earns 8,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase a computer and furniture for her home. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more stationery in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, Cholpon plans to purchase a container in order to expand her business activity. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase stationery

loans.name: 25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
To N. T. (303145) is a 34-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa. To is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa (25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa).

To is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, To operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL.. To has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2004, To joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. To has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by To from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. To plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  V. T. Loan (143) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

2.  L. T. Thanh (17) is a 55-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  T. T. Khoi (36) is a 56-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  T. T. Be (97) is a 57-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  L. T. Dau (112) is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


To N. T. (303145) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa.  To là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa (25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  To thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, To kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND.  Vào 2004, To đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  To đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  V. T. Loan (143) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  L. T. Thanh (17) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  T. T. Khoi (36) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  T. T. Be (97) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  L. T. Dau (112) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim L. (shown in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Hean, have been married since 1988. They have two sons and two daughters. One of the children weaves silk at home and the others are in school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Lim is a silk weaver. Her husband is a wooden house builder. They are also rice farmers. Lim hopes to continue her silk weaving business because it is a traditional professional business. Therefore, she is asking for another loan of $500 to purchase silk materials.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Burul N. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married. Her husband works at a brick factory. Together they are bringing up two sons and a daughter; the first son is married, and the daughter studies at university. The second son is at school. 

 Six years ago Burul’s husband got salary in the amount of 3000 soms. With that money they bought two livestock animals and since that money the family has been breeding livestock. Reselling livestock animals they earn additional 2500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Burul would purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she wants to expand her business activity, save some money, and start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old, married and has two children. He lives in his own house in the urban part of the José Leonardo Ortiz district of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. His community is small yet shows many signs of development.

For more than five years, Jorge has earned a living by providing passenger transportation services in a taxicab and a "mototaxi", a unit that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for carrying people. Currently, he rents both of these vehicles. Jorge has requested a loan so that he can make urgent repairs to the air-conditioning and the muffler in his taxicab. With these repairs, he will be able to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can provide excellent service to his customers and continue generating income. For this reason, Jorge has requested a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Jorge’s taxi service has been quite profitable and he plans in the near future to purchase his own taxicab, which will be the start of a small fleet of cabs he hopes to own and manage. Jorge is very hard-working and responsible. He has had loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and repaid his debt on time. Thanks to his past loans and the income from his business, Jorge was able to purchase a small plot of land where he constructed his house. His greatest wish is to continue growing his business so that he can continue improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the muffler and air conditioning in his taxicab.

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of six people. They have selected Mrs. Sem to be the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living.
Mrs. Sem is 39 years old. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land, which she uses to grow rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells fertilizers and earns a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers for resale.
Mrs. Sem is a widow with two children, both of whom are students and also help their mother in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for resale

loans.name: Zaida's Group

texts.en:
Zaida U. is the leader of this group. She is 24 and married to a teacher. Together with her husband she is bringing up a two-year-old son. Zaida works as a teacher at school as does her husband. She is also engaged in retail trade. Three years ago she saved money from her salary, added some additional savings and with the initial investment of 18,000 soms she started her business. 

At the moment she earns 10,000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to expand her business, a purchase a piece of land, build a big house, and purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Наботова Мехринисо проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Мехринисо занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кроме того она занимается вышивкой разных рисунков и цветочек. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mehriniso N. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is in Russia. Mehriniso works sewing traditional dresses. She also embroiders different patterns and flowers. She has been doing this work for two years. She is taking out a loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Justo German

texts.en:
Justo is 33 years old and single. He lives in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area in the region of Piura, approximately 4 hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque. For more than three years, Justo has managed a business in which he rents out a concrete mixer and other industrial construction tools that he owns to clients, including to the municipal district of Tambogrande. 

Justo would like to make repairs to and purchase spare parts for his concrete mixer. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this investment, he will be able to continue responding to the requests of his clients, which will allow him to continue growing his business and generate a respectable income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the concrete mixer that he rents out to clients.

loans.name: Bisalima

texts.en:
Bisalima works in a very successful fabrics sales business. She operates a sales location where she offers a selection of stylish and colorful fabrics for sewing national women's dresses that are always in demand. 

Bisalima’s business has a long history. She was able to start this new venture by accessing a loan. Since that time, her business has done quite well. She earns approximately $300 in profit each month. Bisalima has requested an additional loan to give her more working capital.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and maintain his corrals

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mr. Sophy C. (in the photo) is 29 years-old and his wife, Mrs. Hai Sieng, is 23 years-old. They live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have two young daughters.
  
Sophy is a wooden house constructor, while his wife stays at home and does house work. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where he lives.

texts.en:
Elmira I., the treasurer of this group, is 38 and divorced. She takes care of her three daughters by herself; two daughters study at school and the youngest daughter is preschool age (under seven). As a supervisor Elmirai earns 6000 soms per month, and as a livestock breeder, an enterprise she started four years ago, she earns an additional 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she will purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Elmira wants to provide her children with a good education.

loans.name: Kallayan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kallayan H. (pictured with her young daughter) is 29 years old and her husband, Mrs. Nueam Dy, is 33 years old. They have been married for almost two years. They have a young daughter. The family lives approximately 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
Kallayan stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He installs cell phone applications and MP3 and MP4 players as well as selling SIM cards and phone cards. People purchase a certain amount of minutes for their cell phone, and when they use up their minutes, they return to the store for another phone card.
Kallayan is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase additional SIM and phone cards for her husband to resell.

loans.use: to purchase additional SIM and phone cards for her husband to resell

loans.name: Nazmiddin

texts.en: Nazmiddin is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Khujand, Tajikistan. Nazmiddin sells good-quality bedclothes and towels in the central city market. His vending kiosk is well-known in the market for a wide assortment of goods at affordable prices. Nazmiddin started his venture eight years ago. He is hoping to expand the assortment of his goods and is requesting a loan of $2,500 USD. His perfect credit history with IMON International proves his integrity and capacity to repay the current loan. We believe Nazmiddin’s ability to transform his business into what he wants it to be and make profit in the process will lead him to ultimate success in the venture. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Nargiza works in a barber shop. She started working there a year ago, and her monthly salary is 3,000 KGS. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase an additional hair clipper. In the future, she dreams of opening her own barber shop.

loans.name: Kaldyk's Group

texts.en:
Kaldyk N. is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she has raised seven children: two sons and five daughters. The sons study at university and the daughters are at school.  

In order to earn additional money to meet family needs, the family breeds livestock. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 3,000 KGS, they purchased two farm animals and since that moment they have been breeding livestock animals. 

With money received from the loan, Kaldyk would purchase more livestock. In the future, she wants to see her sons get married, enlarge a shed and then build a house for her children.

texts.en:

She is a farmer and has been growing rice for 30 years. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month from this farming. 

She requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Lydia works hard to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en: Mairamkul O. is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and a son. The first daughter works as a teacher at a school and the other children study at school. Mairamkul herself works as a teacher too. Ten years ago, she got a salary in the amount of 10,000 soms and that money she spent on purchasing cattle. Since that time, the family has been engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan, Mairamkul would purchase some more farm animals for breeding. In the future, she hopes to purchase a vehicle for her family. Where Did This Loan Come From? loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
42-year-old Melinde is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 10. All of her four children go to school.

Melinde is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She grows rice that she sells to people in her community. She also raises pigs that she sells as well. Melinde works hard to build her business. She wants to be able to sustain her children's education. She wishes for bright futures for them.

Melinde's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and feeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and feeds

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 56 years old and married with six children. Amparo works very hard to provide for them.

Amparo runs a buying and selling of spices business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spices to sell.

Amparo has been in this business for 26 years and sells a variety of items such as onions, garlic, tomatoes etc. Amparo also earns income from renting a chainsaw. 

In the future, Amparo would like to finish her house.

loans.use: To purchase spices to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Davlyatmo

texts.ru: Ёрмадова Давлятмо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 32 года. Не замужем. Образование-среднее. Работает на рынке "Саховат". Она занимается торговлей. У себя дома готовит разные национальные блюда (манту, атола) а потом продает на рынке. Еще она продает прохладительные напитки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Целью кредита является покупка продуктов для приготовления других видов блюд.
texts.en: Davlyatmo Y. lives in the town of Kulob. She is 32 years old. She is not married and has secondary education. She works on the market Sahovat where she does sales. She makes different types of national dishes at home such as mantu, atola and then sells them on the market. She also sells cold drinks. She has been in this business for eight months. The purpose of the loan is to buy ingredients to make different kinds of dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making different types of dishes

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en: Natalina is currently in a business of selling beer and soda. She is 50 years old and married to a policeman. They have five children, three of whom go to school. Natalina requested a loan to stock more beer and soda to sell. She hopes to build a house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more beer and soda to sell.

Anita has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 37 years.

Anita aspires to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Flora has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, bread, vinegar, salt etc. Flora also earns income from buying and selling frozen products.

In the future, Flora would like to be able to send her child to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock.

Alicia has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from photography.

texts.en: Abdurakim O. lives in the Kulob region. He is 41 years old, married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker and children are very young. Abdurakim provides services by having an eatery where he works as a cook. He has been in this business for twenty years. He is taking out the loan to buy a trestle-bed.

Bernardita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock.

Bernardita has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from being an MSE, AVON, JTY dealer.

Mildred has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years.

Inocencia is 43 years old and married with three children.

Inocencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock.

Inocencia has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Inocencia aspires to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in a business of selling groundnuts paste (peanut butter). She is 38 years old and married with four children who go to school. Mary requested a loan to stock more groundnuts paste to sell. She hopes to build a house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more groundnuts paste to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Nelly is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Nelly is 48 years old. 

Ma. Nelly has an ice cream making business in the Philippines. Ma. Nelly requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials to make an additional ice cream box and repair a bicycle.

Ma. Nelly has been in this business for 31 years.  In the future, Ma. Nelly would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make an additional ice cream box and repair a bicycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Erenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Erenia has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from a piggery.

Erenia aspires to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Umoja Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
She is 38 years old and a stickler for diligence as regards the day to day running of her small Pub business in Walukuba estates in the metropolis of Jinja. Needless to say, this kind of business undertaking comes with a lot of cutthroat competition, given the high alcohol consumption levels in most urban areas in Uganda, Jinja being one of them. 

Aware of that fact, N. Hanifa, a happily married mother of five, has worked tirelessly to establish her own niche and to get into the good graces of not only new, but old and prospective patrons. Her Pub offers a wide variety of beverages. 

Hanifa says she began this business with a paltry capital base in the amount of 20,000 UGX. In the course of time, however, she has been able to make significant headway. Monthly she says she makes profits to the tune of approximately $63. She is requesting this loan to purchase more crates of both soft and hard beverages to resell at the Pub. Hanifa is affiliated with the Umoja Development Group.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and married with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the purchase of additional products to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Erlinda's aspirations are house renovation and the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of additional products to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 54 years old.

Helen has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and ingredients for food for her eatery.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Helen would like to expand the business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and ingredients to make food for her eatery

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is currently in a business of selling soft drinks. She is 27 years old, married to a policeman, with 3 children and 2 of them go to school. Lona borrowed a loan to stock soft drinks to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock.

Josephine has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 16 years and also earns an income from livestock.

Josephine aspires to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun K. (shown in the photo) is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Vutha Hieng, is 37 years old. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1994 and have four children – two sons and two daughters. Three of the children are in school and the other is still young.
Sophoeun and her husband raise fish at home. In addition, Mr. Vutha Hieng is a fisherman. Sophoeun hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.use: to purchase additional baby fish to raise

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 40 years old and married with two children in school. Ma. Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Ma. Cristina has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, noodles, sardines, curls, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to send children to school.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Family issues matter to Luzviminda M., 39, as much as matters pertaining to her own business. Minda, as she is called by friends, reached only high school and fervently wishes that her children will reach farther than she did. She is married to Ronald, a vendor. They have five children. Two are in high school, another two study in elementary, and the youngest is not yet of school age. They used to live in Pangasinan, but at present the whole family resides in Libertad, Pasay City.

Aside from the profits of their tricycle operations which go to their family's needs, Minda focuses on her food stall as another primary source of income. Everyday she prepares breakfast and snacks as part of the menu, serving the customers who are too busy to prepare their own meals or those who stay on the road too long and do not have enough time to go home to eat. Minda has her own space in the community's public market, and she has sold from there for thirteen years now. Ronald helps her with the daily tasks. Every month they are able to earn around $320.

To help her expand her food stall, Minda is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use this money to purchase necessary ingredients for cooking, such as cooking oil, coconut, eggs and brown sugar, as well supplies such as spaghetti noodles and macaroni. Minda recognizes the big help the loan represents in her business, as it helps her augment her family's needs with increased profits.

According to Minda herself, daily sales become low during the rainy season. Another challenge to her comes as the result of her child's early marriage. This child of hers was not prepared to establish a separate home, and still lives with them. Minda prays that her child and her son-in-law will find a decent job to support themselves. For her other children, she prays that they would fulfill her dream of seeing them graduate from college. Minda wants to see her business grow and have good sales daily. She also dreams of having her own commercial space. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Meakra

texts.en:
Mrs. Meakra P. (pictured with her daughter) is 30 years old. She has been married to her husband, Mr. Yee Yen (26 years old), since 2005. They have one young daughter. They live in a village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Meakra and her husband are rice farmers. Mr. Yee Yen is also a lathe operator. Meakra hopes to supplement her family's income by starting a new business selling groceries when she is not at the farm. So, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 54 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a boarding house & fish vending.

Ma. Fe aspires to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old and a married woman. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato, with her family. She is engaged in farming. She grows rice to sell to the people in her community. She also opened a sari-sari (variety) store five years ago. She sells various products such as sugar and noodles.

Myrna has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She wants her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 49 years old and married with five children.

Clarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Clarita has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from a piggery.

Clarita aspires to expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
