Kai (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1974 in Lome, the capital of neighboring Togo. She now lives in Calavi on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She and her husband Cyniaque support their three children, all of whom have received their education.

Since the age of 11, Kai has helped in a general store and she now runs a stall selling various household and personal goods. This loan will enable her to purchase bowls, shoes and tissues from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to increase her scope of products. Her strongest point as an entrepreneur is her ability to satisfy customers.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, shoes, and tissues for resale

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a young woman from Hebron. Hiba lives with her family. The family owns a farm where they raise goats and use their milk in making cheese and other products. 

Hiba took out a loan from FATEN to purchase two goats to add to the ones they already have in order to increase their milk products.

Hiba who is photographed with her brother in the picture here is from Hebron which is famous for agriculture.

loans.use: to enlarge their herd by purchasing two goats.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe DANAYA  de l’association SAMBALAGNON sont  des femmes  toutes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali.) 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé. DIALIA D. fait le commerce de pomme de terre dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  4 sacs et demi de 100kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Médine de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants Sikasso.
Elle les revend au grand marché de Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croître.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group DANAYA of the association SAMBALAGNON are all married women averaging 36 years of age and two children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in OUAYERMA I, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They are on their second loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loan has been repaid.

Ms. DIALIA D. does commerce in potatoes in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy 4½ hundred-kilo sacks potatoes. She gets her supplies at the Médine market in Sikasso City and in the villages surrounding Sikasso. She sells them at the big market of Sikasso City and at the family house. She accepts cash from a customer base composed of women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 27,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to cover the loan interest, and the other part will be put into savings. 

Her ambition is to increase her turnover to further satisfy her ever-growing customer base.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is married and has one child who is still underaged.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jamila has been operating a tailoring business for the past four years from a shop where local residents are her potential customers. In addition to the tailoring shop, she also operates a boutique to contribute to her income. Jamila faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the festive season she gets a lot of clients and earns more profit from the business. She dreams of establishing a boutique and dressmaking school in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 60,000 Jamila wants to purchase bundles of leso’s and cloth materials to sell. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase leso’s and cloth materials to sell in her shop

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés.
KIA B. fait le commerce de légumes dans ce groupe de femmes BENKADI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  3 sacs de 100kg de concombres, 6 sacs de 100kg d’oignons, 4 paniers de tomates fraiches,  3 sacs de 100kg de choux pommés. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville et environnants. Elle les revend au marché de Mancourani I dans la ville de Sikasso, à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKADI solidarity group are married women who average 36 years of age and two children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Mancourani I, a popular district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).
This is their ninth loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. Previous loans were correctly repaid.

KIA B. is a Benkadi group member who sells vegetables. With her loan, she plans to buy three 100 kg bags of cucumbers, six 100 kg bags of onions, four baskets of fresh tomatoes, and three 100 kg bags of cabbage. She buys her stock in the city of Sikasso and surrounding areas. She conducts her sales at the Mancourani I market in Sikasso, at a fixed location, and also from her home. She sells for cash to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan, pay the interest, and boost her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 46 years old and married with four children.  Two of the children are in school. Sally works very hard to provide for them.

Sally runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Sally has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sardines, curls, candies etc. 

Sally would like all her children to finish a college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 53 years old and married with three children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from her carinderia/eatery and coffee shop.

Yolanda aspires to expand her business and to do business repairs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.ru: Aybaniz K. ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Aybaniz rodilas v 1966 qodu. Ona jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi detmi i mujem. Ona uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom vipechki xleba. etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey babushki kotoraya toje zanimalas etim biznessom. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit muku i druqiye nujniye produkti dlya vipechki xlebov "tandir".
texts.en: Aybaniz K. is married and has two children.  She was born in 1966. She lives in Baku with her husband and children.  She has been working as a baker for ten years.  She started this business with her grandmother who also did this.  Now, she needs 2000 AZN to buy yeast and flour, which are necessary to make tandir bread.

loans.use: to buy flour and yeast to make bread

loans.name: Mugoma Feed The Family Group C In Kyenjojo

texts.en: Mary I. is the leader of Mugoma Feed the Family, group C, in Kyenjojo. She is 45 years old and married, with 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. Mary has a produce business where she deals in maize, beans and ground nuts.  She works with her 30 year-old son. She has a grocery store in Mugoma and she has been in business for 20 years. She is able to make 140,000/= as monthly profits, in addition to the fresh foods that she also sells. She started her business by growing maize on her father’s farm and she is happy that now she has her own land.  Her dream is to be able to educate all her remaining children to University, as well as open up another retail shop for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans and ground nuts for increased stock.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
ASSETOU T. fait le commerce de fruits dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  4 paniers d ‘oranges, 20 régimes de bananes, 5 cartons de pommes, une trentaine de papayes. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville et environnants. Elle les revend au marché de Mancourani I dans la ville de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the Danaya group are all married women who are 36 years old with 2 children each. They live in polygamous families in Mancourani, one of the most popular quarters of Sikasso town (the third largest administrative region of Mali). They are on their ninth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation in order to better meet their customers' demands. Assetou T. is a member of the Danaya group and sells fruit for a living. She intends to use her loan to purchase four baskets of oranges, 20 bunches of bananas, 5 crates of apples and around thirty papayas. She sources her goods from Sikasso town and from the neighbouring areas, and re-sells them at the Mancourani market in Sikasso, as well as selling to her family. She takes cash sales from a customer base is made up of men and women. She aims to generate average monthly profits of 65,250 FCFA; some of this will be used to pay back her loan and its interest, and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: To purchase fruit

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a married man with a 7 year-old child. He is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice crops. Efren sells his harvest to the people in his community. He owns cows that help him in tilling his land. Efren works hard to build his business. He wants to be able to provide all his family's needs.

Efren requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Efren hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn  is 44 years old and married with two children.  One of the children is in school.  Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock for her general store.

Jenelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, sardines, sugar, curls etc. 

In the future, Jenelyn  would like to expand her business and have her house repaired.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en: Theogene is 29 years old and single. He owns a store in which he sells shoes, suitcases, fabrics, etc.  He has owned this business for 7 years. He is requesting a loan to buy suitcases and fabrics for his business.  With the profits, he plans to create some savings.

loans.use: to buy suitcase and fabrics.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe is a single woman with one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. For the last five years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells various items to her neighbors. She also sells charcoal, and dreams of expanding both of her businesses in the future. She has applied for this loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell to her customers. She joined Yehu to get loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans,  3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
AMI K. fait le commerce de poisson dans ce groupe de femmes.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une 55kg de poissons ( 20kg de frais et 35kg de fumés). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché de Hamdallaye de la ville  de Sikasso, et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The six members of the Danaya group are married women, 38 years old on average, with three children each. They live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the most popular quarters of the town of Sikasso (in the third largest administrative region of Mali). They are on their eleventh loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of better serving their customers' needs. All previous loans have been successfully repaid. Ami K. is a member of the group and sells fish for a living. She aims to use her loan to purchase 55kg of fish (20kg fresh, 35kg smoked). She sources her goods from the large market of Sikasso, and sells them at the Hamdallaye market in Sikasso, as well as to her family.  She takes cash sales from a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate average monthly profits of 32,000 FCFA, some of which will be used to pay back her loan and the interest, and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Jeneian

texts.en:
Jeneian is married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeneian is 34 years old. 

Jeneian has a machine shop business in the Philippines. Jeneian requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her machine shop.

Jeneian has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jeneian would like to improve her business and for her children to finish with a college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her machine shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: 050422 - Trung Trieu - Hoang Phong Group

texts.en:
"Hoa L. T. (1) is a 60 year-old femaL. living in the town of H. hoa - Thanh hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong (050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong).


Hoa is married and has 2 adult children.  Hoa operates a family member's specialized retail store selling internet connection & services.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Manh L. T. (4) is a 47 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Them L. T. (26) is a 44 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Giang H. T. (27) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Tham L. T. (2) is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Hao L. T. (3) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa L. T. (1) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. hoa - Thanh hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong (050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các dịch vụ kết nối internet trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Manh L. T. (4) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Them L. T. (26) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Giang H. T. (27) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Tham L. T. (2) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Hao L. T. (3) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Jennifer

texts.en:
Ma. Jennifer is 36 years old and married with one child. Her child is currently going to school.  Ma. Jennifer works very hard to provide for her.

Ma. Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock.

Ma. Jennifer has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, rice, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, curls, candies, shampoo, toothpaste etc.

In the future, Ma. Jennifer would like to improve her business and for her daughter to finish with a college education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hima Agahikaine Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: K. Boniface is the leader of Hima Agahikaine group in Kyenjojo. He is 42 years old and married with 6 children, all of them in school. Boniface has a retail shop in Munobwa that deals in household items. He works together with his wife and sells to residents in Hima. Boniface is able to make 200,000/= as weekly profits and he also has another business of tea trading. He has been in the business for over 13 years and he started with accumulated savings from selling produce. His dream is to be able to put up a wholesale shop in Fort Portal. He has bought land as a result of using loans. He needs a loan to be able to increase stock in his shop.

loans.use: To pay for buying more sugar, soap, cooking oil and other household items to increase stock.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 41 years old and  lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her children attend a secondary school. Tuvshinjargal rents a bar that she has been running since June 2010. She employs three workers. She invested in the pub by renovating it last year. 
Tushinjargai has a good reputation in the area and her number of customers is increasing. More and more people and organizations are coming to her pub to have a party. She is planning to add some new meals to the meal menu and to change the outside view by replacing the bar name and logo. The loan  will be used to buy some kitchen utensils, to renovate the outside of the pub and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils, redecorate the outside  of the pub and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Finagnon Misséssinto Group

texts.en:
The Finagnon Misséssinto group consists of 4 long-standing friends who live in the same neighbourhood of Calavi, on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their second loan with ALIDE. They have agreed to support each other in business and through loan repayments.

Honorine (with her hand raised in the photo) is 35 years old and lives with her husband Ludovic and their three children, all of whom are in education. For the past 10 years Honorine has been selling cosmetics from a stall outside her home. This loan will enable her to purchase perfumes from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business.  Her strongest point as an entrepreneur is her management ability.

loans.use: purchase perfumes to resell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 18 years old.

Josephine is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She grows rice that she sells to the market. Josephine also raises pigs in her backyard. She sells the pigs as well. She has requested a loan to purchase seed and fertilizer. Josephine works hard to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: 050420 - Trung Trieu - Hoang Phong Group

texts.en:
"Yen  L. T. (9) is a 45 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa.  Yen  is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 050420 - Trung Trieu - Hoang Phong (050420 - Trung Trieu - Hoang Phong).


Yen  is married and has 2 school-age children.  To making a living, Yen  operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL..  Yen  has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Yen  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Yen  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 9th loan taken out by yen from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Yen  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nhan N. T. (11) is a 52 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Giang L. T. (12) is a 52 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Huong N. T. (31) is a 33 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nga L. T. (10) is a 39 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Ninh L. T. (44) is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Yen  L. T. (9) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa.  Yen  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 050420 - Trung Trieu - Hoang Phong (050420 - Trung Trieu - Hoang Phong).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Yen  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Yen  kiếm được khoảng 5,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Yen  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Yen  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nhan N. T. (11) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Giang L. T. (12) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Huong N. T. (31) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nga L. T. (10) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Ninh L. T. (44) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mr. Soeun was born in 1956. He is married to Mrs. Yoeun and they have four children, one of whom is a Korean teacher, while the others attend a local public school. Mr. Soeun is a village chief and his wife is a farmer who owns a 3.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells some of the rice and uses the rest for her family. In addition to farming she is a pig breeder, too. In the rice field, they have some problems because the field is infertile, has a lot of insects and is far from the irrigation system. So to improve its condition, Mr. Soeun is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Zhirair

texts.en: Zhirair O. keeps a cattle farm and cultivates land. Unable to save money from the income that quickly goes to cover his daily costs, Zhirair has applied for the loan from SEF to increase the number of cattle. The increased profit will eventually help Zhirair to have his own place and start his own family. Currently Zhirair is sharing a roof with his brother and sister-in-law.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Minavarkhon

texts.ru:
Минавархон Абдирахмановой 57 лет, замужем, образование среднее, супруг Минавархон фермер. В селе Карасуу (юг Кыргызстана), где ранее жила Минавархон со своей семьей, они  занимались животноводством  и земледелием -  выращиванием  овощей и хлопка, но, к сожалению, в связи с небольшим наделом земли,  прожить на доход от урожая стало очень тяжело. 
Так как многие родственники Минавархон переехали в Чуйскую область (северная часть страны), семья Минавархон также в 2002 году, продав дом и скот, переехали в село Петровка (Чуйская область), где купили дом и сарай с условиями для содержания скота. В  первые годы переезда семья Минавархон испытала трудности - не было возможности расширить хозяйство, устроиться на работу, но со временем они  арендовали 1 га земли и занялись выращиванием помидоров и перца. Получив свой первый кредит в сумме 20.000 сом (KGS), Минавархон купила  корову и стала получать прибыль от продажи молока. Со временем жизнь семьи наладилась – ее сын Бахтияр помогает своим родителям во всем,  а Минавархон воспитывает двух внуков и очень счастлива.  Сегодня в хозяйстве Минавархон имеется дойная корова, два бычка на откорме, также арендованные 3 га земли с помидорами, перцем, арбузами, которые она реализует на местном рынке.
Минавархон  запрашивает кредит в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  для покупки дойной коровы и запасы кормов. В будущем, она планирует расширить хозяйство и мечтает купить машину. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Minavarkhon A. is 57 years old, married, and has a secondary education.  Her husband is a farmer. Minavarkhon lived with her family in the village of Karasuu (in the south of Kyrgyzstan). They worked in animal husbandry and agriculture, cultivating vegetables and cotton.  Unfortunately, the income produced by their small plot of land was very difficult to live on.  

Since many of Minavarkhon’s relatives moved to the Chuysky area (in the northern part of the country), in 2002 Minavarkhon’s family also sold their house and cattle and moved to Petrovka village (in the Chuysky area) where they bought a house and a barn to keep cattle. Right after moving, Minavarkhon’s family had problems.  They could not expand their farm or find a job, but in due course they rented one hectare of earth and grew tomatoes and peppers. After taking out her first loan for 20,000 som (KGS), Minavarkhon bought a cow and began to make a profit selling milk. Over time, the family’s life has changed.  Her son Bahtiyar helps his parents in everything, and Minavarkhon is raising two grandsons and is very happy. Today, on Minavarkhon’s farm, there is a milk cow, two calves being fattened, and also three hectares of rented land growing tomatoes, peppers, and watermelons which she sells in the local market.

Minavarkhon is asking for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a milk cow and a stockpile of feed.  In the future, she plans to expand the farm and dreams of buying a car.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widow with two school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household goods like sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat. In addition she also operates a livestock business which is her other source of income. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, a sack of sugar, maize flour and frying fat. Luvuno decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, a sack of sugar, maize flour and frying fat.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en: Myagmardorj is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. All of his children are married and he lives with his wife in a rented house on a small plot of land. His wife works for a small clothing making factory and she makes leather coats at home in addition to her job. They have an average standard of living. Myagmardorj has a group of people who make construction parts such as floors and windowsills. He has established his own LLC and is trying to expand it. He has been doing construction work for several years that he has his own customers now. He is a polite and hardworking person who says, " I have bought a house with land and I need to fix it". He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.en:
The Fifa group of three entrepreneurs are all friends who have stalls in the same market in Calavi, a district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments.

Agnes (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1968 in Cotonou. She moved to her current location seven years ago, and now lives with her husband Barnabé and their children, all of whom are in school.

For the past 10 years Agnes has run a stall selling clothes in the Akassato market. This loan will enable her to purchase clothes in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market in the heart of Cotonou. She claims to be determined in her approach to business, and always seeks to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Srim

texts.en:
Mrs. Srim was born in 1980 and has two children who are studying in a local public school. She got married to Mr. Lay. She weaves silk cloth for selling. Besides this, she owns a general store in her local village where she can sell groceries to earn some profit to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow rice; some to sell and some for the family. 

She wants to buy a new plowing machine because in their field, it is time for plowing. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Srim is applying for a loan to buy a new plowing machine to plow the field; she will also rent this machine out to other farmers. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy a new plow machine to plow her field

loans.name: Lavella

texts.en: Lavella P. is 35 years old, married, and has two children. They live in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Lavella is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice to sell. Lavella also manages a store that has been running for a year. She sells biscuits, canned goods, and other products.Lavella is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sroem

texts.en: Mrs. Sroem was born in 1943. She is a widow who lives with five other members of her household. She is a rice cake seller who is able to earn some profit to support her family. In addition to this business she is also a chicken breeder. Currently, she has a problem because her house does not have a well to use. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Sroem is applying for a loan to dig a well. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy more rice cakes for resale.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena T. is a 34 years old and married. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice. Lorena sells her harvest to the market. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells items like biscuits and chips. Lorena is requesting a loan, which will be used for her farm to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Lorena hopes for her businesses to prosper in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Mrs. SarO. was born in 1981.  She is married to Mr. Chhoeb, who is also pictured.  The couple has three children:  two study at the local public school, and the youngest one is 2 years old.

Mrs. SarO. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice.  She sells part of the rice, and with the rest of the harvest, she supports her family. She also sells Khmer cakes. Mrs. SarO. has had some problems with the rice field because the soil is infertille and the field is far away from irrigatiO..  To improve her rice productiO., Mrs. SarO. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband is a well digger who also earns some money to support the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Missessinto Group

texts.en:
The Missessinto group consists of 3 entrepreneurs who have agreed to support each other in business and in loan repayments. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Euphrasie (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1965 in Calavi, a district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She moved to her current location 6 years ago, where she lives with her husband James and three of their six children, all of whom are educated.

For the past 28 years Euphrasie has run a general store outside her home in Calavi. This loan will enable her to restock various items such as soap and coal. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business. She says that she has good management ability in her approach to business.

loans.use: to restock the store

loans.name: 050120- Bac Hai - Hoang Phong Group

texts.en:
Sam H. T. is  48 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. They live in the town of H. hoa-Thanh hoa.  Sam is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 050120-Bac Hai-H. Phong.

To making a living, Sam operates a family member's general store.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Sam has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Sam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,616,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This  will be Sam's second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Sam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the other borrowers in the group:
1.  Thuong L. T. is 41 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Ly L. T. is 46 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Thu L. T. is 54 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

4.  Loi L. T. is 47 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

5.  Mai L. T. is 38 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 47 years old and is a married woman with two children. Her children are aged 22 and 18. Marianita is a farmer. She grows rice that she sells to the people in her community. She also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them as well. Marianita earns her living from these activities. She works hard to improve her earnings because her children are in college.

Marianita's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to earn better to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aulelerie

texts.en: Aurelia is 65 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 13 and 19 years old. She sells Irish potatoes, small fish, flour etc. She has done this business for six years and it has enabled her to meet her needs and her family’s needs. She is requesting a loan to buy more Irish potatoes, fish and flour for her business. With the profits she plans to open up a shop.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes, fish, and flour.

loans.name: Rafis

texts.ru: Rafis rodilsya v 1973 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Rafis A. yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy, detmi i materyu. Rafis uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom pochinki mashin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti i instrumenti dlya pochinki mashin. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy toje zanimayetsya etim delom.
texts.en: Rafis was born in 1973. He is married and has two children who go to college.  Rafis A. is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Fuzuli region who now lives in Baku with his wife, children, and mother.  Rafis has been repairing cars for six years.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy needed parts and tools to repair cars.  He started this business with his uncle who also does this work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools

loans.name: Naidansuren

texts.en:
Naidansuren, 38, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on the outskirts of the city. He is a skilled carpenter and makes wooden products to fill custom orders. In addition to his carpentry business, he operates a food shop with his wife. They started the shop with a working capital of 300,000 MNT and their current working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT.

 They want to expand their business and enlarge their shop. Naidansuren is a very hard-working and honest person who is trying to build everything by himself. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more foodstuffs for the shop.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a young man from Bethlehem. He works in a bakery at $300 monthly salary.  Marwan was always interested in music and putting together music for parties of friends and relatives, and he wants to become a professional DJ.

Marwan took a loan from FATEN to purchase DJ equipment and start marketing his work to perform at parties and weddings. This business will ensure a good income for Marwan, who appears in the picture here.

loans.use: to purchase DJ equipment.

loans.name: Mary Bell

texts.en: Mary Bell is a married woman with a 10-year-old child. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato, with her family. Her husband works as a farmer. Mary Bell owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like detergent soap and biscuits. She also sells gasoline. Mary Bell has had the store for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase items like canned goods and noodles. She hopes for her store to grow.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity N. K. is thirty four years old. She is married to a businessman and they have two children aged five years old and two years old whom they hope to give good education to the university level. Her business is located at the busy Gikomba market in Nairobi. She owns a mobile phone accessories shop in which she sells chargers, batteries and other accessories to the local people. She has been in this business for five years now and has managed to employ one person. 

Charity says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of mobile phone accessories to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and in the future become a wholesaler of mobile phone accessories. She describes herself as aggressive, honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: Mobile Phone accessories

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg, 30, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own on the outskirts of the city. Two of her children go to a local school and the third child goes to a kindergarten. 

Her husband works as a miller and Naranchimeg sells beauty products. She began selling cosmetics and stationery in 2006.  She rents a stall at a local market and her current inventory is worth 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She purchases cosmetics and stationery from China twice a month. She is a hardworking and modest person. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT in order to increase her working capital and purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice. She sells her harvest to the market. Aside from farming, Melba also makes and sells chorizo and dried fish to the people in her community. Melba said she has to find ways to provide for her family's needs since farming isn't really enough for them.

Melba's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her family to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
48-year-old Merlyn is a married woman with 3 children. Her children's ages are 24, 21 and 14.

Merlyn raises pigs to earn a living. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Merlyn also grows cassava and sells cassava root crops. Merlyn works hard to support her family.

Merlyn's loan will be used to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 48 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her chidren's ages are 22, 21 and 10.

Myrna is a farmer and primarily grows corn. She sells her harvest to the market. Myrna also loves to cook and is now earning from her canteen. Myrna wishes for her business to prosper. She also hopes to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

Myrna's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and cooking ingredients such as oil and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cooking ingredients such as oil and vegetables

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with his family. He has 2 children aged 24 and 22.

Nelson is a farmer. He plants and harvests rice and corn crops. He sells his harvest to the people in his community. Nelson wishes to have a stable business. He wants to be able to provide for all his family's needs.

Nelson has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Humura Cb Group

texts.en:
Humura group is made up of 22 people. All the members of that group are very hardworking and they all have small scale businesses. Most of the group members have shops in which they sell several items which are commonly used at home such as salt,soap,sugar etc.

Farida is the group president, she has 4 children who are between the ages 7 to 23 years old. She is 43 years old and her husband is a driver. She sells charcoal and she is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal. With the profits she plans pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en:
Karlen A. is 35 years old, and he lives with his parents in Geghamavan village, in the area of Sevan. 

Karlen works for the police and at the same time he is engaged in farming. He has 13 years of experience in animal breeding and land cultivation. Karlen raises cows, calves and sheep at his farm, and he also grows potatoes and grain. Karlen’s parents help him in his occupation and thus they solve their family’s needs.

Karlen is asking for a 1.000.000 Armenian drams loan to repair the cow barn and to buy some calves for his farm. This is Karlen’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to repair cow barn and to buy some calves for his farm

loans.name: Raimjon

texts.en:
B. Raimjon is 59 years old and he is married with three children. Raimjon has been in the business of selling cows for over 6 years. He buys them from villagers and from the nearby province to raise for reselling to abattoirs and farmers. His wife has been a fruit seller for two years. Raimjon is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase additional cows to raise for resale. This loan will allow him to better provide for his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
O. Mavjuda is a 50 year old woman. She is married and a loving mother of 3 children. Mavjuda is a market vendor. For the last 15 years she has sold cottonseed oil at the local market.  In the traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil, especially our national dish “Pilaw” which needs lots of cottonseed oil in order to be delicious.

So, the goods that Mavjuda sells are popular and in demand among the population. Today, Mavjuda is planning to increase her business. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $1,100 USD. Mavjuda thanks you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cottonseed oil in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Khumidin

texts.en:
Khumidin lives in Kurgantube, Tajikistan. He is married and lives with his parents. He started his business 4 years ago. His career began with his father and the business investment he received from his father. His father works as a butcher.

Khumidin buys cattle from Kurgantyube, Yavan, Jomi and Khuroson markets. Khumidin believes that that the profit from the resale of the cattle is greater than from the fattening of cattle, as well as providing a constant turnover. Khumidin would like to get a loan of 4,000 Somoni to purchase cattle, to expand his business.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr: Jean Marie Vianney M. est agriculteur de légumineuses, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il est marie, il 5 enfants entre 11 ans et 4 mois, trois d ses enfants vont à l’école, il est  né au Rwanda, et Jean Marie a fini ses études de 6 ans primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour paiement de main d’œuvres et achat de semences, alors il augmenter la récolte qui est aussi sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire (agriculture).  Il voudrait être éleveur  d’une vache moderne, et pour la vie, il voudrait occuper sa famille, construire une maison pour eux, et aussi éduquer ses enfants jusqu’au niveau universitaire.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney M. is a pulses grower, and client of ACB since 2008. He is married with five children ranging in age from 4 months to 11 years old. Three of them go to school. Jean Marie was born in Rwanda, and he completed six years of primary school. 

He will use his loan to pay for labor and to purchase seeds, which will help increase his crop. This is Jean Marie’s business growth strategy. In the future, he would like to become a modern cow breeder. In the long term, he wants to take care of his family, build a house for them, and provide his children with a university level education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Todjikhon

texts.en:
Todjikhon is married and a loving mother of three children. She produces and sells bakery products. She started her own business with a small production and then she brought her family in to her business. Today, Todjikhon works with her family together in this business. She has been in this business for 12 years. She produces her baked goods at home in a special place.

Todjikhon would like to get a loan of 7,500 Somoni to purchase a large quantity of flour to expand the assortment of her products.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen O. and his family are all engaged in agriculture. Currently Karen and his wife and children all share  one house with Karen’s parents, grandparents and Karen’s brother’s family. Karen’s dream is to provide his immediate family with a house of their own.

As a starting point to this dream, Karen is planning to increase the number of cattle he raises.  This should increase the family’s profit, and allow Karen to start saving for the future.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Vugar

texts.ru: Vugar A. 23 qoda, on ne jenat. Vugar jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoim bratom. Vugar okonchil shkolu i kolledj posle cheqo srazu nachal rabotat tak kak on xotel uje jit samostoyatelno. Ranshe on rabotal prodavcom v raznix magazinax, no uje 2 qoda kak otkril svoy magazin qde on pradayot smeshannie tovari. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovar(Gazeti, jurnali a takje fanari, lampochki i t.d) dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Vugar A. is 23 years old and single. Vugar lives in Baku city with his brother. Vugar finished school and college and then started to work and live on his own.   He used to work as a salesman at different stores, but two years ago, he opened his own shop selling various goods.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy goods for resale, including newspapers, magazines, flashlights, light bulbs, etc.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is married and a loving mother of five children. She lives in Kurgantube, Tajikistan with her husband, children and mother-in-law. Dilorom works hard, because she wants to improve her life. She is engaged in animal husbandry. Her husband sells car spare parts at the market and he helps his wife in his free time.

Mostly, Dilorom buys a cow with a newborn calf. Then, once the cow stops giving out milk, she sells the cow and keeps the calf.  She sells milk to private entrepreneurs, who produce dairy products. Dilorom would like to get a loan of 7,900 Somoni to purchase young cattle. She is hoping to further develop her business with this additional assistance.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael M. is a married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores while Raphael goes out to run their milk sales business. They have three children aged between thirty and twenty-five years old. He owns a milk sales business in which he sells milk to the local people. His business is located at the busy Kongowea market in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region in Kenya known for tourist attractions.

Raphael has been in this business for fifteen years now and has managed to give employment to two people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more milk to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that in future, he will own his farm with cows from where he will be able to get milk. He also plans to buy a van for transporting milk. He describes himself as a very ambitious man.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a 35 year old lady. She is married and a mother of three children who are 16, 10 and 2 years old. She runs a salon, and also operates a grocery and a retail shop. She joined Faulu Kenya after she was introduced by a friend. Since then, she has become more focused in her business.  She has also learned how to save her money. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy cereals and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cereals and cosmetics

loans.name: Asyl

texts.en:
Asyl E. is 55, married, and has two daughters. She worked as a nurse for a long time but her wage was too low to cover the expenses of her children. For this reason, in 1990 she engaged in a business of breeding cattle. Starting with the initial capital of 5,000 KGS she managed to develop a farm with two milk cows and fifteen sheep. With the revenues from selling milk and meat products, she was able to pay for the education of her elder daughter who dreams to be a designer. 

Asyl has applied for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase more cattle. It will allow her to further broaden her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.en:
Abdusamat lives in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan. He is engaged in trading tablecloths and towels. His mother helps him with his business. He is a very active and attractive person, which attracts customers. Abdusamat has been in this business for 2 years. He purchases his goods from the Dushanbe, Korvon market. He has many regular customers, because he has a large assortment of goods.

Abdusamat would like to get a loan of $1,350 USD to purchase new quality Turkish products, which will attract more new customers and expand his business.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy quality tablecloths and towels for expansion of his business.

loans.name: Serge

texts.en: Serge G. runs a general store in Darbas village in the Syunik region. Village people don’t have bank accounts, and Serge pays cash to his suppliers. Village life is quite challenging, and many customers are not able to pay during the purchase. So Serge offers them the goods on credit. To increase the turnover, Serge needs to stock up on the most popular goods, and eventually expand the business. In the future the additional profit will help Serge to renovate his house and pay education fees for his three children.

loans.use: to stock up on the most popular goods

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.en:
Ulmas is 47 years old. She is married and she has three children. Her husband works as a builder. She is a hardworking woman who trades in the market winter, summer and autumn slippers. Ulmas buys the goods from the Dushanbe, Korvon market.

She has been in this business for 20 years. She has a good location in the central market and her products sell well, and she often travels to buy new goods. Ulmas would like to get a loan of 6,500 Somoni to purchase new goods for expansion of her business and commodity circulation. Her greatest wish for the future is to keep improving her house and for her children to have good careers.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy slippers

loans.name: Mekhak

texts.en: Mekhak A. is a minibus driver between three villages in the Syunik region. The bad roads badly affect the bus. To insure the bus runs safely, Mekhak needs to make some car repairs. Once that is done Mekhak is planning to expand his business by adding more villages to his service map. The additional income in Mekhak’s family with two children is really needed. Mekhak’s service will positively affect the village people, helping them reach their destinations safely, and on time.

loans.use: to pay for car repairs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 41 years old and married with three children. He sells scrap metals for recycling. He has been engaged in the business for seven years. He also rents out his piece of land to earn more income.

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to provide for his family without straining. He hopes to grow his business so that he may become financially stable in the future. He has requested a loan of 70,000 Kes to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M. is a widowed man and has five children aged between thirty-four and eighteen years old. He owns a grocery store in which he sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. His business is located at the busy Mkomani market in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region in Kenya known for tourist attractions.

Julius has been in this business for eight years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more vegetables to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that in future, he will grow his business and own a pick-up to better his business. He describes himself as a very faithful man.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a steamer, flat iron and other beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for his master’s degree

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is married and a father of two children. He is engaged in the business of animal husbandry. He has been in this business for a year, and the money invested in his business was earned in the Russia Federation.

After buying young cattle, he feeds them during two or three months and when they gain weight and become larger he sells them at a reasonable price. All of the money which he earns he provides for his family’s needs. Alisher’s purpose is to develop his farm and therefore he is seeking a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy young cattle for his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: Harutyun G. lives with his wife and son in Karakert village. Together with his son, Harutyun looks after the family’s cattle and cultivates the land. With his previous loan from SEF in 2007, he purchased cattle. Unfortunately, due to a cattle disease, a great number of the cattle died and Harutyun’s economy suffered a lot. With the current loan, Harutyun is planning to purchase cattle feed and seeds to cultivate his farm.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Ta-Kilie-Su Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-Kilie-Su” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatu M..  Fatu is age 37; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a teacher and one of her children is attending primary school while two are in secondary school. For eight years now, Fatu has been selling sweets, sugar, cigarettes, soap, water, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy sweets, sugar, cigarettes, soap, water, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 57-year-old father of one daughter and three sons.  Husam grows seasonal vegetables and herbs in his land. Husam has been working on his land for 20 years.

Husam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase fertilizers and seedlings to increase the variety of crops and thus his sales. Husam appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 34 year old single mother. She runs a salon so as to provide for her three year old child. She also operates a mobile-phone money transfer business. She has employed two people to assist her in the business, and hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to add a float to the mobile phone money transfer business.

loans.use: to add float to the mobile phone money transfer business

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 32 years old, and her children are between the ages of 9 months and 11 years. She sells food stuffs, including fruit. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Курбонов Икромчон житель Вахдатского района. Ему 32 года. Он женат. Имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей. Он в основном покупает и продает национальные сундуки. Еще он сам изготавливает сундуки для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сундуков.
texts.en: Ikromjon K. lives in the Vahdat area. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He works in trade. He basically buys and sells traditional chests. Additionally, he builds chests for resale. He has been doing this work for five years. He is taking out a loan to buy more chests.

loans.use: to buy traditional chests

loans.name: Haik

texts.en: Haik M. lives with his wife and three children in Irind village. Together with his wife, Haik is engaged in agriculture – the family’s main source of income. In his free time Haik also works in construction. Haik has applied for this loan to purchase four young bulls. This addition will increase the family’s income and help them have a more sustainable life in the village.

loans.use: to purchase four young bulls

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald was born in 1974, and he is married and blessed with five children. For a living, he runs a hardware shop and rents out houses to earn a living.  He also works as a mechanic. He has been running his business since 2009 and has witnessed a lot of growth in the business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his hardware shop in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy paints, nails, brushes and add more rental houses.

loans.use: to buy paints, nails, brushes and add more rental houses.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Bless” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.
