The leader of this group is Adama S.. Adama S. is age 30; she was born in a place called Sanda, near Makeni city. But currently, she is residing in Makeni together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For eight years now, Adama has been selling firewood and palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil). With her share of this loan,  she will buy firewood and palm oil in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy firewood and palm oil in large quantity.

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru: Нажмиддин Хакими проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын находится в России. Сам Нажмиддин зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Najmiddin H. lives in J.Rumy. He is 43 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. His son is in Russia. Najmiddin makes a living by raising cattle. He is raising cattle for sale in the future. He has been doing this work for four years.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Janyl

texts.en:
Janyl J. is 51, widowed, and has three children.  She has been working as a doctor's assistant at the local hospital for the last thirty years and is known as a very open-hearted and responsible person. Unfortunately, salaries of medical personnel are low, so in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, she decided to start her land-cultivating and cattle-breeding business. 

She has been engaged in this business since 2000 and has managed to develop a farm with two horses, seventeen sheep, three goats and one milk cow. In 2007, she obtained her first loan of 10,000 KGS and successfully repaid it without any delays. 

Now Janyl has applied for a loan of 135,000 KGS to purchase calves and sheep. With the income, she plans to broaden her farm by purchasing a plot of land for constructing a barn for her cattle. 
  
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en: Voskehat A. lives with her husband and children in Shgharshik village. Voskehat works as a housekeeper in the local school. Her husband has left the home to find a job abroad, and now works hard and saves to help his family. The household’s main income comes from agriculture. Voskehat’s children help her. She has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle and to purchase chicken meal.

loans.use: to purchase chicken meal and more cattle

loans.name: Nurmahmat

texts.ru: Мустафакулов Нурмахмат проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Сын находится в России. Сам Нурмахмат занимается животноводством и растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Кроме того он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В этой области 13 лет. Кредит просит для закупа крупнорогатого и мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Nurmahmat M. lives in J. Rumy.  He is 56 years old, married, and has six children. His son is in Russia. Nurmahmat works in animal husbandry and agriculture.  At home he has a plot of land where he sows wheat and grows vegetables. He also raises cattle at home. He has been doing this for thirteen years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle and smaller livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle and smaller livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil and rice in large quantity.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 31 years old and single. She runs a greengrocer shop to earn her living. She has been engaged in the business for three years. She hopes to get capital to open a restaurant some day.

Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to get business loans which she has used to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Abasali

texts.en:
Abasali M. lives in the village Dzveli Kveshi, Kartli Region. He is 52 years old. Abasali is married and lives with his wife, 25-year-old son and 103-year-old mother. Abasali’s family is actively involved in agriculture. In particular, they own a plot of land, cultivate it and grow potatoes and maize. The harvested grain and potatoes are sold to local wholesalers. 

With the requested amount, Abasali plans to cultivate land and sow potatoes and maize. The profit will be used for Abasali’s son's aducation, as well as purchasing additional plots of land to expand the family business. Abasali hopes he will have a good harvest season and will be able to purchase home furniture as well, in addition to the above-mentioned.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation of the land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy women's dresses and shoes to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Содиков Мухаё проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. У него среднее образование. Он плотник. Изготавливает деревянные двери и окна. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки досок.
texts.en: Muhayo S. lives in  J. Ruмy. He is 48 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He has a secondary education. He is a carpenter. He makes wooden doors and windows. He has been doing this work for five years.  He is taking out a loan to buy wooden boards.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio C.  es un comerciante exclusivo de calzado; él  vive  en un barrio alegre y de gente trabajadora llamado Carrizal, con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de los cuales aun viven con ellos.
Se inició en el comercio hace 32 años, porque no encontraba oportunidades laborales en empresas grandes, fue así como  al principio vendió juguetes  en las navidades, luego  ropa y hoy en día comercializa ha seleccionado el calzado deportivo y colegial como producto único. Este es su primer credikiva aunque lleva 12 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante un periodo de 15 años, con los que ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y con ello sus utilidades y ofrecer un bienestar a su familia. Su sueño es hacer el segundo piso de sus vivienda para independizar su negocio y le quede un local con un confortable almacén especializado en calzado en todas las líneas, para seguir apoyando a su familia, mientras construye la forma de alcanzar sus sueños sigue trabajando fuertemente con  un margen de utilidad no menor del 50% y una liquidez de 3/1. Con su credikiva comprará calzado porque venderá al por mayor también mediante la distribución de este producto en diversos locales del centro de la ciudad e Barranquilla y en la ciudad heroica: Cartagena de Indias.
texts.en:
Dionisio C. is a salesman who solely sells footwear.  He lives in a cheerful neighborhood full of hard-working people called Carrizal.  Dionsio lives with his wife and has three children, two of whom still live with him.  He started his business 32 years ago because he couldn't find any job opportunities with a large company.  At first he sold toys at Christmas, then he sold clothes, and now he has chosen to sell only sports shoes and school shoes.

This is Dionisio's first Kiva loan, though he has obtained 12 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo over a period of 15 years.  These loans have helped him to increase his working capital and profits, and take care of his family's welfare.  Dionisio's dream is to add a second floor to his home so that he can separate his business from his home and have a comfortable store which specializes in all lines of footwear.  In this way he will be able to continue supporting his family.  While he works towards fulfiling his dreams, Dionsio continues working hard with a profit margin no lower than 50% and a liquidity ratio of 3:1.

Dionsio will use his Kiva loan to buy footwear because he will sell his products wholesale, distributing them to several places in Barranquilla city center and in the city of Cartagena de Indias: the 'heroic city'.

loans.use: to buy footwear wholesale

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
María Gloria R. G. es de origen campesino y desde pequeña aprendió los oficios propios del campo al lado de su madre. Actualmente y al lado de su esposo quien trabaja en una finca en el municipio de El Carmen de Víboral al oriente de Antioquia en Colombia y de sus 6 hijos, esta emprendedora mujer viendo las necesidades por las que atraviesan en algunas épocas donde las oportunidades laborales para su esposo son muy pocas, decidió aportar montando su propio galpón de pollo de engorde. 

María Gloria necesita de un préstamo para adecuar el galpón, comprar los pollos y el cuido para su engorde y así poder iniciar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su numerosa familia.
texts.en:
María Gloria R. G. has a farming background.  She learned how to farm alongside her mother when she was very young.  She currently lives with her husband, who works on a farm, and her 6 children, in the town of El Carmen de Víboral, in the west of Antioquia department, in Colombia.  This enterprising woman saw the hardships that her family was facing during certain periods of the year when work opportunities for her husband were scarce and so decided to support her husband by setting up her own chicken shed in which she will fatten chickens.

María Gloria needs a loan to fit out her shed and to buy chickens and feed with which to fatten them.  In this way, she will be able to start her business and improve her own quality of life and that of her large family.

loans.use: to fit out her chicken shed and to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 27 years old and single. She runs a salon to earn a living. Her business is only one year old and she has two employees. She has really benefited from the training offered by Faulu Kenya, and has learned how to keep business records, hence improving her business. Her future dream is to build rental apartments. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy hair chemicals and hair driers.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and hair driers

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi K. and his family live in the village of Dmanisi, Kartli Region. His wife is 55 years old, and she is a housewife. They have two sons, 25 and 26 years old, who are unemployed at the moment. Their 19-year-old daughter is a student. 

Agriculture has been the main source of the income for Givi’s family for about 20 years. They have four milk cows. They produce cheese, which is sold on local market. At the same time, the family owns 0.6 ha plot of land, where maize and haricot beans are grown. The harvested grain and vegetables are sold locally to retailers. 

The requested loan will be used for cultivation of the land, where maize and haricot beans will be sown. Givi hopes that after good cultivation, they will have a good harvest and it will be enough to pay tuition fees for his daughter, and also to purchase some furniture for the family.

loans.use: to pay for materials for cultivation of the land.

loans.name: Parsman

texts.en:
Parsman I. lives in the village of Chapala, Kartli Region, together with his family – his wife and 22-year-old son. This part of Georgia is known for its rich soil and consequently agriculture is well developed there. Agricultural family business is the main source of income for Parsman’s family. They own a 1.1 ha plot of the land, where potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and haricot beans are grown. The harvested vegetables are sold on the local market. 

With the requested amount Parsman plans to purchase seeds for the vegetables. After the hard work, the family will sell the vegetables at the harvest season. With the income, they plan to cover the cost of education for their son, and also renovate their house, purchase some furniture,  and put aside some fertilizers for the next season.

loans.use: to pay for vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carrots and black pepper.

loans.name: Tashpulat

texts.ru: Казиев Ташпулат проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Уже год как занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Tashpulat K. lives in J.Rumy.  His is 50 years old, married, and has two children.  He has a high school education.  He has been working in animal husbandry for a year.  He is raising his flock so he might later sell them. He is taking out a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive M. is 25 years old, married to a barber and has two children who are three years old and two months old. They have a barber shop which Olive has owned for the past three years. This business has enabled them to meet their family’s needs and develop themselves.

Olive is requesting a loan to buy a shaving machine and a battery to charge the shaver. With the profits she plans to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: To buying a shaving machine and a battery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair braids and weaves

loans.name: René De Jesús

texts.es:
La falta de oportunidades laborales para René de Jesús A. R. y sus dos hermanos, lo impulsaron a crear su propio negocio en la puerta de su casa. Después de pensar por varios días a qué se dedicaría, decidió explorar en una buena receta para elaborar arepas de queso que se caracterizaran por un buen sabor y así garantizar su venta. 

Es así como desde hace 3 años esta es la fuente de sustento para él y sus 3 hermanos quienes trabajan con él los fines de semana que es cuando se disparan sus ventas. Actualmente René necesita de un préstamo para comprar una nueva plancha para agrandar su capacidad de producción y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The lack of job opportunities for René de Jesús A. R. and his two brothers drove them to create their own business at the door to their house. After thinking for several days about what work he would do, he decided to explore a good recipe for making cheese arepas, which are characterized by their good flavor and would guarantee sales.

As a result, this has been his source of livelihood for three years and his three brothers work with him on weekends when sales soar. René currently needs a loan to purchase a new griddle to expand his production capacity and thus increase sales.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for grilling arepas

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Manuel José C. C., tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Manuel se dedica al trabajo de campo en la agricultura en especial al siembra de maíz para vender en grano seco.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es tener animales para vender.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en la tierra.
texts.en:
Manuel José C. C. is 58 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel in the Tangara area, which belongs to the Province of Bolívar.

The name of this communal bank is “Campesinos Unidos” and it is located in the Tangara area, 15 minutes from the Canton of San Miguel. The members of the communal bank work in farming and in business.

Manuel works in the field of agriculture, especially in planting corn to sell dried. He buys his products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same canton.

He is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and seeds. The loan will help his family business, as he will produce more and he needs to work to pay off the debt. His dream is to have animals to sell.

The challenges he faces are pests and diseases among his crops. He likes to play sports and work the land.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Ибрагимов Рачаб проживает в районе Кумсангир. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Он предоставляет услугу, на своей грузовой машине развозит продукты, овощи и другие тяжелые предметы людей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 5 лет. Кредит просит для ремонта грузовой машины.
texts.en: I. Rajab lives in Kumsangir.  He is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  He has a high school education.  He provides a service hauling foodstuffs, vegetables, and other heavy things in his truck for people.  He has been doing this for five years.  He is asking for a loan to repair his truck.

loans.use: to repair his truck

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar Eduardo M. G., tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos que son solteros, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar, tiene 8 hijos.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Cesar trabaja en la agricultura como fuentye de ingreso economico para la familia, siembra maiz y trigo y en pocas cantidades legumbres.Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es con el dinero que gane de la venta de la produccion ponerse un negocio.

Los desafíos la sequia afecta en gran magnitud a los cultivos. Le gusta criar cuyes y conejos.
texts.en:
Cesar Eduardo M. G. is 54 years old, married, and lives with his wife and single children in San Miguel in the Tangara area, which belongs to the Province of Bolívar. He has eight children.

The name of this communal bank is “Campesinos Unidos” and it is located in the Tangara area, 15 minutes from the Canton of San Miguel. The members of the communal bank work in farming and in business.

Cesar works in farming for a living, growing corn and wheat, as well as small amounts of vegetables. He buys his products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same canton.

He is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and seeds. The loan will help his family business, as he will produce more and he needs to work to pay off the debt. His dream is to set up a business with the money he earns from selling his crops.

The challenge he faces is drought, which affects his crops greatly. He likes raising guinea pigs and rabbits.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and seeds

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah N. K. is 31 years old, married and a mother of two. She runs a retail shop and has been in business for almost two years. With income from her business, she helps her husband with the household expenses. 

Penninah hopes to expand her business so that she can employ more people. She has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy sugar, milk and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk and maize flour

loans.name: Tomasa Leticia

texts.es:
Tomasa Leticia T. Y. tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive con los padres, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.Tiene un hijos pero no vive con el padre de su hijo.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Tomasa se dedica a la agricultura para poder comprar las cosas para la casa ella siembra maiz.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le salir a hacer deporte con mi hijo.
texts.en:
Tomasa Leticia T. Y. is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in San Miguel in the Tangara area, which belongs to the Province of Bolívar. She has a son but she does not live with his father.

The name of this communal bank is “Campesinos Unidos” and it is located in the Tangara area, 15 minutes from the Canton of San Miguel. The members of the communal bank work in farming and in business.

Tomasa works in farming, growing corn in order to be able to buy things for the house. She buys her products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same canton.

She is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and seeds. The loan will help her family business, as she will produce more and she needs to work to pay off the debt. Her dream is to have her own house.

The challenges she faces are pests and diseases among her crops. She likes to play sports with her son.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johana Elizabeth T. Y. , tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive con los padres no tiene hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Johana trabaja en la agricultura y tiene animales como cerdos siembra maiz para aumentar los igresos familiares.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes, semillas y comprar de cerdos, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es tener comprar una casa.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta bailar sobre todo en las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Johana Elizabeth T. Y. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents in San Miguel in the Tangara area, which belongs to the Province of Bolívar. She does not have any children.

The name of this communal bank is “Campesinos Unidos” and it is located in the Tangara area, 15 minutes from the Canton of San Miguel. The members of the communal bank work in farming and in business.

Johana works in farming and has animals such as pigs. She grows corn to increase her family’s income. She buys her products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same canton.

She is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers, seeds, and pigs. The loan will help her family business, as she will produce more and she needs to work to pay off the debt. Her dream is to buy a house.

The challenges she faces are pests and diseases among her crops. She likes to dance, especially during the carnival celebrations.

loans.use: to buy pigs, as well as seeds to plant

loans.name: Hortencia Del Socorro

texts.es: El señor Hortencia Del Socorro tiene 42 años, Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado anteriormente su familia se dedicaba a este tipo de actividad, pues ha sido muy beneficioso para el obtener un medio de ingreso para que su familia sobreviva. Hortencia tiene 27 años de tener este negocio, pues no ha sido fácil pues algunos compradores no quieren pagar el precio justo. Esta solicitando este préstamo con el objetivo de comprar más vacas, toros y terneros. Su sueño siempre ha sido incrementar su negocio y además mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Hortencia Del Socorro is 42 years old, and she works buying and selling livestock. Her family has worked in this business for a long time, and it has been a good way for them to make a living. Hortencia has had her business for 27 years, and it has not been easy, as some buyers do not want to pay a fair price. She is applying for this loan with the goal of buying more cows, bulls, and calves. Her dream has always been to grow her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls and calves

loans.name: Norma Narcisa

texts.es:
Norma Narcisa T. C., tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, vive con los 2 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Norma se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdo para tener dinero para la alimentacion de los hijos.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar balanceado para los animales, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es ampliar el negocio.

Los desafíos las enfermedades de los cerdos y la competencia. Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
34-year-old Norma Narcisa T. C. is married with two children, and she lives in Tangara, San Miguel Canton, Bolivar Province, Ecuador.

The credit window to which Norma belongs, Campesinos Unidos, is located in Tangara, 15 minutes from the San Miguel Canton. (Note: a canton in Ecuador is similar to a county in the USA.) The members of this credit window work in agriculture and trade. Norma raises animals such as pigs to be able to pay to feed her children. She buys her products in San Miguel, and sells them in the market of the same canton.

She is applying for this loan to buy feed for her animals; the credit will allow her to produce more in her family business and pay off the debt in a timely manner. Her dream is to grow her business.

Norma's biggest challenges are illnesses her pigs might catch and competition from other vendors. She likes to play sports and dance at festivals.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
DesD. hace algunos años, Luz María A. aprendió el oficio D. la confección, lo que le ha permitido en un espacio reducido D. su casa adecuar su máquina para dedicarse a esta labor y así aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues con lo que su esposo gana en su trabajo no les alcanzaba para mantener su numerosa familia conformada por 5 hijos. 

Luz María necesita D. un préstamo para comprar una máquina D. coser plana que le permitirá hacer otro tipo D. prendas y así incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Several years ago, Luz Maria A. learned to make clothing, which has allowed her to use the small space available in her home to work and cover household expenses. Her husband's income alone could not cover these costs for their large family, comprised of five children.

Luz Maria needs a loan to buy a flat sewing machine that will allow her to expand her work to other types of garments, increasing her income and improving quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a widow with six children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a "posho" (cornmeal) mill for the past four years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Anzazi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase diesel for running the "posho" milling machine. Anzazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase diesel to run the "posho" (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Luis Salomon

texts.es:
LUIS SALOMON G., tiene 52 años de edad, es divorciado, vive con los 3 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanilla se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y trigo por que son los productos que mas se venden.
Comprar sus productos, como semillas, en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es construir una chanchera grande y comprar cerditos para vender.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta festejar el carnaval con la familia.
texts.en:
Luis Salomon G. is 52 years old and divorced. He lives with his three children in Tangara, San Miguel Canton, Bolivar Province, Ecuador.

The credit window to which Luis belongs, Campesinos Unidos, is located in Tangara, about 15 minutes from the San Miguel Canton. (A canton in Ecuador is similar to a county in the USA.) The members of this credit window work in agriculture and trade.

Luis works in agriculture, planting corn and wheat, because these are the most commonly bought agricultural products. He buys his products, such as seeds, in San Miguel, and sells them in the market of the same canton.

He is applying for this loan to buy agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers and seeds. The credit will be supported by this family business, which will produce more as a result of the inputs and be able to pay back the debt promptly. His dream is to establish an operation to raise pigs for sale.

The biggest challenges that Luis faces are pests and sicknesses in his crops. He enjoys going to the carnival with his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make tortillas and pupusas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows, bulls, and calves.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco G. Q. de 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia con grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y tres hijos en el Barrio Concepción, Departamento de San Vicente. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado y ha procurado dar  todo lo que puede a su familia. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y dos de ellos ya le ayudan económicamente, ya que han logrado obtener un pequeño empleo. Don Juan  es un hombre humilde que toda su vida ha dependido de la agricultura. Se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y a la crianza de ganado bovino. Cada año tiene que invertir en insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos, semilla, etc. Para poder seguir cultivando los granos básicos que es  el sustento para el resto del año. Debido a esto se ha visto obligado de acudir a INTEGRAL para solicitar este crédito con la fe puesta en Dios que  va  a ser un año lleno de bendiciones para la siembra y por ende para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old and lives in his own house among his family group, composed of his wife and 3 children, in Barrio Concepcion, San Vicente department. All his life, Juan has worked and given all he could to his family. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to advance his children. Juan has been able to aid 2 of them economically and they have gained employment.

Juan is a humble man who has depended upon agriculture all his life.  He cultivates corn and beans and raises cattle. Each year he must invest in agricultural supples, such as fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, etc., to be able to continue cultivating basic grains, which provides his sustenance for the rest of the year. For this reason, Juan has been obliged to approach INTEGRAL to request this loan, with his faith placed in God that it will be a year filled with blessings for the harvest and ultimately, for him and his family.

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES TO CULTIVATE CORN AND BEANS, AND TO RAISE CATTLE

loans.name: Wilman Mariano

texts.es:
WILMAN MARIANOTENEMASA C., tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, vive con los abuelitos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Wilman se dedica al trabajo de campo en la agricultura en especial al siembra de maíz y trigo para vender en grano seco.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y seguir produciendo.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
WILMAN MARIANO TENEMASA C. is 25 years old and single. He lives with his grandparents in San Miguel in Tangara precinct, located in the Bolívar province.

This branch is called CAMPECINOS UNIDOS. It is located in Tangara precinct, 15 minutes from the San Miguel region. The members of this location work in agriculture and retail business.
 
Wilman works in agriculture. He farms maize and wheat and sells the dried grain. He purchases agricultural inputs in San Miguel and sells his products in the public market of the same region. 

The loan Wilman is requesting will be used to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. This loan will help his small business produce more, and Wilman will work hard to repay his debt. His dream is to buy land and continue expanding his farm. His greatest challenges are crop pests and diseases. In his free time, Wilman enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David B. O. O. is a member of Favour Self-Help group in Faulu Kenya where he operates a retail shop.  He has run his shop for three years. Being a member of the Self-Help group, he is able to save money and access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy maize flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soda.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soda

loans.name: Irene Maria

texts.es:
Irene Maria  nació en Barranquilla y a la edad D. 17 años se casó y se dedicó al hogar para lograr un buen cuidado D. sus 4 hijos, hoy en las edades D. 34 a 43 años y  13 años mas tarD., comenzó a trabajar en una empresa D. confecciones, a quien le debe su experiencia  emprendedora que inició 11 años después y que aun no se ha detenido. Ella comenzó su negocio D. modistería  en su propia casa, mientras su esposo   fabricaba  muebles D. madera, actividad que aun ejerce D. manera independiente.  Irene ha recibido 17 financiamientos D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 16 años D. estar vinculada a esta organización, con los que ha logrado formalizar su actividad, crecer y ampliar los ingresos D. su hogar porque adicionó venta D. cosméticos mediante guías especializadas; con su credikiva financiamiento #18 comprará telas, e insumos D. confección así como colonias y ropa interior, que se encuentra en descuento en la revista a través D. la que promociona su mercancía. 
Su sueño a largo plazo es conocer Alemania, país D. donD. es oriundo la familia D. su esposo, mientras a mediano plazo planea continuar trabajando, para  tener un almacén bien dotado D. la mercancía que mas se venD. en los alrededores D. su vivienda , porque su gran desafío es la competencia que responD. rápidamente los pedidos D. los clientes, pero enfatiza que sus  productos  son D. mejor calidad, que los que su s competidores ofrecen y por eso se sostiene en el mercado; ahora sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 5 días, sus inventarios cada 9 y su rentabilidad sobre las ventas no es menor D. un 30%.
texts.en:
Irene was born in Barranquilla and at the age of 17, she married and dedicated herself to the home to give good care to her 4 children, today 34 to 43 years old. Thirteen years later, she began to work in a clothing manufacturing enterprise, to which she owes her enterprising experience, which began 11 years later and which has not ended. Irene began a dressmaking business in her own home. Her husband continues to make wooden furniture, and does so independently.  

Irene has received 17 loans through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo during her 16 years of  association with this organization. Through those years, she has formalized her activity, and increased household income, and she has added sales of cosmetics by means of specialized guides. With this “credikiva” loan #18, she will buy cloth and sewing supplies, plus cologne and underwear, currently at a discount during a merchandise promotion.

Irene's long-range dream is to visit Germany, the country of her husband's family. At medium-range, she plans to continue working, in order to have a store well stocked with the merchandise that sells best in her neighborhood. Her great challenge is competition that responds rapidly to customer orders. But she emphasized that her products are of better quality than her competitors offer. For that reason, she holds onto her market. Now, her accounts must be paid every 5 days, her inventories sell each 9 days, and her profitability on sales is no less than 30%.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH AND SEWING SUPPLIES, PLUS COLOGNE AND UNDERWEAR,NOW AT A DISCOUNT

loans.name: Francely

texts.es:
Francely G. A. aprendió el arte de vender al lado de su hermano quien tenía un almacén y en el que ella trabajó durante algún tiempo y descubrió sus habilidades para vender. Fue entonces cuando motivada por generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir con el pago de los gastos de la familia como se decidió a darle vida a su propi negocio, un local en el que vende mercancía. 

Después de quedar embarazada y asumir su rol como madre soltera, esta emprendedora mujer se empeñó aún más en su negocio, por ello actualmente necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas y comprar mercancía con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Francely G. A. learned what it takes to run a business from her brother.  He used to own a store and she learned that she had a knack for selling when she worked for him there.  She decided to start her own business because she wanted to earn her own income and contribute to paying household expenses.  She found a space and started selling.

Francely is a single mother and she doubled her efforts to make a success of the business when she became pregnant.  She will use this loan to make improvements to her store and buy merchandise to stock it.  She wants to offer a wider range of products so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell scrap metal

loans.name: Jacoba Bacilia

texts.es: Jacoba Bacilia es una madre de familia de 46 años. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, ella busca la forma de salir adelante con su negocio,  tiene una gran variedad de clientes, pues este negocio lo inicio por su Papa ella es una persona muy tranquila y que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes. Se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez un crédito con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio para la compra llantas, repuestos herramientas entre otros. Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que la necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en: Jacoba Bacilia is a 46-year-old mother.  She works providing transportation service and she looks for a way to get ahead with her business.  She has a wide variety of customers and she started the business because of her father.  She is a very calm person and likes talking with her customers.  She is requesting her first loan in order to invest in her business, purchasing tires, spare parts, and tools, among other items.  She is very dedicated to her family and is always willing to help those in need.  The people who know her consider her to be a very calm and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy tires, spare parts, tools, and other items

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel O. S. is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. He sells green bananas to earn a living. Daniel has been in business for five years. He works hard so as to provide for his family.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Daniel has grown his business. He hopes to open another business in the future to earn more income. He has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to add to his stock of bananas.

loans.use: To add to his stock of bananas

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria’s family consists of her six children and husband, but just one of her children lives with her and their father. They are a big family with older and younger members, some of them bringing in income to the household and others attending school.

Maria is one of our businesswomen. Before she ran this business, she sold other sorts of products for twenty years. She now sells apparel and bedding. She will invest this loan in blouses, shirts, pants, belts and bedding to sell.

Maria's family goals are to finish building her house and save for the future. She will be using her profits toward this goal and to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, pants, belts and bedding to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit such as pineapple, banana, mango, watermelon, and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of products like baby clothing, decorations, paper, gift bags, and other items.

loans.name: Luz Mirella

texts.es:
Aunque Luz Mirella C. C. es de origen campesino y vive actualmente en una finca en el municipio de Rionegro en el Oriente de Antioquia Colombia, con la ilusión de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia decidió iniciar vendiendo algunos productos a sus conocidos, poco a poco le fueron pidiendo aún más productos y así a crecido un poco su negocio, aunque no tanto como sueña. 

Actualmente, Luz Mirella necesita de un préstamo para comprar más mercancía y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Even though Mirella C. C. grew up in a rural area of Colombia and still lives on a farm there, she wants to get ahead in the world.  She decided to start her own retail business so that she could increase her income and help improve her and her family's quality of life.  She's slowly adding new products to the other merchandise she sells and the business is growing, though not as fast as she'd like.

Luz Mirella will use this loan to buy more merchandise so that she can meet the demand from her customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to stock merchandise for retail business

loans.name: Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative Group A, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
Saturday B. is the leader of Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative A in Kyenjojo. He is 45 years old, married and has thirteen children, seven still in school. Some of his children work with him in his business.

Saturday deals in produce, which includes maize, beans, cassava and so on from Kigoyera. He has a well-stocked store, and his customers are mostly big grocery owners in the area. He also sells a local brew called “waragi,” which he makes himself. He started his produce business seven years ago and now makes 80,000 UGX weekly.

In the past Saturday had a retail shop where he accumulated capital that, in addition to his loan proceeds, he used to begin his produce business. He needs a new loan to be able to increase the stock in his produce store.

loans.use: To buy more produce to stock his store

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius I. C. is 51 years old and has four children.  He has been raising pigs for 10 years.  He works hard in his business so as to educate his children.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and he is now able to provide for his family.  He hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He is requesting a loan for 80,000 KES to buy cement for constructing his house.

loans.use: To purchase cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, eggs, coffee, and other items.

loans.name: Mery Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery; la socia tiene 46 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de imprenta ella realiza lo que son almanaques, tarjetas para todo tipo de compromisos como bautizos,matrimonios,fiesta de 15 años entre otros, la socia lleva años trabajando en este negocio el cual le llena de satisfacciones ya que mediante este su negocio ella saca a sus hijos adelante y esto es algo que la enorgullece, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en el negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de más mercadería como papeles, cartulinas entre otros para así poder trabajar mejor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Mery, 46, is a member of the SOL Y LUNA community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Mery is married and has 2 children.  She and her husband operate a printing business where she makes and sells cards for every kind of celebration from baptisms to weddings to quinceaneras.  She has earned her living from the business for years and is very happy with it because it has allowed her to give her children a leg up, something about which she is immensely proud.  She's a naturally happy woman with a strong drive to get ahead in the world.  

Sra. Mery is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies such as paper and printer cartridges.

Sra. Mery is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for printing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, chopped pork, beans, tomatoes and other ingredients needed to make pupusas

loans.name: Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative B - Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Peter K. is the leader of the Kigoyera Marketing Cooperative B group in Kyenjojo. He is 45 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are still in school. Peter deals in produce, which includes maize, beans, cassava and so on, from Kigoyera. He works with his wife. He has a well-stocked store and his customers are mostly big grocery owners. 

He is able to make 80,000 Ugandan shillings as weekly income from this business he started two years ago. Before, he had a livestock business from which he accumulated capital in addition to the loan to begin his produce-selling business. His dream is to educate all his children to university as well as to purchase a truck to help in his business. He needs a loan to be able to increase stock in his store.

loans.use: To increase stock of maize, beans and cassava flour in his store

loans.name: Tetepec Group

texts.es:
“Tetepec” que en lengua mixteca significa: “En el cerro de Piedras”, se compone de “tepetl”- cerro y “c”- en, un lugar muy hermoso de vegetación muy variante, este es un grupo solidario integrado por 9 personas, la mayoría de las personas de esta población se dedican a la ganadería.
Isidora López Hernández es la representante de este grupo una mujer muy trabajadora de 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Fidel Pérez López  quien se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 4 hijos de las respectivas edades: 14, 8, 5 y 1 de los cuales dos estudian.
Isidora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como son: jitomates, cebollas, chile, plátano, manzana, papa, mandarina, ajo, huevo, entre otros; es por ello que solicitó el préstamo para comprar más verduras y obtener mas ganancias, ya que últimamente las ventas están muy bajas y no le alcanza para surtir y hay ocasiones en que el dinero solo le alcanza para comer, ella tiene 10 años vendiendo estos productos en su casa.
Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Zoila Hernández de 54 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor Juan López que se dedica al campo, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 están casados y 1 falleció, tiene 4 niños pequeños bajo su manutención desde hace un año cuando falleció su hija la mama de los pequeños, ella trabaja mucho para poder darles alimento a estos pequeños, ella tiene que salir a vender varios tipos de artículos para el hogar y ropa de manera ambulante en diferentes poblaciones. Zoila trabaja muy duro para mantener a sus nietos a pesar de su edad es una mujer muy fuerte que trabaja desde hace mas de 30 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a otras actividades, ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas productos como son: bandejas, platos, vasos, cucharas, jabonera y cubetas y así tener un poco mas surtido y obtener un poco mas de ganancia ya que con el dinero que le da su esposo no le alcanza, como el se dedica a la cosecha pues solo obtienen dinero cuando ya existen frutos para vender y ahí ocasiones que solo da la cosecha  para que ellos puedan comer.
La señora Zoila esta muy agradecida con las personas que proporcionan ayuda a gente humilde como ellos, que les prestan dinero para seguir con su negocio.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Isidora López Hernández: De 34 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de verduras para la venta.
María X Pérez: De 30 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan para la venta.
Zoila Hernández X: De 54 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de plásticos y ropa para la venta.
Dorotea Martínez Nicolás: De 47 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de merceria para la venta.
Luisa Martínez Nicolás: De 49 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan y tamales para la venta.
Sara López Nicolás: De 32 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Patricia Lourdes Sánchez Díaz: De 32 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de joyas para la venta.
Lucina Flora López Pérez: De 41 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Julio Nicolás Nicolás: De 72 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de ganado para la venta.
texts.en:
“Tetepec” means “At the Hill of Rocks” in Mixteca.  It’s composed of “tepetl”- “hill” and “c” – at.  It is a very beautiful place with very varied flora.  This communal bank has 9 members; most of this area’s residents raise livestock.

Isidora López Hernández is the group representative.  She is a hard working, 34 year old woman, married to Fidel Pérez López who raises cattle.  She has four children who are 14, 8, 5 and 1 respectively; two of them go to school.

Isidora sells fruit and vegetables like: tomatoes, onions, chilies, bananas, apples, potatoes, mandarins, garlic, and eggs, among others.  This is why she requested a loan: to buy more vegetables and thus higher profits because lately sales have been very low and she does not earn enough to restock and sometimes there’s just money enough to eat.  She’s been selling these products at home for ten years.

Another group member is Mrs. Zoila Hernández , 54.  She is married to Mr. Juan López who is a farmer.  She has 5 children four of whom are married and one who passed away.  She has four little children dependent on  her since her daughter, their mother, died a year ago.  She works very hard to provide food for them.  She has to go out to sell all kinds of articles for the home and clothing door-to-door in different towns.  Zoila works very hard to support her grandchildren.  Despite her age, she’s a strong woman who has worked for over 30 years.  She used to be in other activities.  She asked for the loan to buy more products like: trays, plates, glasses, spoons, soap dishes and buckets to have a bit more stock and earn a bit more profit because the money her husband earns is insufficient.  Since he’s a farmer he only earns money when he harvests and sells his fruit and sometimes the harvest is just barely enough for them to feed themselves.  Zoila is very grateful to the people who provide help to humble people like them; that lend them money so that they can continue working.

The members of this group are:

Isidora López Hernández, 34, who is a vegetable merchant.

María X Pérez, 30, who will buy ingredients to bake bread to sell.

Zoila Hernández X, 54, who will buy plastic items and clothes to sell.

Dorotea Martínez Nicolás, 47, who will buy merchandise to sell.

Luisa Martínez Nicolás, 49, who will buy ingredients to make bread and tamales to sell.

Sara López Nicolás, 32, who will buy ingredients to make tamales to sell.

Patricia Lourdes Sánchez Díaz, 32, who will buy Jewelry to sell.

Lucina Flora López Pérez, 41, who will buy ingredients to make fast food snacks to sell.

Julio Nicolás Nicolás, 72, who will buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Angela Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, su gente es muy trabajadora, dedicada a sus familias y muy orgullosa de sus raíces.

Aquí conocimos  a la señora Angela, ella tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos  ya son mayores e independientes, sus tres hijos menores viven  con ella los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa donde vende carne, pollo, arroz, azúcar, detergentes entre otras muchas cosas de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00. Nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo y esto le ha permitido ganar algo de  dinero para el sustento de su familia y también se distrae con sus amigas que llegan hasta su local. Su mercadería la compra en Manta y Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos, carne, entre otros productos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y  le gusta por las facilidades que brinda tanto para conseguir los créditos como también para  pagar las cuotas.

 Su sueño es tener una gran despensa.
texts.en:
La Sequita Communal Bank meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the Canton of Montecristi in the Province of Manabí. Its people are very hardworking, dedicated to their families and very proud of their roots.

Here we met Angela, who is 42 years old and married. She has five children, two of which are adults and are independent. Her three younger children live with her and are in high school. Her husband works in building.

She has a small grocery store where she sells beef, chicken, rice, sugar, detergents, and other basic needs items. She works every day from 6am to 8pm. She tells us that her store is small, but she has everything and this has allowed her to earn money to support her family. She is also distracted by her friends that come to her store. She buys her merchandise in Manta and Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, cold cuts, meat, and other items. This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes the credit facilities as well as the payment terms.

Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergent, oil, meat, cold cuts, etc.

loans.name: Santa Catalina De Sillacancha Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Santa Catalina de Sillacancha” tiene 9 ciclos de funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 10 mujeres y 3 varones. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el salón comunal de la comunidad de Sillacancha (Calca, Cusco, Perú). La mayoría de los socios viven en la comunidad de Sillacancha. (La comunidad de Sillacancha está ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Calca y a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco). Sillacancha se caracteriza por tener paisajes hermosos, montañas y un clima templado. La mayoría de los pobladores de la comunidad de Sillacancha se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.        

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de verduras, venta de maíz, venta de comestibles y otros brindar servicios varios. 
 
La socia Teolifa nació en el departamento de Huánuco y tiene 48 años de edad. Actualmente, Teolifa vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la comunidad de Sillacancha. Su actividad económica principal de Teolifa es la venta de verduras y frutas, ella lleva sus productos a vender a diferentes mercados de la ciudades de Cusco, Calca y Urubamba, ella lleva sus verduras y frutas dos veces a la semana. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. En esta oportunidad Teolifa requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea comprar maíz. (Los socios que faltan en la foto no están porque pidieron permiso para no estar presente en la reunión).
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Catalina de Sillacancha” has been in operation for 9 cycles (each cycle is 4 months).  The communal bank is made up of 10 women and 3 men.  The communal bank meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Sillacancha's communal room (Calca, Cusco, Perú). The majority of the members live in the community of Sillacancha. (The community of Sillacancha is located 10 minutes from the city of Calca and 50 minutes from the city of Cusco). Sillacancha is known for its beautiful landscapes and mountains and for its temperate climate.  The majority of those who live in the community of Sillacancha make their livings in agriculture and ranching.        

The members are hard working and enterprising people.  They see every moment as an opportunity to get ahead, and with their daily effort, to give their children a better future.  The economic activities through which some of the members make their livings are: selling vegetables, selling corn or selling dry goods, and others offer various services. 
 
Teolifa is a memeber who was born in Huánuco Department.  She is 48 years old.  Currently, Teolifa lives with her husband and their three children in the community of Sillacancha. Teolifa's main business is selling vegetables and fruits.  She brings her products to different markets in the cities of Cusco, Calca and Urubamba to sell.  She brings her produce twice a week. She also earns a living raising small animals, like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  At this time Teolifa needs the loan, just like her friends from the communal bank, to increase her business's capital.  But she also wants to purchase corn.  (The members who do not appear in the photo requested permission to miss the meeting).

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Adrian; él tiene 53 años de edad y es viudo y tiene 4 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía como muñecas de tela,llamas,vicuñas entre otros mas el socio trabaja en este negocio ya un buen tiempo atrás, a la vez el socio trabaja como albañil en todo tipo de construcción que le solicitan ,el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia aunque sus hijos ya son mayores pero el igual sigue apoyándolos en lo que necesitan.

El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de artesanía.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Adrian belongs to the communal bank "Sol y Luna," located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Adrian is a 53 year-old widower who has 4 children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling handicrafts such as woven dolls, llamas, vicuñas, and other items.  Adrian has worked in this business for quite some time.  He also works as a bricklayer on all types of construction projects.  He is a person who is quite cheerful and has a strong desire to get ahead with his family.  Although his children are already grown, he continues to help them out when needed.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for his business selling handicrafts.

He is pleased to have this loan, and is committed to making all of his payments.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his business selling handicrafts

loans.name: Twelwaneku Development Group

texts.en: Betty G. is 43 years old and has four children.  She operates a beauty salon business at her home along Amber Court Road in Jinja. She has been running this business for 10 years. She took root in this business with paltry start-up capital of 50,000 shillings. At the threshold of her business, she had to come to grips with a lot of financial hardships but with her tenacity and determination, she was able to continue. Betty's salon earns a profit of 50,000 shillings a week. Betty will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics and other essential items for her salon and also use the remaining proceeds to pay fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and other essential beauty salon items

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Madame Marieme F. est une femme mariée de 26 ans. Elle habite  dans la localité de Yoff. Elle gère un fast  Food depuis un an. Auparavant elle était commerciale dans une entreprise de vente de thé. Elle a choisi son activité a cause de son aspect lucratif. Madame F. est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis janvier 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un réfrigérateur pour le besoin de son commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra  d’augmenter son fond de roulement et de mieux élargir son activité progressivement.
texts.en: Mrs. Marieme F. is a married woman, 26 years old. She lives in the township of Yoff. She manages a fast-food joint since a year ago. Before, she was a salesperson in a tea shop. She has chosen this business because of its profitability. Mrs. F. is a member of the Yoff branch since January 2011. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase a refrigerator for her business. The increase of her income will allow her to increase her working capital and to continue building up her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Los Quinuales Group

texts.es:
Yudit, 41 años D. edad, casada, 02 hijos en edad escolar; presidenta del grupo comunal: " Los Quinuales" del distrito 9 D. julio, provincia D. Concepciòn,  cuidad D. Huancayo - Perù.
Yudit es regidora D. su localidad en Concepciòn; ademàs D. ello, tiene una bodeguita y en el futuro desea abrir un locutorio (telèfonos pùblicos); pero aùn no llega la señal a ese lugar donD. ella vive.
Yudith y su esposo que es taxista trabajan mucho para poder sacar a su familia adelante y poder darles estudios universitarios a sus hijos.
El prèstamo otorgado serà para poder comprar mercaderia y surtir D. nuevos productos su bodeguita (tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad)
En la fotografìa Yudit esta vestida con chompa color beige, y esta sentada en el centro.
(*)Las fotografìas pequeñas pertenecen a:
- Foto pequeña D. la izquierda: ClotilD. F. P. (Se retiro temprano porque tenìa que retornar a su centro D. trabajo que es un vivero)
- Foto pequeña D. la derecha: Doris O. S. (Al igual que la Señora ClotilD., trabaja en un vivero)
- Jefferson L. O., socio que no se encuentra en la foto llego tarD. por motivos D. que se encontraba laborando y llego despùes que los demàs socios se habìan retirado.
texts.en:
Yudit is 41 years old and has 2 school-age children.  She is the president of the 'Los Quinuales' community bank which is located in 9 D. Julio district, in the city of Huancayo, in Concepción province, Peru.

Yudit is a councillor in her town in Concepción.  In addition, she owns a small grocery store and, in the future, she would like to open a 'locutorio' (an establishment that offers access to public telephones).  However, as of yet there is still no telephone signal in her town.  Yudit and her husband, who is a taxi driver, work hard so that they can get their family ahead in life and proviD. their children with a university education.

Yudit will use this loan to buy merchandise and stock her 'bodeguita' (a small store that sells essentials) with new products.  In the photo, Yudit is wearing a beige-colored sweater and is sitting in the center.

(*) The small photos belong to:
(on the left) ClotilD. F. P. who left early because she had to return to her workplace which is a fish hatchery.
(on the right) Doris O. Sanches who, like ClotilD., works in a fish hatchery.

Jefferson L. O. isn't in the photo because he arrived late due to the fact that he was working.  By the time he arrived all the other members had gone home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mario; él tiene 52 años de edad y es separado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio tiene un carrito el cual lo trabaja brindando el servicio de taxi el trabaja de lunes a domingo durante todo el día pero su horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener, el es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus hijos que ya son mayores pero igual el sigue apoyándolos en lo que necesitan.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para la compra de algunos accesorios que le faltan.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Mario, 52, is a member of the SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank that’s located in Cusco District which is in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

He is separated and has three children. He has a car that he uses to provide taxi services all day Monday through Sunday.  His schedule can vary according to the activities he might have.  He is quite a cheerful person with much drive to get ahead with his children who, though they are adults already, he still continues to support with whatever they need.

He is asking for the loan to service his car and to buy some accessories he needs.  He is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to service his car and buy some accessories he needs.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 45 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, esta casada con Efraín de 49 años de edad y tienen 03 hijos; juntos viven en su casa propia en la comunidad situado en el distrito de Santa Rosa. Con mucho esfuerzo Blanca y su esposo han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; ella es agricultora se dedica a cultivar plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca; que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas. Viene trabajando 21 años en la agricultura y es siempre ha demostrado responsabilidad y dedicación con su trabajo. Lo que más le gusta es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que depende de eso el ingreso de su economía; considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por cada producto. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos de cacao y café, por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará  semillas de cacao y café. Este su octavo crédito de con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro crédito con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en: Blanca is 45 years old and is a native of the District of San Miguel.  She is married to Efraín who is 49 and they have three children.  They live together in a house that they own in a community located in the District of Santa Rosa.  Through a great deal of effort, Blanca and her husband have been able to turn over their lands to make them very productive.  She is a farmer and works growing cacao plants, coffee and coca leaves, all of which support her income.  During the harvest, she has to hire laborers to quickly pick the fruits from the plants.  She has been working in agriculture for 21 years and has always proven to be responsible and dedicated to her work.  What she likes most is caring for her crops, as her income depends on this.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products from the farm to the city of San Francisco, where they pay her more for each product.  In the future, she wants to buy new land to increase her cacao and coffee crops which is why she will purchase cacao and coffee seeds with the loan requested.  This is her eighth loan with MFP and she knows that if she makes her payments on time, she will be able to obtain another loan more easily and without causing problems to her communal bank.  With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; la socia tiene 51 años de edad, separada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de pasamanería como  champús, Kolinos, detergentes, jaboncillos, ganchos para el cabello, ollas entre otras variedades de productos, la socia vende en el mercado El Molino II ella trabaja de lunes a domingo durante el día, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le agrada bastante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y así tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Justina belongs to the communal bank "Sol y Luna," located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Justina is 51 years old, separated, and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling consumer products such as: shampoo, toothpaste, detergent, bars of soap, hair accessories, sauce pans and other products.  She sells in the El Molina II market.  She works every day during the day.  She has spent years in this business, and she enjoys it a lot.

Justina requests a loan to purchase more merchandise for her business so that she can offer a greater variety of products for sale. 

She is pleased to have this loan, and pledges to comply with the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business so that she can offer a greater variety of products

loans.name: Serigne Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne Moustapha N. est un technicien supérieur en bâtiment  qui a fait beaucoup de stages  dans plusieurs entreprises de la place. Après l’obtention  de son diplôme de bac on lui a conseillé d’intégrer le secteur du génie civil. Par conséquent  il est beaucoup intéressé  par la supervision du travail des manœuvres. Monsieur N. est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis octobre 2008, mais n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 50 000frs prévu pour l’achat de quelques thioubs destinés à la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer  ses  conditions  de vie sociale.
texts.en: Mr. Serigne Moustapha N. is a high-level construction technician who has completed many internships in several local enterprises. After obtaining his high school diploma, he was advised to enter the sector of civil engineering. Consequently, he is highly interested in works management. Mr. N. has been a member of the Yoff branch since October 2008 but never obtained a loan with this micro-finance institution. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs for buying some thioubs (dyed cloth) for resale. His goal is to increase his revenues and to improve his situation in life.

loans.use: to buy thioub cloth

loans.name: Pumamarca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Pumamarca” tiene 9 ciclos D. funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 12  mujeres y 1 varón. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la capilla D. la comunidad D. Pumamarca (San Sebastián, Cusco, Perú). La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Pumamarca. (La comunidad D. Pumamarca está ubicado a 10 minutos D. la ciudad D. San Sebastián y a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco). Pumamarca se caracteriza por tener paisajes hermosos, montañas y un clima templado. La mayoría D. los pobladores D. la comunidad D. Pumamarca se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.        

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta D. verduras y venta D. animales menores.  
 
La socia Rosario nació en la comunidad D. Ayarmaca – Pumamarca y tiene 42 años D. edad. Actualmente, Rosario vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la comunidad D. Ayarmaca - Pumamarca. Su actividad económica principal D. Rosario es la venta D. verduras, ella lleva sus productos a vender a diferentes mercados D. los distritos D. la ciudad del Cusco. También Rosario se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. En esta oportunidad Rosario requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea comprar animales menores.
texts.en:
The “Pumamarca” communal bank has had nine financing cycles (each cycle lasts four months).  The bank’s members are 12 women and 1 man.  The bank’s meetings are monthly and take place in the Pumamarca community chapel (San Sebastián, Cusco, Perú).  Most of the members live in the community of Pumamarca.  (The community of Pumamarca is located 10 minutes from the city of San Sebastián and 30 minutes from the city of Cusco).  Pumamarca is noted for having beautiful scenery, mountains and a temperate climate.  Most of Pumamarca’s residents are farmers and raise livestock.

The members are hard working and enterprising; they  always seek ways to get ahead and through their daily efforts proviD. a better future for their children.  The economic activities some of the members are involved in are small farm animal sales and vegetables sales, for example.

Rosario, 42, was born in the community of Ayarmaca-Pumamarca.  She lives with her husband and three children in the community of Ayarmaca-Pumamarca.  Her main economic activity is vegetable sales.  She takes her products to sell in various markets in Cusco’s districts.  She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  On this occasion Rosario wants the loan, as do her fellow communal bank members, to increase the business’s capital so she wants to buy small farm animals.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 30 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, esta casada con Simeón de 33 años y tienen 03 hijos juntos viven en su propia  casa en la comunidad de Pampa Miraflores caseríos del distrito de Santa Rosa. Reyna y su pareja, cuentan con muchos proyectos en mente, razón por la cual hace 03 años invirtieron sus ahorros en venta de repuestos para todo tipo de vehiculo motorizado. En su negocio le va muy bien  y existe mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes  y trabajan de la mano junto con su esposo. Le gusta este negocio a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias esta en plena comunicación con las personas. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo económicamente y con el transcurso del tiempo abrir otra sucursal  en otros distritos. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de repuestos y lubricantes. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, el dinero solicitado le será de mucha utilidad. En su banco comunal es una socia participe. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará accesorios para la venta de repuesto que realiza.
texts.en: Reyna is 30 years old and is from the District of Santa Rosa.  She is married to Simeón who is 33 and they have three children together.  They live in their own house in the community of Pampa Miraflores, a rural area in the District of Santa Rosa.  Reyna and her husband have many projects in mind, which is why they invested their savings in selling spare parts for all types of motor vehicles three years ago.  Their business is doing very well and there is greater demand from their customers.  They work closely together.  She likes this business since in addition to making a good profit, she is able to interact with people.  Her plans are to continue growing financially and to open another branch in other districts over time.  The loan requested is to obtain spare parts and lubricants.  This is her eighth loan with MFP and the money requested will be very useful for her.  She is a participating member in her communal bank.  With the 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy accessories for her spare parts sales.

loans.use: to buy accessories for motor vehicles.

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 6 Group

texts.en:
Mirita leads this five-person loan group, El Buen futuro 6 (Good Future). She lives in a simple home with her long-term partner and their five children. Some of the children help the family earn a living, and Mirita devotes the earnings she makes by selling clothes to help her children grow up and lead rewarding lives. She has been in this business for four years, and opened her small company after getting some financial help from her partner.
