This group, which is typical of many in Haiti and the Dominican Republic, is located in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural areas where the economy depends on agriculture. People who live here lack reliable electricity and running water, none of which is potable. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, underwear, blouses and other items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; la socia tiene 32 años de edad, soltera; la socia termino la carrera de biología en la universidad nacional del Cusco y desea titularse lo más antes posible para poder buscar un buen trabajo, a la vez la socia vende ropa para damas y ella lo distribuye de manera independiente a sus amistades, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para poder titularse en la universidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Juana, 32, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District, belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She’s single.  She completed her career in Biology at the Cusco National University and wants to graduate as soon as possible so that she can look for a good job.  She also sells women’s clothes independently among her friends.  She is a very cheerful person with a strong drive to continue moving forward.

She is asking for a loan to pay graduation fees at the university.  She is happy for the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to pay her university graduation fees.

loans.name: Bukasa Kirabo Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: Joshua W. leads the Bukasa Kirabo loan group, all of whose members live in the town of Mukono. He is 33 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. For more than six years, he has made a living as a bricklayer, and also sells maize on the side. He buys his maize from nearby farmers, and became a bricklayer after taking to a friend who was already employed in this line of work. He is very hardworking and needs a loan to be able to buy firewood for making the bricks he uses and sells.

loans.use: To buy firewood to use in making bricks.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina de 44 años, natural de la ciudad de Huanta; esta casada con Sergio de 47 años de edad y tienen 05 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa. Ricardina, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Ella es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Santa Rosa. La bodega de Ricardina es la primera en abrirse, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que suceden en su ámbito circular, lleva 08 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa ampliar su bodega es por ello que viene construyendo su propio lote de terreno. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, siente que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy adulada por ser participe y colaboradora por el resto de los socios. Con los 3, 000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará víveres para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 44 years old and from the town of Huanta.  She is married to 47 year-old Sergio and has 5 children.  They live together in their own home, in Santa Rosa district.

Ricardina is a very industrious woman who works hard and tries do well even when faced with the adversities that fate places in her path.  Ricardina is a saleswoman who has a grocery store in Santa Rosa district market.  Her store is always the first to open.  She opens her doors at 6.00am, ready to receive her first customers.  Ricardina's customers know that her store offers a good variety of merchandise and they don't hesitate to buy from her since they can be certain that they will find the products they need.

What Ricardina most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers and thereby being aware of what is happening in the community around her.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her feet throughout the day.

Ricardina will use her loan to buy more food products for her business so that she can stock it with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to expand her store.  She has been building her own plot of land for this purpose.

This is Ricardina's eighth loan from MFP.  She feels that the loan will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She is very well liked by the other members of her community bank owing to her participation and contributions.  Ricardina will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy food products to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her business

loans.name: Segundo Fausto

texts.es:
Segundo Fausto Gabor C., tiene 70 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los 5 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Segundo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura a sembrar maiz trigo y cebada como fuente de ingresos desde hace muchos años.Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es comprar ganado.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta salir a ver los animales que tienen los vesinos.
texts.en:
Segundo Fausto Gabor C. is 70 years old and is married.  He lives with his wife and his 5 children in San Miguel, in Recinto Tangara, which is part of Bolivar province.  

He belongs to a rural communal bank called "Campecinos Unidos."  It is located in Recinto Tangara, which is 15 minutes from the canton of San Miguel.  The members of this communal bank are farmers and merchants.

Segundo has relied on his cultivations of corn, wheat and barley for a source of income for many years. He buys his products in San Miguel and he sells his products in the market in the canton of San Miguel.

He requests a loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.  This loan will support his family's business, since he will be able to produce more and will have to work to pay off the debt.  His dream is to buy livestock. 

The challenges that Segundo faces are the pests and diseases that affect his crops.  He enjoys going out to see his neighbor's animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sonata En Invierno Group

texts.es: Carla es una nueva integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Sonata en invierno” es conviviente y tiene 03 niños en casa por quien velar y educar. Las 07 integrantes D. su Alcancía Comunal la conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo, Carla  se dedica  a la venta D. Helados en forma ambulante en diversos clubes D. Chosica y también en forma D. pasajera en los ómnibus interprovinciales que atraviesan su comunidad. Carla junto con su esposo han logrado enfrentar la vida yendo D. un lado a otro incluso migraron a otro país vecino pero regresaron con ganas D. echar andar un propio negocio, pues con su esfuerzo han logrado comprar un auto para que su esposo labore como chofer. El sueño D. Carla es comprar un puesto D. venta para ofrecer prendas D. vestir y calzado y establecerse, el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. Helados para sus ventas en su mochila D. viaje. En la foto posan nuestras socias D. la alcancía comunal  Sonata en Invierno, luego D. su reunión D. desembolso en nuestras instalaciones, las menores son sus hijas.
texts.en: Carla is a new member of the communal bank "Sonata en Invierno."  She lives with a partner, and they have 3 children in the home to look after and educate.  The 7 members of her communal bank have known each other for a long time.  Carla travels from place to place selling ice cream.  She sells in some clubs in Chosica, and also on the interprovincial buses that pass through her community.  Carla and her husband have managed to cope with life going from one place to another, even migrating to a neighboring country.  But they came back wanting to start their own business, and through their efforts they managed to buy a car so that her husband could work as a driver.  Carla's dream is to buy a sales stand where she could sell clothing and shoes and establish herself.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of ice cream to sell from her travel bag.  In the photo, you see the members of the communal bank "Sonata en Invierno" after the meeting in our institution where they received their loan.  The little ones are their daughters.

loans.use: to buy ice cream

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
Desde hace 11 años, José Luis E. A. ha venido desarrollando diferentes fórmulas de cremas y aceites a base de hierbas naturales, con el paso del tiempo ha mejorado no sólo sus fórmulas sino también la presentación de producto, pues espera en el futuro ser una marca reconocida en el mercado. 

Actualmente, Luis necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos, empaques y etiquetas con el fin de realizar el trámite del registro sanitario, necesario para comercializar sus productos.
texts.en:
For the last 11 years, José Luis E. A. has been developing different formulas for creams and oils based on natural herbs.  As time’s gone by he’s improved not only his formulas but also the presentation of his products; he hopes to become a well-known market brand in the future.

Luis needs a loan to buy some ingredients, containers and labels in order to process his health permits which are needed in order to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, containers and labels.

loans.name: Angel Bolivar

texts.es:
ANGEL BOLIVAR S. V. , tiene 68 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con 4 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Angel se dedica al trabajo de campo en la agricultura en especial al siembra de maíz y trigo.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es mejorar la casa.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Ángel Bolívar S. V. is 68 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in Tangara, in San Miguel, in Bolívar province.

This community bank is called 'Campesinos Unidos' and is located in Tangara, 15 minutes from San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in agriculture and retail.

Ángel is a farmer who mainly grows corn and wheat.  He buys his supplies in San Miguel and sells his produce in San Miguel market.

Ángel is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.  This loan will help his family business to produce more and he will work hard to pay off his debt.  Ángel's dream is to improve his home.

The challenges that Ángel faces in his work are insect infestations and plant diseases.  He enjoys taking part in sports and dancing at local festivals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Genny Esperanza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, su gente es muy trabajadora, dedicada a sus familias y muy orgullosa de sus raíces.

La señora Genny  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque para obtener los créditos no les piden tantos requisitos. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 8, 6 y 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos, él tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres las cuales las realiza de forma ambulante en su triciclo por la ciudad de Manta. Trabaja tres días a la semana, muchas veces compra a las personas que cultivan por su localidad y también a los mayoristas en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres.

Su sueño es tener una casa más grande.
texts.en:
The La Sequita communal bank meets in Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province.  Its people are very hardworking, are dedicated to their families, and are very proud of their roots.

Genny is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because they do not ask for so many requirements in order to obtain the loans.  She is 34 years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children, 2, 6, and 8 years old.  The two older children are students at the school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife, and she takes out the loans in order to help her husband.  He has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which he sells by traveling around the city of Manta on his tricycle.  He works three days a week.  Many times he buys from people who farm in his town.  He also buys from the wholesalers in Manta.

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables.

Her dream is to have a larger house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor de 44 años de edad, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa es un hombre muy alegre y próspero, esta casado con Severina de 38 años de edad y tienen 05 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa. Víctor, trabajó desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por los cultivos lo llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 20 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando  plantas de café, cacao y plantaciones de barbasco; en total posee 06 hectáreas de terreno. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando a los frutos de sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para contratar jornaleros quienes le apoyarán en las extracciones de sus cultivos. Más adelante planea aumentar sus sembrios con plantas de barbasco ya que los inversionistas Coreanos por primera vez aperturaron un empresa de tratamiento y envasado con plantas de barbasco. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a los compañeros de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetado debido al orden que le impone al grupo. Con los tres mil soles, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo con las extracciones de café y barbasco.
texts.en:
Víctor is 44 years old and comes from Santa Rosa district.  He is a very cheerful and successful man who is married to 38 year-old Severina and has 5 children.  They live together in their own home.

Víctor worked on his parents' land from a very early age.  His passion for crops led him to acquire his own land which he has been working independently for 20 years.  He grows coffee, cacao and barbasco root (a native plant).  In total, he owns 6 hectares of land.  During harvest time, he is supported by laborers who help him to extract the fruit from each of his crops more quickly so that he can advance swiftly in his work.  Víctor feels very committed to his work because, thanks to his daily effort, he can see the fruits that his plants are producing and knows that he will make good profits on every kilogram of produce he sells.

Víctor tells us that he doesn't like the winter season because insects are prolific at that time of year and there is a lot of rain which hampers his production and damages the fruits on his plantations.  Víctor will use the loan he is requesting to hire laborers who will support him in harvesting his crops.  In the future, he plans to increase his barbasco plantings as, for the first time, Korean investors have opened a barbasco packing and processing company.

This is Víctor's eighth loan from MFP and he hopes to be able to repay it on time since he doesn't want to cause trouble for the other members of his community bank where he is a respected member as a result of the order that he brings to the group.  He will use his 3,000 Peruvian soles to hire laborers to help him in harvesting his coffee and barbasco root.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help him harvest his coffee and barbasco root

loans.name: Benemerito Group

texts.es: En Pueblo Nuevo de los Angeles se encuentra el grupo de Benemerito, cerca de la casa de doña Marybel esta una presa grandisima y la gente viene a pescar y tambien hay gente que todavia viene a lavar su ropa, es una comunidad indigena y por eso existen estas costumbres todavia, Doña Marybel se dedica a la engorda de reces, y solicitó su prestamo para comprar el alimento como zacate molido y engordar los toros, no cría reces solo las engorda para que en poco tiempo pueda venderlas, ya tiene un cliente que semana tras semana le compra una res, uno de los desafios que enfrento en mi negocio es que el zacate cada dia es mas caro y yo nesecito bastante para que mis reces engorden bien, pero yo ya no le puedo subir mas al precio de mi res para que me recupere porque si lo hago ya no me la compran, el prestamo va beneficiar mucho porque me voy apoyar para invertir en otra res y comprar el alimento lo que hago es darle vuelta al dinero para que salgan las ganancias, las metas que tengo es que con mi negocio pueda mejorar mi casa, arreglarla con las cosas que hacen falta y tambien para mis hijos, que tengo 4 estudiando, en total son 6 pero dos ya trabajan, tengo 21 años de casada, la casa es propia y mi esposo es comerciante, el incremento en las ganancias me ayuda porque quiero comprar una lap-top que nesecita mi hijo que va en la preparatoria y haga sus tareas. Los otros compañeros del grupo de Marybel son: Teresa(borregos), Crispina(tienda), Trinidad(tienda), Eva(pollos), Maria(pollos),Otilia(borregos), Yolanda(ganado), Violeta (tienda), Elena (borregos) y Maricela (plasticos).
texts.en:
The Benemerito group is located in Pueblo Nuevo de los Angeles.  Near Marybel's home there is a very large dam and people come there to fish.  Some still come there to wash their clothes.  This is an indigenous community and so these customs still survive.  Marybel's business is fattening cattle.  She requested her loan to buy ground feed to fatten her bulls.  She does not raise cattle but fattens them so that she can sell them a short while later.  She already has customers who buy a cow from her week after week.

"One of the challenges I have faced in my business is that feed is becoming more and more expensive and I need quite a lot so that my cattle put on a good amount of weight.  However, I can't increase the price of my cattle any further in order to make this money back because if I do they won't buy from me any more.  The loan will help me a lot because it will help me to invest in another cow and buy feed.  What I do is I use the money so that I can make profits from it.  My goals are to work in my business so that I can improve my home and fix it up with the things that it lacks.  I also want to provide for my four children who are studying (I have six children in total but two of them are already working).  I have been married for 21 years, I own my own home and my husband is a salesman.  The increase in profits will help me because I would like to buy a laptop that my son needs.  He is in high school and needs it for his work".

The other members of Marybel's group are: Teresa (who raises lambs), Crispina (who owns a store), Trinidad (who owns a store), Eva (who raises chickens), Maria (who raises chickens), Otilia (who raises lambs), Yolanda (who raises cattle), Violeta (who owns a store), Elena (who raises lambs) and Maricela (who sells plastic products).

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her cattle

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: La Señora Genoveva y su esposo el Sr. Roberto viven en la zona D. kupini que esta ubicada a 30 minutos del centro D. la ciudad D. la paz. Ellos tienen un taller D. confección D. calzados D. cholitas y trabajan D. esta forma desD. hace más D. 20 años. Sus hijos ya son mayores y son independientes, así que ahora destinan los ingresos D. su actividad en la construcción D. su casa. Las señoras D. pollera esta ciudad utilizan este tipo D. calzado el cual está compuesto principalmente por plástico y charol con suela y una planta D. goma.                                                                                                         El Sr. Roberto realiza los calzados y doña Genoveva los venD. en distintos lugares D. la ciudad e inclusive tienen clientes en la cuidad D. el alto,     Ellos trabajan con emprender desD. varios años atrás y durante todo este tiempo demostraron ser clientes muy responsables y puntuales con sus cuotas D. pago D. sus cuotas, con el dinero del crédito compraran materiales  para la confección D. sus calzados como plástico y pegamento que es la clefa, está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Genoveva and her husband Roberto live in Kupini which is located 30 minutes from La Paz city center.  They have a workshop where they make traditional women's footwear.  They have been in this business for more than 20 years.  Genoveva's children are already grown up and live independently so she now uses the income from her business to build her home.

The ladies in this city who wear traditional, regional skirts wear this kind of footwear which is maD. mainly from plastic and patent leather with a rubber sole.  Roberto makes the shoes and Genoveva sells them in different parts of the city.  They even have customers in the city of El Alto.  The couple have been working with Emprender for several years and during this time they have shown themselves to be very responsible clients who are punctual in making their loan repayments.  They will use their loan money to buy materials for making their shoes such as plastic and adhesive (clefa).  Genoveva is very grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy plastic, PVC and 'clefa' (an adhesive)

loans.name: Tricia Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tricia; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, soltera; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora el cual se encuentra ubicado al frente de la universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco, ella lleva años en este negocio el cual le gustaría más adelante poder agrandar su negocio es por ese motivo que ella trabaja con mucho empeño y alegría. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su fotocopiadora como papeles,tinta entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Tricia, 36, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

She alternates her daily chores with a photocopy service business located across the street from San Antonio Abad del Cusco National University.  She’s been in business for years and she’s like to expand the business later on.  Because of this she works with much dedication and joy.

She’s requesting a loan to get supplies, like paper, ink and others, for her photocopier.  She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to get supplies, like paper, ink and others, for her photocopier.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Verónica es una clienta antigua en emprender, ella trabajo con crédito en banca comunal durante 2 secuencias,  actualmente no esta en una banca comunal por lo que solicito un préstamo individual, debido al negocio que ella  realiza el cual es todo el año, ella se dedica a la artesanía en confección de de pelucas para danzas folklóricas, tal es como diablada, morenos, tobas ch'utas y otros este negocio le enseño su esposo, quien lo aprendio de su familia la señora realiza su comercialización con los artesanos de Oruro, Cochabamba y La Paz entregando las pelucas para las diferentes danzas en las diversas festividades que hay en nuestro país,  la señora es muy joven tiene un niño de 6 años quien esta en la escuela el sueño que como familia tienen es lograr un techo propio, ya que este negocio les ayudo a comprar dos  mini bus que esta afiliado a un sindicato y uno de ellos necesita arreglo de su motor para ello es que solicito el crédito , desean seguir trabajando para comprarse una casita o terreno, es una persona muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Verónica is a long-standing client of Emprender.  She was a member of a community bank for 2 loan cycles.  However, she is not currently a member of a community bank.  She is requesting an individual loan since her business is year-round.

Verónica is in the handicrafts business.  She makes wigs for folk dances such as diablada,  morenos, tobas ch'utas and others.  Her husband taught her this business and he, in turn, learned it from his family.  Verónica sells her products to craftspeople in Oruro, Cochabamba and La Paz.  She delivers the wigs for the different dances that form part of the various festivals which are held in our country.  Verónica is very young and has a 6 year-old child who is in school.  Their family dream is to achieve a home of their own. 

This business helped Verónica and her husband to buy two minibuses which are affiliated to a drivers' union and one of them needs its engine repairing.  It is for this purpose that Verónica is requesting her loan.  She would like to continue working so that she can buy a small house or a plot of land.  She is a very hard-working person and she is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle's engine
